href=\"/user/show/22313662-laz\">Laz</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810590\" href=\"/book/show/7955580-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">magic world lovers</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=tear-jerkers\">tear-jerkers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=classics\">classics</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=books-i-own\">books-i-own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22313662-laz?shelf=all-time-favorites\">all-time-favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer794900337\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4615143886416004804\"><b> <blockquote>U+201CWit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure.U+201D</blockquote> </b> <br /><br />Each time & every time I start an HP book I'm blown away by how much every book is different than the last one..<br /><br />From the very beginning of the book, just like Harry, I was mad at Dumbledore cause he really seemed to ignoring Harry, which as a fact he was, but then at last when Dumbledore told Harry the reasons why he had been acting so distant I couldn't help feeling sorry for Dumbledore and the fact that instead of stopping Harry from sho</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4615143886416004804\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <blockquote>U+201CWit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure.U+201D</blockquote>\n</b> <br /><br />Each time & every time I start an HP book I'm blown away by how much every book is different than the last one..<br /><br />From the very beginning of the book, just like Harry, I was mad at Dumbledore cause he really seemed to ignoring Harry, which as a fact he was, but then at last when Dumbledore told Harry the reasons why he had been acting so distant I couldn't help feeling sorry for Dumbledore and the fact that instead of stopping Harry from shouting at him or shattering his office he egged him to do so, I felt my stomach churn, I simply loved Dumbledore from that moment on that much more..<br /><br />This was huge, when I say huge, I mean huge. Every book gets bigger and bigger, this is unbelievably dark and so different than any other book. Reading the first book I never would have guessed how it all takes such a dark turn or that it'd come to this. This book is the epitome of plot twists.<br /><br />The tyranny of Dolores Umbridge. The hunt. The ministry. The fight. The tension between everything and everyone. The suspense was real, I felt it in my bones every time something would happen or someone would get hurt. Near-death experiences. Harry and Voldemort. <br /><br />The fight in the ministry between Voldemort and Dumbledore is one of the most amazing scenes I've ever read. It was breath-taking in all of its aspects. Whichever way you want to see this, it was incredible. <br /><br />I loved and hated the fact that our heroes are being through so much pain. Not just Harry, or Ron & Hermione. I'm talking about every one. Event those in the Order of the Phoenix and those in Dumbledore's Army (coolest names ever, right?). <br /><br />Mrs. Rowling makes a leap every time, she takes every book to an entire different level. <br /><br />Thanks for reading my review! </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4615143886416004804\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_478650441\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/478650441\" />\n    <a title=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder\"><img alt=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476896265p2/3048260.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/478650441?book_show_action=false\">Jun 04, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" class=\"user\" name=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" href=\"/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder\">Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=a-own-book-form\">a-own-book-form</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=sad\">sad</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=magic-powers\">magic-powers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=part-of-series\">part-of-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=witches\">witches</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=monsters\">monsters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=shapeshifters\">shapeshifters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=got-in-2014\">got-in-2014</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=s-king-recommends\">s-king-recommends</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=5-star\">5-star</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=movie-seen\">movie-seen</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=anthony-award\">anthony-award</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=cover-love\">cover-love</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=ttiv\">ttiv</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=buddy-or-group-read\">buddy-or-group-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer478650441\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7498973223448015449\"><b>U+201CIndifference and neglect often do much more damage than outright dislike.U+201D </b><br /><br />4.5<br /><br />This book may not be perfect, but it was inching its way toward that finish line. I enjoy comedic, childlike humor as much as the rest of the fans, but to me when the story gets a little darker (deeper), it gets even better. <br /><br />We get a return of favorite characters, but as with the other books, we also get new ones. While the rest of the series introduced new characters that were fun and that we actually wanted to read</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7498973223448015449\" style=\"display:none\"><b>U+201CIndifference and neglect often do much more damage than outright dislike.U+201D </b><br /><br />4.5<br /><br />This book may not be perfect, but it was inching its way toward that finish line. I enjoy comedic, childlike humor as much as the rest of the fans, but to me when the story gets a little darker (deeper), it gets even better. <br /><br />We get a return of favorite characters, but as with the other books, we also get new ones. While the rest of the series introduced new characters that were fun and that we actually wanted to read about, here it just seems like two main hate-filled creatures show up: Dolores Umbridge (shudder) and Bellatrix (who I can't stand.)<br /><br />Harry is now 15 and showing it through teenage angst and mood swings. Happily this didn't bother me because - let's face it - these are dark times in the young wizard's life and him being happy-go-lucky would just be unrealistic. Plus the teenager hormones were already tweaked anyway because of his friends, Dumbledore, and the wizarding community basically ignoring him for a summer. Then you have the Voldemort strange triangle in his head, probably fueling that anger. I noticed when watching the movie that they played up the potential possession while in the book it was hinted as a possibility, left for the reader to muse about themselves and see what happens.<br /><br />Hermione and Ron show considerable patience with their temper-triggered friend, becoming of all things, perfects in the school. It was an ironic touch for the series but would have worked just as well without it. Loony Luna is a delight because the girl is simply so strange, although the convenience of her character's connected to a newspaper owning father comes into play as well. There's Fred and George, who I always loved in the books but who seem lusterless in the movies - here they rocked with their unique style of misbehavior, especially when showing up a certain new villain.<br /><br />Where this book shines character-wise is Neville, who is so awesome as a friend suddenly and co-fighter. There's a teary situation in the hospital, and how he stands by Harry (stuffed nose and all) in a fight later was heart-winning. Dumbledore finally gets to show us why he has such an awesome, badass reputation in the wizarding world, and I couldn't be happier with the two scenes that showed him flexing the magic muscle.<br /><br /><b>U+201CYou know, Minister, I disagree with Dumbledore on many counts...but you cannot deny he's got style...U+201D </b><br /><br />Since Snape is a favorite of mine but only shows his face occasionally, it was a further delight that Harry had to learn Occlumency from the professor. The scenes were intense and, although a small subplot, mesmerized me. They showed a glimpse into the life of Harry's parents before he put them on a pedestal.<br /><br />Can we all agree that McGonagall is even more likable after this book? I didn't care about her the first few, but she keeps growing on me. Here she's amazing. <br /><br />Sirius...ah, Sirius. This book shows even further that he is dependent upon Harry because he misses James so much and sees the father in the son. There was a sad scene in the fire where he withdraws from Harry a bit because he's disappointed. He spends much of the book frustrated and lonely, which was realistic and deep but depressing. I love their relationship, both without families but connecting to each other due to that.<br /><br />Let's wave aside the villain of Voldemort for this book, shall we? He's there, he's bad, but he's not that frequent and he isn't the one who really irritated readers in this one. Those badges go to the annoying Umbridge we all loved to hate and the evil Bellatrix. Umbridge is around for the majority of book, raising shivers of annoyance. Besides her arrogant attitude that made me want to slap her, there's the beyond disturbing punishment with that blood quill and poor Harry. It certainly brought a twisted touch to the series that was almost missing before.<br /><br />I hate to see Harry tricked at the end, but you can't keep a series real and have the character be perfect in predictions every time. The book misses that perfect finish line because there are too many lucky coincidences that come in handy and save the characters throughout fight scenes, but they were still imaginative and adventurous. It's a large book, 870 pages, and if you stand back and examine it, not a lot of action actually happens. Still, it's so easy to get sucked in and so hard to look away. <br /><br />There's a heartbreaking, soul-slapping death that I don't think I'll get over. I knew it was coming, but couldn't remember the order from the movies when it would show up. Sadness! It was sudden and shocking and just awful. Harry's emotion afterwards was realistic and well done.<br /><br />J.K. Rowling continues this series with talent, and the books really do keep getting better and better. A timeless series that should continue to bewitch future generations.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7498973223448015449\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n    \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12105490999870200053\">Why does the biggest book in this series (I like big books and I cannot lie) have to have the most annoying character (Umbridge)? class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_601965872\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/601965872\" />\n    <a title=\"Mason\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/19798005-mason\"><img alt=\"Mason\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461423450p2/19798005.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/601965872?book_show_action=false\">Sep 30, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Mason\" class=\"user\" name=\"Mason\" href=\"/user/show/19798005-mason\">Mason</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19798005-mason?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer601965872\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12537956117294588251\">A week ago I would've told you this was my least favorite Harry Potter novel. A week ago I would've told you that Harry seems so bratty, and the story just isn't that interesting in this iteration. <br /><br />I want to travel in time to a week ago and slap myself.<br /><br />I haven't reread this book in years. Probably since I was in 8th grade (for those curious I just celebrated my 20th birthday). I was more than content to just watch the movie if I eve needed my OotP fix. Flash forward to last year, where I stopped</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12537956117294588251\" style=\"display:none\">A week ago I would've told you this was my least favorite Harry Potter novel. A week ago I would've told you that Harry seems so bratty, and the story just isn't that interesting in this iteration. <br /><br />I want to travel in time to a week ago and slap myself.<br /><br />I haven't reread this book in years. Probably since I was in 8th grade (for those curious I just celebrated my 20th birthday). I was more than content to just watch the movie if I eve needed my OotP fix. Flash forward to last year, where I stopped my HP reread because I knew OotP wasn't going to be as good. Then flash forward to last week when I was feeling slumpish after a few sub-par books and needed something to get my fix. Why not continue with the Harry Potter reread? Of course OotP was next, but even this novel is still good right?<br /><br />Wrong.<br /><br />It's phenomenal. <br /><br />Now that I'm an adult, I can truly appreciate the characterization of Harry Potter in this novel. Just two months ago he witnessed a man he called friend be brutally murdered by the man who betrayed his parents. Betrayed his parents to the man who killed them, and who would later that night, be resurrected. Harry isn't a brat in this novel. He's a 15 year old kid suffering from PTSD. He's a 15 year old kid who's been hoisted into these incredibly adult situations that no one his age should ever have to prepare for. He's a 15 year old kids who's spent years finding adults he believed he could trust wholeheartedly, and it seems at every turn he's being abandoned, ignored, or made out to be some attention seeking brat by his own government. <br /><br />This also happens to be the year that Harry comes to understand that Dumbledore isn't the 'perfect' man he's come to idolize. He has his flaws, he keeps things hidden from Harry that Harry needs to know, he even fully admits at the end to playing a part in the death of Sirius Black. An accidental part, but a part nonetheless. It's a hard lesson I think we all had to go through, but an important one. Dumbledore isn't perfect, no one is. <br /><br />It's sad. Brutally sad. <br /><br />And also as an adult, I can now fully understand everything going on in this novel. This novel confused me as a child, but now that I can read with a mature and somewhat fresh mind, I can understand everything that goes on here. From the workings of the Ministry, to the prophecy at the end. <br /><br />I'm not sure how I could ever consider this to be my least favorite of the Harry Potter novels. I've said in an update that I think I'd place this just behind Goblet of Fire, which is my favorite. But I really think that this novel may be my favorite now. For so long Goblet of Fire was the turning point for me. People actually died, Voldemort actually came back, the Death Eaters returned, and not even Hogwarts felt safe. But I actually think this is a greater turning point for the series.<br /><br />The death of Sirius Black, the reign of Dolores Umbridge, the O.W.L.s, the duel in the Ministry, the widely regarded return of the Dark Lord, and the realization that Dumbledore isn't the man we thought he was. It's all so sad, and so telling of what will come next. Unfortunately I've got a few more books to get through before I can return to the Wizarding World, but 'The Half-Blood Price' is high up on my 'to read soon' list!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12537956117294588251\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review601965872\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_854590662\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/854590662\" />\n    <a title=\"Vane J.\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/19590155-vane-j\"><img alt=\"Vane J.\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468102148p2/19590155.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/854590662?book_show_action=false\">Jan 29, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Vane J.\" class=\"user\" name=\"Vane J.\" href=\"/user/show/19590155-vane-j\">Vane J.</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=amazing-characters\">amazing-characters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=2012\">2012</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=ate-my-heart\">ate-my-heart</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=speshul-snowflake\">speshul-snowflake</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=all-the-feels\">all-the-feels</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer854590662\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17222522820700889718\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1454085929i/17916758._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Having known what was going to happen in this book didn't make it any easier for me. In fact, it was worse because you know you can't do anything, and you're actually expecting the bad things to happen.<br><br>But the thing is, the first time I read these books, I only <i>liked</i> them; I wasn't attached to neither the story nor the characters - I simply enjoyed them. All that changed with this reread, in which I found myself surprisingly immersed in them and I was a victim of what most book-lovers suffer: Ca</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17222522820700889718\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1454085929i/17916758._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Having known what was going to happen in this book didn't make it any easier for me. In fact, it was worse because you know you can't do anything, and you're actually expecting the bad things to happen.<br><br>But the thing is, the first time I read these books, I only <i>liked</i> them; I wasn't attached to neither the story nor the characters - I simply enjoyed them. All that changed with this reread, in which I found myself surprisingly immersed in them and I was a victim of what most book-lovers suffer: Caring about them.<br><br>Oh yes, Dumbledore is right: Pain makes me human. At least I can say that the fact that I feel hurt after finishing this book is a clear sign of a talented author, since it is so rare that I mourn book characters as if they were real.<br><br>So what makes this book better than the others? It's mainly the fantastic character development, and of course, the complexity of the storyline, which was now full with politics and many more dark moments.<br><br>The Boy Who Lived... He has grown a lot, hasn't he? And his sufferings have grown with him too. Now not only are his parents dead, but the one person he cared about the most is too.<br><br>Which brings me again as to why it was worse knowing it would happen. Because Sirius Black had been one of my favourite characters so far. In fact, it's probable that his death hurt more because I commited a great mistake called \"relating to the characters,\" or better said, \"finding yourself in parts of them.\"<br><br>Yeah, I related to Sirius. His personality is not similar to mine, but the feelings and experiences he underwent in his youth are. And again, there's the fact that he was Harry's last family. Oh no, there we go again...<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454085929ra/17916759.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Anyway, the last thing I can say is that at least everything in this series happens for a reason, and not because the author only wants some tears shed. Now I can only prepare myself for the many more depressing deaths (of the rest of my favourite characters *weeps*) that are coming.<br><br>Off to reread book 6, then!<br><br>P.S.: I didn't want this review to be ramblings about how sad this book is. I wanted to praise the characters, the writing, the world-building and also say why everything had to be this way, but... well, I decided to go on the... easier way, I guess.<br><br>P.P.S.: It's been more than 24 hours since I finished this, and I've already started book 6, but damn, it still hurts. I didn't remember to be this affected before.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17222522820700889718\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n quU+00E9 significa ser joven.</blockquote><br /><br />IncreU+00EDble como todo libro de Harry, entretenido y lleno de cosas que no conocU+00EDamos del mundo de Rowling, me encantU+00F3 como todos los pasados, sin embargo, creo que al libro le sobran muchU+00EDsimas pU+00E1ginas que no llevan a ningU+00FAn lado. id=\"reviewTextContainer683781405\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6885720154715310244\"><a class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>I finished this book and now IU+2019m sad AF. I seriously cried through so much of the last few hours of the audiobook. One of my favorite characters is gone, and I had to listen to Umbridge for hours and hours. Yeah. Sad AF. </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review683781405\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link683781405\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=683781405&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_683781405'><a id=\"like_count_review_683781405\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/683781405?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">103 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_683781405\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_683781405\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=103&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=683781405&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_683781405\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 683781405, true, &#39;&#39;); id=\"reviewTextContainer1780188651\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16574403720197471856\">I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS WAS AN 800 PAGE BOOK. class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_9065782\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/9065782\" />\n    <a title=\"Wile\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/147370-wile\"><img alt=\"Wile\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1272078319p2/147370.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/9065782?book_show_action=false\">Oct 19, 2011</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Wile\" class=\"user\" name=\"Wile\" href=\"/user/show/147370-wile\">Wile</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer9065782\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1201148491045822542\">I've been told this was the most difficult to read of the series and I found it to be true. Harry is full of teen angst and spends a lot of the book furious (and being quite infuriating) at the fact that nothing is happening, and that when things do happen, he's not allowed to be involved. Of course not being allowed do things should never stop a boy like Harry Potter from getting involved - except that amazingly it does. <br /><br />This book isnU+2019t really so much about Harry Potter, but about all the other</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1201148491045822542\" style=\"display:none\">I've been told this was the most difficult to read of the series and I found it to be true. Harry is full of teen angst and spends a lot of the book furious (and being quite infuriating) at the fact that nothing is happening, and that when things do happen, he's not allowed to be involved. Of course not being allowed do things should never stop a boy like Harry Potter from getting involved - except that amazingly it does. <br /><br />This book isnU+2019t really so much about Harry Potter, but about all the other characters and the events that are sweeping the wizarding world. Harry eventually gets caught up with fighting the new headmistress brought in due the great changes taking place outside Hogwarts, but heU+2019s more a witness caught up in events than an actor trying to sort them out. While the book lays a great deal of background information and sets up for the last two books, there isn't a strong central adventure story that makes this book stand alone. What results feels less like a story in the middle of a larger tale, and more like a closet where all of the information and loose ends that must be sorted to finish the series have been crammed in like so many bogarts. There is a reamU+2019s worth of scenes an editor could have blue penciled out to emphasize the story arc, with all essential events quite intact. Still the narration and dialog is often enjoyable and the actions that Harry does finally end up involving himself in become key in the end. <br /><br />LetU+2019s hope Harry is past his angst and ready for final battle. <br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1201148491045822542\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\"           <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=fantasy-scifi-paranormal\">fantasy-scifi-paranormal</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=these-are-not-tears\">these-are-not-tears</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=funny-funny-funny\">funny-funny-funny</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=childrens\">childrens</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=own-physical-copy\">own-physical-copy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=i-love-fairy-tales\">i-love-fairy-tales</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=series\">series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=cover-love\">cover-love</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=challenge-a-series-a-month-2015\">challenge-a-series-a-month-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=read-in-2015\">read-in-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1454534635\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14842820080209571546\">Noooooo. I am so sad right now! I had completely forgotten about a certain character's death. I was just not ready for it! :'(<br /><br />In general, this book made me feel such a wide range of emotions for its characters. I don't think I've ever hated someone as much as I have hated Dolores Umbridge, Snape certainly has more of my pity, James Potter lost some of his shine but he and Lily (L.E. <3) are still my favorite ship and I'm aching for their story, Harry was <i>so</i> moody but my heart just broke for h</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14842820080209571546\" style=\"display:none\">Noooooo. I am so sad right now! I had completely forgotten about a certain character's death. I was just not ready for it! :'(<br /><br />In general, this book made me feel such a wide range of emotions for its characters. I don't think I've ever hated someone as much as I have hated Dolores Umbridge, Snape certainly has more of my pity, James Potter lost some of his shine but he and Lily (L.E. <3) are still my favorite ship and I'm aching for their story, Harry was <i>so</i> moody but my heart just broke for him at the end of this... On another note, though, I absolutely loved Ginny! I can't wait to see more of her in the next two books. Though I know my heart is about to be shredded, <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> and <i>Deathly Hallows</i> are the books I've been looking forward to the most. Wish me luck...</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14842820080209571546\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1108867329\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1108867329\" />\n    <a title=\"Edward Lorn\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/8850418-edward-lorn\"><img alt=\"Edward Lorn\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478625849p2/8850418.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1108867329?book_show_action=false\">Nov 10, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Edward Lorn\" class=\"user\" name=\"Edward Lorn\" href=\"/user/show/8850418-edward-lorn\">Edward Lorn</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">did not like it</span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8850418-edward-lorn?shelf=paperbacks\">paperbacks</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8850418-edward-lorn?shelf=hardcover\">hardcover</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8850418-edward-lorn?shelf=audio-books\">audio-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8850418-edward-lorn?shelf=52-in-52-2015\">52-in-52-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1108867329\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6597361023830865393\">You know how this goes. I hate a book, and then I write a ranty review trashing said book. Well, friends and neighbors, I'm not up to the task this time. I so completely and utterly loathed this book that I can't even be bothered to be bring the snark. This novel is a time sink and I refuse to waste too much time reviewing it. I hate that I spent almost a month of my life reading it. In fact, I read <i>The Last Temptation of Christ</i> while reading this, and I actually wanted to read the Christ book m</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6597361023830865393\" style=\"display:none\">You know how this goes. I hate a book, and then I write a ranty review trashing said book. Well, friends and neighbors, I'm not up to the task this time. I so completely and utterly loathed this book that I can't even be bothered to be bring the snark. This novel is a time sink and I refuse to waste too much time reviewing it. I hate that I spent almost a month of my life reading it. In fact, I read <i>The Last Temptation of Christ</i> while reading this, and I actually wanted to read the Christ book more than I wanted to read about Potter. And I'm a fucking atheist. <br /><br />After the near-constant action of GOBLET, I expected more from this one. What I got was 800 pages of \"Let me tell you ALL THIS so I can set up the next two books\" and 70 pages of shit actually happening (the dementors at the beginning and the final fight). Somewhere in the middle of all this is this chick named Umbridge who is really good at being insufferable. You know she's going to get hers in the end because this is a Harry Potter book, so it's no surprise when she gets her comeuppance. At this point, I would have much rather seen her take over the school permanently and the students continuing their education in a fucking cave... or something else unpredictable. I was so ready for something different that I cheered when a main character died. I almost gave this an extra star because Rowling killed off this character, but I changed my mind. That one scene doesn't make up for the rest of this tedious attempt to fulfill her promise of a seven book series.<br /><br />In summation: If it wasn't for my goddamned OCD I would never have finished this. And yes, I plan to continue torturing myself by reading the next two books. Not because I have to know what happens, but because I have to finish. If you're obsessive compulsive, you'll understand. <br /><br /><b>Final Judgment: I'd rather read the Bible.</b></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6597361023830865393\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1108867329\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1108867329\" ref=\"like\" <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1646910311\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1646910311\" />\n    <a title=\"sweet jane\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/47263528-sweet-jane\"><img alt=\"sweet jane\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479606071p2/47263528.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt href=\"/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=messed-with-my-feelings\">messed-with-my-feelings</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=characters-i-love\">characters-i-love</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1221841416\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17792637887491925576\">I wasn't so enthusiastic about revisiting<i> The Order of The Phoenix.</i> <b>The waterU+2019s run deep</b> in this one and I admit (while dodging flying rotten tomatoes) that this is my least favourite Harry Potter book because SO MANY AWFUL STUFFS happened, and will continue to happen in the later booksU+2026<br /><br />This is the mark of a turning point for Harry and his friends. His innocent fascination of the wizarding world is clearly over and the situations heU+2019ll have to face now will be darker and full of losses.<br /><br />With each</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17792637887491925576\" style=\"display:none\">I wasn't so enthusiastic about revisiting<i> The Order of The Phoenix.</i> <b>The waterU+2019s run deep</b> in this one and I admit (while dodging flying rotten tomatoes) that this is my least favourite Harry Potter book because SO MANY AWFUL STUFFS happened, and will continue to happen in the later booksU+2026<br /><br />This is the mark of a turning point for Harry and his friends. His innocent fascination of the wizarding world is clearly over and the situations heU+2019ll have to face now will be darker and full of losses.<br /><br />With each reread I've come to dread many scenes especially<b> that one death that will always strike me as unfair and unjustified.</b> YES, IT STILL HURTS EVEN AFTER MANY REREADS. For one stupid, stupid moment I even dare to wish that the scene might somehow alter itself magically this time so that, that one death might never happened at all. <br /><br />Dolores UmbridgeU+2019s presence throughout the book soured the situations. Everytime she turned up, IU+2019ll find myself wishing for her death or her expulsion. Such a vile old bat, I swear. Hell, I don't know whether to hate her or to admire her sometimes.<br /><br />On the plus side, I notice that some of the side characters have stood up to a bit of their full heights here. Ginny WeasleyU+2019s become her own person, and a bit of Neville Longbottom's courage shone through. Also, LUNA LOVEGOOD. Seriously, I have got to give props to Rowling and her uncanny ability to weave up characters you'd root for or hate on.<br /><br />Enough rambles, I'm off to nurse my hurt feelings and start the 6th book.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17792637887491925576\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div        <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=magic\">magic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13870608-jo-the-book-sloth?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer474703501\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10590958260713097018\">So... I'm at my mother's house and there my old paperback edition of this book sits, taunting me, challenging me to read it for the hundredth time. How can I resist Harry??<br><br>This is my least favourite book in the series because Harry acts like a self-righteous jerk but it is still one of the best books I've ever read. And the end always makes me cry like a baby.<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1398869871i/9473954._SX540_.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473955.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473956.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473957.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473958.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473959.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473960.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473961.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img      \n\n<div id=\"review_72483045\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/72483045\" />\n    <a title=\"Mike (the Paladin)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin\"><img alt=\"Mike (the Paladin)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473374585p2/2187043.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt href=\"/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin\">Mike (the Paladin)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer72483045\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8720728857052452388\">Wonderful book...only complaint I ever heard was it was too short. Still the emotional toll of this book is heavier than the ones before and it is more a young "adult" book than a "youth" book. As I've pointed out before, the original "generation reading these books had more time to mature between the publishing date of each book. Now they can be bought all together. Harry goes through some amazingly tough times (and doesn't handle some of them too well). Read these books before you simply turn</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8720728857052452388\" style=\"display:none\">Wonderful book...only complaint I ever heard was it was too short. Still the emotional toll of this book is heavier than the ones before and it is more a young \"adult\" book than a \"youth\" book. As I've pointed out before, the original \"generation reading these books had more time to mature between the publishing date of each book. Now they can be bought all together. Harry goes through some amazingly tough times (and doesn't handle some of them too well). Read these books before you simply turn them over to your kids. You'll enjoy them and be able to decide if your children are ready for this volume.<br /><br /><br />This book is a somewhat emotionally draining book due to what Harry is going through. The body of the book, right up to the \"heavy\" climax will draw you in and hold you. Again we are moving into a darker side of Harry's world. <br /><br />Review to be expanded.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8720728857052452388\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\"      <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/794915817?book_show_action=false\">Jan 05, 2014</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Shelby *trains flying monkeys*\" class=\"user\" name=\"Shelby *trains flying monkeys*\" href=\"/user/show/1053760-shelby-trains-flying-monkeys\">Shelby *trains flying monkeys*</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1053760-shelby-trains-flying-monkeys?shelf=favorite-series\">favorite-series</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer794915817\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11517200249674861609\">I started these books thinking I some what liked Harry Potter's story. I mean I had watched the movies. How much love could you expect a 44 year old woman to give to a children's book? I never imagined how these books would cast a spell on my heart and mind. I have slowed down in my reading of them just because I know the end of them is near and I know I'm going to shed some tears. <br>You think if you've watched the movies you know these stories...not. These books are just completely and utterly ma</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11517200249674861609\" style=\"display:none\">I started these books thinking I some what liked Harry Potter's story. I mean I had watched the movies. How much love could you expect a 44 year old woman to give to a children's book? I never imagined how these books would cast a spell on my heart and mind. I have slowed down in my reading of them just because I know the end of them is near and I know I'm going to shed some tears. <br>You think if you've watched the movies you know these stories...not. These books are just completely and utterly magic. You can't represent them in film. It just can't be done. The movies were cute when I watched them sure, but nothing like the books. <br>This one started very slow and I thought Harry was a big whine ass. I kept reading. This book is written for children! How did I get so attached to it. These characters come to life-you see them as human. Neither bad nor good. Isn't that what we all are? Enjoy these pics while I go cry awhile. <br><a href=\"http://s926.photobucket.com/user/bookqueenshelby/media/umbridge1_zps76b30366.gif.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\">\n  <img      \n\n<div id=\"review_1673017792\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1673017792\" />\n    <a title=\"Laura\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/45700423-laura\"><img alt=\"Laura\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476670460p2/45700423.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1673017792?book_show_action=false\">Jun 29, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Laura\" class=\"user\" name=\"Laura\" href=\"/user/show/45700423-laura\">Laura</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1673017792\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8427548413966894843\">oh god! I have to say that i have been a harry potter fan for a long time (due to the movies) and just a month ago i decided to read the books since a friend of mine told me how amazing they were, even better than the movies. i was like: no way thats impossible, and man i was wrong. This books are absolutely amazing. The world J.K created is unbelievable fantastic.<br /><br />Now, HP and the order of Phoenix is currently one of the longest books I've ever read and not even a single minute i spent reading i</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8427548413966894843\" style=\"display:none\">oh god! I have to say that i have been a harry potter fan for a long time (due to the movies) and just a month ago i decided to read the books since a friend of mine told me how amazing they were, even better than the movies. i was like: no way thats impossible, and man i was wrong. This books are absolutely amazing. The world J.K created is unbelievable fantastic.<br /><br />Now, HP and the order of Phoenix is currently one of the longest books I've ever read and not even a single minute i spent reading i got bored. There was a lot of mystery, secrets, action and there are so many things that now I understand that i didn't understood in the movies. The last few chapters were so intense that it was literally impossible to stop reading. <br /><br />I'm really excited to continue reading the last two books but at the same time i do not want to finish this series at all. Harry Potter is and will be one of my favorite books series ever.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8427548413966894843\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1673017792\">\n  <td /><b>OFF-TOPIC REVIEW</b><br /><br />No, this review is not about the book. I have not read it, but I may read it in future.<br /><br />This is about a similar situation here on GR: I call it<br /><br /><i> <b>MANNY RAYNER AND THE ORDER OF THE HYDRA</b> </i><br /><br />The good Word Wizard, Manny, is on the warpath against the evil \"Am...\" - er, sorry - \"The corporate entity which shall not be named\". This incredibly evil being, compared to whom Lord Voldemort see</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14187083354705823911\" style=\"display:none\"><br />Below is the Off-topic review, seriously tongue in cheek.<br /><br />I have reviewed the series as a whole, <a href=\"http://nandakishorevarma.wordpress.com/2014/09/26/the-harry-potter-phenomenon/\" rel=\"nofollow\"> here</a>. <br /><br /><br /><b>OFF-TOPIC REVIEW</b><br /><br />No, this review is not about the book. I have not read it, but I may read it in future.<br /><br />This is about a similar situation here on GR: I call it<br /><br /><i>\n  <b>MANNY RAYNER AND THE ORDER OF THE HYDRA</b>\n</i><br /><br />The good Word Wizard, Manny, is on the warpath against the evil \"Am...\" - er, sorry - \"The corporate entity which shall not be named\". This incredibly evil being, compared to whom Lord Voldemort seems like a choirboy, has swallowed GR and is trying bring its evil kingdom into existence. Join Manny in his good fight! id='comments_for_review_1417011123' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_38425405\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/38425405\" />\n    <a title=\"Jason Koivu\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1742824-jason-koivu\"><img alt=\"Jason Koivu\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464843865p2/1742824.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/38425405?book_show_action=false\">Sep 22, 2014</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jason Koivu\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jason Koivu\" href=\"/user/show/1742824-jason-koivu\">Jason Koivu</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1742824-jason-koivu?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer38425405\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer3725604105037710768\">Why won't I let myself give this more than 3 stars?! I want to, I really do, but my cursor-moving finger won't budge! Let's investigate the whys!<br /><br /><b>Length</b> - This is the longest book in the series. I love the Harry Potter series, so I should want more of it, right? I don't know, sometimes a lot is too much. Rowling did her best to pack a lot into this one and it feels too bulgy. If this was carry-on luggage, TSA would make her check it for going over the size limit. <br /><br /><b>Dolores Umbridge</b> - What a great e</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3725604105037710768\" style=\"display:none\">Why won't I let myself give this more than 3 stars?! I want to, I really do, but my cursor-moving finger won't budge! Let's investigate the whys!<br /><br /><b>Length</b> - This is the longest book in the series. I love the Harry Potter series, so I should want more of it, right? I don't know, sometimes a lot is too much. Rowling did her best to pack a lot into this one and it feels too bulgy. If this was carry-on luggage, TSA would make her check it for going over the size limit. <br /><br /><b>Dolores Umbridge</b> - What a great evil character she is, isn't she? Quite the bitch. And the kicker is she's supposed to be on the good side! I like a well-crafted, dual-natured character as much as the next reader, but I do not like when characters are made to be so blind to what's going on that it's beyond belief. Umbridge's absolute unwillingness to believe in the return of Voldemort is trying to say the least. She's Hitler-esque at times. That's fine, a little over the top, but fine. But she cares sooo very much for the Ministry of Magic and Hogwarts, or at least in her position there, that one would expect her to do her due diligence in investigating any threat to her own power and interests.<br /><br /><b>Sirius Black</b> - Now, this one's on me. I LOVE Sirius Black and I <i>really</i> wanted to see the development of a strong bond between he and Harry. Since book three I'd been waiting for some Black/Potter tag team action. I wanted to see them hanging out, doing Uncle/Nephew kind of things. That's not quite how it played out. Oh well... It's nobody's fault but mine that I let this missing aspect get me down. Still, a book review is subjective and so I must admit a personal bias that affected my overall enjoyment.<br /><br /><b>Harry's Yellow Fever</b> - That's so racist! Okay, now that I've got that out of the way... I was disappointed when Harry's love affair with Cho Chang went south. I liked the relationship. It was complicated. It was difficult for him. It could have made for a fine romance. But no, Rowling had other ideas - very <i>British</i> ideas, like \"keeping it in the family\". Frankly, Harry's eventual attachment to Ginny Weasley felt too close. I mean, Harry and her feel almost like brother and sister. Plus she's a ginger. Eeeewww.<br /><br />I could give <i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i> four or even five stars and there are reasons I might drop it as low as two. So, let's give it a very strong three and be done with it!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"3725604105037710768\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review38425405\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link38425405\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=38425405&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_38425405'><a id=\"like_count_review_38425405\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/38425405?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">31 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_38425405\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_38425405\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=31&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=38425405&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_38425405\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 38425405, true, &#39;&#39;); I'm still furious about that... to this day. I'm still furious about that... to this day. You spend an entire book introducing one of the coolest characters in the entire series, and then you completely waste him.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7578954167091246577\" href=\"#\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/15094746-vilda\"><img alt=\"Vilda\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1438091034p2/15094746.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/468115822?book_show_action=false\">Aug 18, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Vilda\" class=\"user\" name=\"Vilda\" href=\"/user/show/15094746-vilda\">Vilda</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855690\" href=\"/book/show/22844196-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=re-read\">re-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=emotional-roller-coaster\">emotional-roller-coaster</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=highlighted-like-crazy\">highlighted-like-crazy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=the-favorites\">the-favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=buddy-read\">buddy-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=laugh-out-loud-moments\">laugh-out-loud-moments</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=didn-t-want-to-put-down\">didn-t-want-to-put-down</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=childrens\">childrens</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=huggles\">huggles</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=oh-the-heartache\">oh-the-heartache</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=favorite-series\">favorite-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=buddy-reads-with-nika\">buddy-reads-with-nika</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=wipes-tears\">wipes-tears</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=read-in-2016\">read-in-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=physical-copy\">physical-copy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer468115822\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16966665564642286262\"><blockquote> <i>\"'Four of them chased us into a dark room full of planets; it was a very odd place, some of the time we were just floating in the dark -'<br />'Harry, we saw Uranus up close!' said Ron, still giggling feebly. 'Get it, Harry? We saw Uranus - ha ha ha -'\"</i> </blockquote><br />As most of you probably know by now, Harry Potter is one of my all time favorite series and a definite childhood favorite. <b>Every time I've re-read these books, I've gotten to love them all over again</b>; finding new things I'd forgotten or details I migh</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16966665564642286262\" style=\"display:none\"><blockquote>\n  <i>\"'Four of them chased us into a dark room full of planets; it was a very odd place, some of the time we were just floating in the dark -'<br />'Harry, we saw Uranus up close!' said Ron, still giggling feebly. 'Get it, Harry? We saw Uranus - ha ha ha -'\"</i>\n</blockquote><br />As most of you probably know by now, Harry Potter is one of my all time favorite series and a definite childhood favorite. <b>Every time I've re-read these books, I've gotten to love them all over again</b>; finding new things I'd forgotten or details I might have previously missed.<br /><br />This book is huge and the longest one in the series, so there's no surprise that there was a lot of details that had slipped from my mind during these (almost) ten years since I last read them. <b>And I loved re-discovering these details once more, as if for the first time.</b> I've also realized, again, why I disliked this movie so very much in comparison; it lacks so very much from the book that it just doesn't do it justice.<br /><br />My heart is broken right now and I need a minute to just breathe before continuing on my Harry Potter journey. <b>I remember that this was one of the first books that made me truly cry (as in I-can-barely-see-the-pages cry) and I keep re-living the reason why every time I pick this one up.</b> A wonderful and heartbreaking book, this one. But so worth reading--just as the rest of the books.<br /><br /><blockquote>\n  <i>\"'He chose the boy he thought most likely to be a danger to him,' said Dumbledore. 'And notice this, Harry: he chose, not the pure-blood (which, according to his creed, is the only kind of wizard worth being or knowing) but the half-blood, like himself.'\"</i>\n</blockquote></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16966665564642286262\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review468115822\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link468115822\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=468115822&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_468115822'><a id=\"like_count_review_468115822\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/468115822?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">32 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_468115822\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_468115822\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=32&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=468115822&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_468115822\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 468115822, true, &#39;&#39;); <b>Stephen Fry:</b> Can we settle an important question?<br><br><b>JK Rowling:</b> Yes.<br><br><b>Stephen Fry:</b> How do you pronounce your last name?<br><br><b>JK Rowling:</b> It is Row-ling. As in rolling pin.<br><br><b>Stephen Fry:</b> So if any of you hear someone pronounce her name U+201CRohw-lingU+201D, you have my permission to hit them over the head with U+2014 not with Order of the Phoenix, that would be cruel. <i><b>Something smaller, like a fridge.</b></i> </blockquote></span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n storm of swords ;)</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Sep 21, 2016 09:35AM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_157699830\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Ghadeer Saad\" href=\"/user/show/49478588-ghadeer-saad\"><img \n\n<div id=\"review_26033375\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/26033375\" />\n    <a title=\"Jessika\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1166992-jessika\"><img alt=\"Jessika\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445122165p2/1166992.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/26033375?book_show_action=false\">Nov 28, 2009</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jessika\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jessika\" href=\"/user/show/1166992-jessika\">Jessika</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=fiction\">fiction</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=series\">series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer26033375\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10075051843831155485\">I cried like a little baby. J.K. Rowling really starts taking the series down a darker road in this book. She is so talented at character development, and it really shines in this book. Here, Harry is 15 years old, and for most of the book, he's whiny and self-centered, just like a typical teenager. I also adore Dumbledore's role in this book--his conversation at the end with Harry put me to tears. Rowling did an amazing job with the character of Umbridge...never have I hated a fictional</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10075051843831155485\" style=\"display:none\">I cried like a little baby. J.K. Rowling really starts taking the series down a darker road in this book. She is so talented at character development, and it really shines in this book. Here, Harry is 15 years old, and for most of the book, he's whiny and self-centered, just like a typical teenager. I also adore Dumbledore's role in this book--his conversation at the end with Harry put me to tears. Rowling did an amazing job with the character of Umbridge...never have I hated a fictional character more than I hated her. I do have to admit, I'm curious to see whether she makes any more appearances or not. For me, this book was stronger for character development than plot. Yes, this is a key book for the series, but I felt like most of the book was spent with characters' internal issues and development rather than the plot. I love how Harry and the crew are dealing with more adult issues now, such as relationships and death. As with all of her books, I have a really difficult time putting these books down, but especially within the last 100 pages, I physically could not separate the book from my hands. Overall, another outstanding addition from J.K. Rowling. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10075051843831155485\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div  \t<a alt=\"Maheen Waqar\" href=\"/user/show/47798252-maheen-waqar\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444514576p1/47798252.jpg\" alt=\"47798252\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div repeated</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Oct 10, 2015 03:49PM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n\n
