elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_559980598\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/559980598\" />\n    <a title=\"Navessa\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/18104163-navessa\"><img alt=\"Navessa\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444162983p2/18104163.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/559980598?book_show_action=false\">Mar 19, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Navessa\" class=\"user\" name=\"Navessa\" href=\"/user/show/18104163-navessa\">Navessa</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer559980598\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10101339183625050760\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1388953377i/7962354.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Seriously, don't read this review if you haven't read the books. <br><br>The biggest compliment I can think to give an 870 page book is that I wish it had been longer. I wish this had been longer. <br><br>This book has always been my favorite in the series. Up until it, HarryU+2019s story had been filled with light. Sure, there were some tough parts earlier on, and while it's true that some darkness crept into the ending of the previous installment, for the most part, that was a pretty happy book compared to this. R</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10101339183625050760\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1388953377i/7962354.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Seriously, don't read this review if you haven't read the books. <br><br>The biggest compliment I can think to give an 870 page book is that I wish it had been longer. I wish this had been longer. <br><br>This book has always been my favorite in the series. Up until it, HarryU+2019s story had been filled with light. Sure, there were some tough parts earlier on, and while it's true that some darkness crept into the ending of the previous installment, for the most part, that was a pretty happy book compared to this. Ron got over his jealousy, the school eventually got behind Harry as a Champion, and good still triumphed over evil. Our hero surmounted impossible odds in the Triwizard Tournament and then managed to escape Voldemort, yet again, and warn the wizarding world of his return. <br><br>And then <b>BAM!</b><br><br>The beginning of this book hits you in the face. Where you expect Harry to be in the know, heU+2019s in the dark, where you expect The Daily Prophet to be filled with stories about the ministry pursuing Voldemort, thereU+2019s only silence, where you expect excitement about returning to Hogwarts there is only frustration and angst. And you know what? You get it, you frigging get it, man. <br><br>Because you were with Harry when he faced Voldemort and his Death Eaters alone, you stood beside him as the shades of his parents appeared from the tip of his enemyU+2019s wand and helped save his life. And when he made it back to safety, you were just as dumbfounded as he was when the minister of magic refused to believe him, refused to believe Dumbledore. <br><br>So how dare they? How dare they let him rot, alone, in a house full of people who hate and ridicule him, while the murderer of his parents begins to rebuild his army? How dare they feed him snippets like U+201CWe canU+2019t tell you anything about what weU+2019ve been doing, and weU+2019ve been doing A LOT. But donU+2019t worry, weU+2019ll see you soon, we just canU+2019t tell you whenU+201D? As if he hasnU+2019t been through enough. If anyone has the right to know whatU+2019s going on, itU+2019s Harry. DoesnU+2019t anyone KNOW him like we do? Or do they just think that they know whatU+2019s best for him better than he does? <br><br>And thatU+2019s part of the genius of this installment. This book grows up. Where the previous four could be labeled as childrenU+2019s stories, this one cannot. There are so many hard lessons and difficult themes in this, ones that a childU+2019s mind cannot fully grasp. Gone are the heroes, gone are the happy endings. This book teaches you that adults arenU+2019t the perfect protectors you thought they were. Sirius isnU+2019t infallible. James Potter isnU+2019t infallible. Albus frigging Dumbledore isnU+2019t infallible. None of them are. None of them are even fully good. And come to find out, those you thought were fully evil might not be either. This book introduces you to shades of grey, and each revelation seems to hit you harder than the last. <br><br>Normally, I hate angst. This is mostly because I find the vast majority of what I see these days to be a sorry excuse to lengthen a story or a shoddy attempt to distract a reader from glaring issues. Trying to cover up weak characterization? Add some angst! Want to hide those holes in your plot? Add some angst! <br><br>The only type of angst I can stand is believable angst. Rowling delivers on this. And thatU+2019s one of the many reasons that I love this book. There are a lot of other reasons, Fred and GeorgeU+2019s badassery, Ginny Weasley finding her voice and becoming a character in her own right, the undiluted rage that coursed through my body every time I read a scene that included Delores Umbridge, the incredible courage and honesty of Hermione Granger, the loyalty of Ron Weasley, Neville Longbottom coming into his own, the failed Occlumency lessons (I WILL ALWAYS HATE SNAPE) and the way the entire school ended up doing exactly what the sorting hat suggested at the beginning of the year and banded together as one against the ministryU+2019s interference. <br><br>I even loved the ending. YES, I SAID IT! And do you know why? Because life isnU+2019t sunshine and roses and you donU+2019t always get to say goodbye to those you love. You donU+2019t get the sense that SiriusU+2019s death was a righteous one. You donU+2019t get resolution. He didnU+2019t make some grand sacrifice to save the lives of many others. He died taunting the bad guys, smiling at them, egging them on as though he was still that ego-inflated teenager you glimpsed through the pensieve. And then you find out that it was all for nothing. That there were so many ways that it could have been avoided. How do you deal with that? The best you can, I guess. <br><br>So while I donU+2019t necessarily \"enjoy\" this book as much as I do the others, it remains my favorite in the series for the reasons I listed above.<br><br><b>This review can also be found on <a href=\"http://thebookeaters.net/2014/01/05/review-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Book Eaters</a>.</b><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10101339183625050760\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review559980598\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/58560179-ashley-musick\">Ashley Musick</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15245876534674202996\">send a friend request and follow ok</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Aug 11, 2016 06:29PM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_108852928\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/108852928\" />\n    <a title=\"Raeleen Lemay\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay\"><img alt=\"Raeleen Lemay\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475215415p2/3452652.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/108852928?book_show_action=false\">Dec 14, 2014</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Raeleen Lemay\" class=\"user\" name=\"Raeleen Lemay\" href=\"/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay\">Raeleen Lemay</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747561071\" href=\"/book/show/862631.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=own\">own</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer108852928\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1672230463075210886\"><i>Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You</i><br /><br />ok. I will start by saying that this is one of my least favorite books in the series, and that isn't because it's bad, BECAUSE IT IS DEFINITELY NOT. It's mainly due to the fact that I hate Umbridge more than words can translate, and having to read about her so much just infuriates me, rather than giving me warm fuzzies the entire time I'm reading.<br /><br />That being said, here are some of my thoughts on the book:<br /><br />-mention of Regulus Black near the beginni</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1672230463075210886\" style=\"display:none\"><i>Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas To You</i><br /><br />ok. I will start by saying that this is one of my least favorite books in the series, and that isn't because it's bad, BECAUSE IT IS DEFINITELY NOT. It's mainly due to the fact that I hate Umbridge more than words can translate, and having to read about her so much just infuriates me, rather than giving me warm fuzzies the entire time I'm reading.<br /><br />That being said, here are some of my thoughts on the book:<br /><br />-mention of Regulus Black near the beginning of this book. I've noticed particularly during this re-read that J.K. Rowling tends to mention characters a book or two before they will have any importance to the story. She <i>seriously</i> knew what she was doing while writing these books.<br /><br />-it's so weird to think that Sirius is related to Narcissa and Bellatrix! Sirius is such an amazing human, and he was born into a terrible family, which is pretty true of a lot of people. Just because you come from something/somewhere terrible, that doesn't mean you can't be different and be good.<br /><br />-Ron and Hermione becoming prefects is just so great. Surely there would be a better candidate in their year to be the male prefect, yet Dumbledore chose Ron. Why? Because Dumbledore knows that Ron always feels worthless in comparison to his five older brothers, and him becoming prefect was enough to make him feel like a winner at something. Dumbledore is cool like that.<br /><br />-Quite often I forget that St. Mungo's exists since it's not in the movies at all. Here, we get to see Neville's parents, as well as Gilderoy Lockhart (who is adorable now and not at all annoying), and I WISH THAT WAS IN THE MOVIES.<br /><br />-it sucks that Harry was banned from playing Quidditch this year, as I LOVE Quidditch. and Harry was so sad because of it, which made him cranky and quite insane. HOWEVER, I love that Ginny took over for him as Seeker. I feel like Ginny has grown up so much already, and it's particularly in this book that I grew to really like her. She's so much better in the books than in the movies.<br /><br />-In the epic fight near the end of the book, NEVILLE IS SO BADASS. If you ever think that Neville isn't brave until the last book, you are wrong. He was throwing himself at Death Eaters and Stunning the shit out of everybody. It was awesome.<br /><br />-As usual, lots of information was revealed in the last couple of chapters of the book. This particular book reveals A LOT of stuff that most people were probably wondering about whilst reading the other four books, as well as information that you probably didn't even think of. I love how many answers we get in this one.<br /><br /><br />I THINK THAT'S IT FOR NOW. I have a lot of feelings, so I might add more later.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1672230463075210886\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review108852928\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div  <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/10380469-nour-sharif?shelf=english\">english</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer353311537\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16705413281977824887\"><b> Edit #3: 27/3/2015 </b> <br />I am still getting positive feedback over this and every time I read what you guys and girls have told me, my heart swells. <br />Gosh, I am so proud of this review. <br /><br /><b> Edit #2: 25\\7\U+2014<br />So I came across this article today, and for some reason, it made me happy!! I feel evil *evil laugh* <br /><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://mea-news.net/en/index.php/2014-04-12-10-49-53/world-news/81-economy/795-amazon-s-heavy-investing-eats-into-bottom-line-shares-drop\" rel=\"nofollow\">http://mea-news.net/en/index.php/2014...</a><br /></b> <br />Edit #1: 8\\3\U+2014<br />It has been four months that I posted this review. And so far I have received great feedback. Thank you everyone for yo#ur support ^^ <br />Rememb</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16705413281977824887\" style=\"display:none\"><b> Edit #3: 27/3/2015 </b> <br />I am still getting positive feedback over this and every time I read what you guys and girls have told me, my heart swells. <br />Gosh, I am so proud of this review. <br /><br /><b> Edit #2: 25\\7\U+2014<br />So I came across this article today, and for some reason, it made me happy!! I feel evil *evil laugh* <br /><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://mea-news.net/en/index.php/2014-04-12-10-49-53/world-news/81-economy/795-amazon-s-heavy-investing-eats-into-bottom-line-shares-drop\" rel=\"nofollow\">http://mea-news.net/en/index.php/2014...</a><br /></b> <br />Edit #1: 8\\3\U+2014<br />It has been four months that I posted this review. And so far I have received great feedback. Thank you everyone for yo#ur support ^^ <br />Remember, this is not a benign cause. <br /><br />6/11/2013<br />I know that I have neglected the subject of the new Goodreads policy a lot recently, and I ought not to have done that. You see, I wasnU+2019t very free recently, and well because I didnU+2019t know what to either say or on what book should I post it. <br />And then I read this book, and the rebelliousness in this book made me think that hey, this book is perfect for what I have in mind. Oh, and guess what! I am going to be aggressive. <br /><br />Let me tell you something maybe a lot of you people are not aware of. We, people who live in the Middle East, look up towards the west, where presumably, everyone is free to say and do whatever they want, bounded by no tradition or religious law whatsoever. But when this kind of law is forced upon everyone from the west itself, we lose hope. We lose hope that anything will be good again. And well for someone (me), who has suffered a lot because of that (Facebook only made my freedom of speech more restricted), I found a haven for myself in Goodreads, where apparently no one gives a damn whether you insult or disagree with them because well, they donU+2019t care. And because they are mature enough to ignore any insults under the pretext that it is U+201Cyour opinionU+201D.<br />Do you know how much I love that? I have suffered A LOT because of that. Let me tell you something about myself. I never EVER stay quiet about something that I believe to be true U+2013 even if I was wrong to many other people U+2013 and now Mister Money-Head-Of-Amazon has to ruin that for me. <br /><br />All right, I realized that everything that was said about the new policy was said in the utmost civilized way. But guess what! I am a teenager. I donU+2019t give a damn about manners, and I am about to say what everyone has wanted to say for a long time. <br /><br />Goodreads by succumbing to the green papers have restricted my freedom of speech. In the last few years, I have been bullied, put down, humiliated, insulted, punishedU+2026 just because I wanted to say what I had in mind, just because I always stand up to what I believe in. And since because ALL OF THAT HAPPENED TO ME, I turned towards Goodreads where I was surprised that no one cared about whatever I said, and always respected me when I wanted to express myself. <br />No review of mine has been removed, but a lot of peopleU+2019s reviews have been removed. Since it didnU+2019t affect me yet, I should shut up, right? No! Just the fact that it exists is bothering me. It is like having this law around forbidding people to eat chicken, and I hate chicken, but that doesnU+2019t mean I should keep quiet. Okay, that was a bad example, but the closest I had to the ridiculousness of what we are fighting for. No one should fight for his right to express himself freely. It is a right. We are born with that right. And no number of reviews removed is going to change that. It is not going to frighten us. It is not going to make us back out. You can remove all the reviews you want, Goodreads, but this is something I believe in. So I am fighting, even if you have to ban me. Well, according to your own policy, you can't do that. Well, you can't even remove the reviews that have been put <i> before </i> the declaration of that censorship but you do it anyway. So you are bunch of hypocrites. <br /><br />You, Goodreads managers, anyone with the IQ of a peacock can realize that what you have done is so wrong on so many levels. <br />If I were the Goodreads manager, I would say this to the Amazon Manager when he came offering the new law U+201CYou can take your money and your pathetic ass out of my office! You cannot threaten us with money or hold it over our heads! This company has so far made you millions of money just by existing and promoting your books! More than half of our members buy regularly from your website! In fact, according to this logic, you owe us!U+201D GR Manager slaps Amazon Manager. <br />Jackie Shan bursts into the scene wearing nothing but a newspaper around his waist. <br />Kung fu! Jackie kicks Amazon ManagerU+2019s head off, and his body goes around looking for its head. Meanwhile, GR Manager holds both the head and the body and throws them from the window of the headquarters. BOOM! The end. <br /><br />This policy is so wrong. If people like us cannot express themselves online, then where will they? I might not insult your precious little authors, Amazon Manager (in my opinion they shouldnU+2019t be called authors if they canU+2019t take god damn criticism. Not everyone should approve with them), but I have every god damn right to express myself freely without having to worry whether my review would be removed or not. <br />The management even has no right to go around reading whatever we say online because well, I thought they had better things to do. It turns out I was wrong, donU+2019t you think? Anyway, what we say online is OUR concern, not yours. You shouldnU+2019t threaten us. You shouldnU+2019t condemn us. <br />Maybe to you, you are only deleting a review, but to us you are restricting our freedom. And no one really appreciates freedom but the ones who have been deprived from it. I wonder how the Goodreads Management even agreed to this. <br />I had a lot more to say about this on my mind, but I think I have made my point quite clearly. Us, readers, and the ones who write a bit like I do, find words our strongest weapon. <br /><br /><br />Back to my review about this book. <br />THIS WAS THE WORST BOOK I HAVE READ! I have cried 50 pages straight. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ why did she have to kill Sirius?WHAT DID HE EVER DO TO HER? I AM STILL CRYING YOU KNOW!  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />The 5 stars I have given it, it was not a U+201CWOW I LOVED THIS BOOK AUTOMATIC FIVE STARS!U+201D No. It was this kind of books U+201Cit deserves 5 stars, with a little dash of wow at the endU+201D. <br />This is the kind of perfect books that makes you feel as though all happiness, innocence and hope had been sucked out of the world, and until everything in the book is fixed, nothing in the world will ever be right again. <br />I have really a lot of controversial feelings about this book, but it all goes down to one point. It is good. It is worthy of five stars. And it had hooked me up five days straight.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16705413281977824887\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/1713956-manny\">Manny</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16983669534618005097\">Thank you dr btyust. comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_2516681\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/2516681\" />\n    <a title=\"Annie\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/160759-annie\"><img alt=\"Annie\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1184216794p2/160759.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/2516681?book_show_action=false\">Jun 28, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Annie\" class=\"user\" name=\"Annie\" href=\"/user/show/160759-annie\">Annie</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">did not like it</span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">tried and true Harry Potter fans</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/160759-annie?shelf=almostcrapbutnotquite\">almostcrapbutnotquite</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer2516681\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7808361824874678316\">hrrmmpp.<br />This is my least favourite of the Harry Potter series, and almost borders on the \"don't bother\". It is saved only by the virtue that it is a Harry Potter book and moves the series along to the still yet unknown finale.<br />My issues with it:<br />- deals with complex social/political problems in a simplified, extreme, and dichotomous manner<br />- characterisations are too easy/lazy- all good or all bad (with the exception of Snape who's good/evil intentions are yet unknown), all courageous or cowardly,</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7808361824874678316\" style=\"display:none\">hrrmmpp.<br />This is my least favourite of the Harry Potter series, and almost borders on the \"don't bother\". It is saved only by the virtue that it is a Harry Potter book and moves the series along to the still yet unknown finale.<br />My issues with it:<br />- deals with complex social/political problems in a simplified, extreme, and dichotomous manner<br />- characterisations are too easy/lazy- all good or all bad (with the exception of Snape who's good/evil intentions are yet unknown), all courageous or cowardly, the righteous or the corrupt. <br />- Malfoy junior is the most incompetent nemesis in the history of evil. And whilst this was acceptable in the earlier books where there was an element of the comical in his attempts to be evil, by book 5, where the themes have become signifantly darker, he and his side-kicks' unchanging and inane attempts to foil Harry's ultimate fate have just become annoying. The only <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/130916.The_Saving_Graces_A_Novel\" title=\"The Saving Graces A Novel by Patricia Gaffney\">saving grace</a> is that Harry has more than enough true and worthwhile enemies and obstacles for the reader to really get bogged down by Malfoy's silliness. <br />- the laudable themes of power/corruption/propaganda/censorship are played out with such naive characterisations, extreme situations and melodramaticism that it results in inflammatory knee-jerk reactions rather than furthering understanding of the subleties of these ideas. <br />- the plot seems confused, as if JK Rowling has all these ideas, but is unsure of where she ultimately wants to go, thereby leaving in all these subplots that neither has entertainment, wisdom nor story-advancing value. EG what's with Grawp and the freaking giants??<br /><br />Overall- read it only as a part of the greater goal of coming closer to the ending of the series.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7808361824874678316\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review2516681\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right B\" href=\"/user/show/42304304-molly-b\"><img src=\"https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_25x33-d79c46f9428d2aea1444d67c091766a6.png\" alt=\"F 25x33\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/42304304-molly-b\">Molly B</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11735787794696864837\">You may not have liked this book but don't forget that this book is well-written still and still hooked you long enough to finish it</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      May 12, 2016 10:42AM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_154091363\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Catherine\" <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1553332697\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer920342608342555504\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1455858913i/18159569.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I know I overwhelmed Goodreads with my abundant reviews this week but I promise this is the last IU+2019ll post until I finish <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince__Harry_Potter__6_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (Harry Potter #6) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a> which will probably take a week. Lol.<br><br>The following is mostly rubbish because I was dreadfully ill when I read the fifth Harry Potter book (my faithful, loyal companion while my own respiratory tract conspired against me.) MerlinU+2019s Beard! What has happened to my English? It has fully converted to British. Bloody brilliant! My husband will</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText920342608342555504\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1455858913i/18159569.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I know I overwhelmed Goodreads with my abundant reviews this week but I promise this is the last IU+2019ll post until I finish <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince__Harry_Potter__6_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (Harry Potter #6) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a> which will probably take a week. Lol.<br><br>The following is mostly rubbish because I was dreadfully ill when I read the fifth Harry Potter book (my faithful, loyal companion while my own respiratory tract conspired against me.) MerlinU+2019s Beard! What has happened to my English? It has fully converted to British. Bloody brilliant! My husband will surely be gobsmacked!<br><br>I know that I should be using my days off to rest but I just couldnU+2019t keep my hands off Harry Potter. Even though this is even longer than the fourth book, I finished it triumphantly in three days to be exact.<br><br><b> As usual, the ff. are my usual gibberish while and after reading HP books: </b><br><br>1. A crabby Harry is new!<br>2. Percy has always pissed me off but the ingrate! I canU+2019t believe heU+2019s a Weasley!<br>3. I always thought drawling is cool except when Lucius does it.<br>4. I swear Prof. Umbridge is the reincarnation of a professor I once had in college. Getting to know her is like reliving those dreadful days. Her carefully structured theory based method=<b>blech!</b><br>5. Brilliant, Prof. Mc Gonagall. You show that Umbridge woman off!<br>6. When has Ginny started to become so clever and funny?<br>7. Romance is quite in the air but not for long really. Lol.<br>8. Hermione fell nothing short of brilliant and as usual, she is right. SheU+2019s always right. When will you learn that, Harry?<br>9. Prof. Lockhart turned up! Poor thing.<br>10. Woohoo! Show that old bat, Fred and George! What a legendary departure.<br>11. I have never taken a liking to Peeves until now.<br>12. Kreacher, you treacherous elf!<br>13. Looney, I mean Luna Lovegood has been a great help. <br>14. The best Defense against Dark Arts Professor Award goes to Harry Potter!<br>15. Oh Dumbledore! *gasps* Indeed, you got style.^^<br>16. Hagrid has a little brother! <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Graupy-lol <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br>17. NOOOOOOOO! Please stop killing people, J.K. I donU+2019t think I can take anymore. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ Sirius!  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><b> *wails for one hour!* </b><br>18. Thank you, Order of Phoenix. ItU+2019s about time the Dursleys learned their lesson.<br><br><i> * I didnU+2019t bother taking notes of the things the movie missed or gotten wrong because there are just too many but I have to say the Umbridge actress played the character spot on and so did Luna Lovegood, Bellatrix and of course Voldz. One thing I commend the movies for from the first one up to the fifth would be the choice of actors and actresses who gave justice to their characters.^^ </i><br><br><b> Goodbye, real world! Hello, wizarding world! *poof!*</b><br></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"920342608342555504\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1553332697\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1553332697\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1553332697&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1553332697'><a id=\"like_count_review_1553332697\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1553332697?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">106 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1553332697\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1553332697\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=106&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1553332697&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1553332697\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1553332697, true, &#39;&#39;); To view it,\n                    <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1773578300&#39;); return false;\">click here.</a>\n                  </em>\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1773578300\" class=\"readable\"\n                    style=\"display:none\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10472031968039298646\"><s>REVIEW TO COME TOMORROW</s><br><br><s>Edit : Guys, I'm sorry that I have to review it on Monday. There's blackout here ;_; </s><br><br><b>4.9 Stars</b><br><br><i> <b>'Yeah' said Harry, 'but you, unlike me, are a git, so get out and leave us alone.' </b> </i><br><br>I supposed to post the review yesterday but there was a blackout while I was reviewing and you can imagine how pissed I was when suddenly my computer was off and the review was already quite long. I was like this : <br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1477326351ra/20939087.gif\" width=\"200\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>well, I wasn't screaming because it was midnight but I was really really angry. <br><br>wel</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10472031968039298646\" style=\"display:none\"><s>REVIEW TO COME TOMORROW</s><br><br><s>Edit : Guys, I'm sorry that I have to review it on Monday. There's blackout here ;_; </s><br><br><b>4.9 Stars</b><br><br><i>\n  <b>'Yeah' said Harry, 'but you, unlike me, are a git, so get out and leave us alone.' </b>\n</i><br><br>I supposed to post the review yesterday but there was a blackout while I was reviewing and you can imagine how pissed I was when suddenly my computer was off and the review was already quite long. I was like this : <br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1477326351ra/20939087.gif\" width=\"200\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>well, I wasn't screaming because it was midnight but I was really really angry. <br><br>well let's talk about this book :D <br><br>*breaths in Breaths out* <br>there were lots of tears, laugh, sadness, happiness and anger while I was reading it and I'm here still can't accept the death of the guy I <s>cared</s> care. I mean, why do I always lose charcters that I love or care?!?! why Sirius?! not Kreacher or anyone, anyone means Cho Chang actually...<br>okay let's begin with Cho Chang. <br><br><u>\n  <b>I Ship Harry With Ginny Not Cho Chang</b>\n</u><br><br>I totally HATE this girl. She is a cry baby and she is also weird. one minute she is happy and then suddenly she bursts into tears and she always exaggerate problems. little problem can be big problem with her and I still don't know why Harry had feelings to her. yes, had. because he doesn't like Cho Chang anymore. YAY! finally he opened his eyes! and these scenes made me hate her so much : <br><br><i><br> U+279C He turned to saw Cho standing in the middle of the room, tears pouring down her face.<br><br> U+279C 'I thought,' she said, tears spattering down on to the table, 'I thought you'd u - u - understand! I need to talk about it! Surely you n - need to talk about it t - too! I mean, you saw it happen, d - didn't you?'<br><br> U+279C 'I'll see you around, Harry,' she said dramatically , and hiccoughing slightly she dashed to the door, wrenched it open and hurried off into the pouring rain.<br><br>U+279C 'I'm really, really sorry. That interview was so brave ... it made me cry.'<br><br> U+279C 'That was a really horrible trick of Hermione Granger's,' said Chp fiercely. 'She should have told us she'd jinxed that list -'<br>'I think it was brilliant idea,' said harry coldly, Cho flushed and her eyes grew brighter.<br>'Oh yes, I forgot - of course, if it was darling Hermione's idea -'<br>'Don't start crying again,' said Harry warningly.<br>'I wasn't going to! she shouted.<br>'Yeah ... well ... good,' he said. 'I've got enough to cop with at the moment.'<br>'Go and cope with it then!' Cho said furiously, turning on her heel and stalking off. <br><br>U+279C 'Yeah,' said Ron slowly, savouring the words, 'we won. Did you see the look on Cho's face when Ginny got the snitch right out from under her nose?'<br>'I suppose she cried, did she?' said Harry bitterly,<br>'Well, yeah - more out of temper than anything, though ...' Ron frowned slightly. 'But you saw her chuck her broom away when she got back to the ground, didn't you?' </i><br><br>and she was totally insane, why did she have to ask about Cedric to Harry while they were dating. of course Harry didn't want to talk abou Cedric! and Didn't she have feelings?! I'm sure Harry didn't want to remember that horrible memory. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1477332825ra/20939742.gif\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I ship Harry with Ginny because : <br><br>U+2764 Ginny is funny <br>U+2764 Ginny is not a crybaby <br>U+2764 Ginny is brave <br>U+2764 Ginny is more beautiful than Cho<br>U+2764 She is basically more perfect than Cho <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1477329230ra/20939304.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><u>\n  <b>I Don't Like Harry's Temper </b>\n</u><br><br>I know, Harry was having a hard time but that didn't mean he had the rights to be harsh to his best friends. they will always on his side and there was a scene where he snapped at Hermione. <br><br><i>'Been having a nice little chat with her about whether or not I'm a lying, attention-seeking prat, have you?' Harry said loudly.<br>'No,' said Hermione calmly. 'I told her to keep her big fat mouth shut about you, actually. And it would be quite nice if you stopped jumping down our throats, Harry, because in case you haven't noticed, Ron and I are on your side.'<br>There was a short pause.<br>'Sorry,' said Harry in a low voice.<br>'That's quite all right,' said Hermione with dignity. Then she shook her head. 'Don't you remember what Dumbledore said at the last end-of-term feast?' </i><br><br>and they continued talking.<br><br>oh! I also didn't like Harry when he shouted at professor Dumbledore because he just saved his life and he's clearly older than Harry, So Harry had to talk calmly to him even though he was angry and the most annoying thing was that he destroyed Dumbledore's possessions. he was totally rude<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1477330563ra/20939453.gif\" width=\"280\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I know, I know he was sad because Sirius just died and I was sad too! I cried a lot! but I didn't angry with Dumbledore. I was angry with Kreacher, Bellatrix and Voldemort. I still am, actually. how could I forgive them?! they killed Sirius! <br><br><u>\n  <b>I Love Sirius Especially Young Sirius</b>\n</u><br><br><i>With another shock of excitement, Harry saw Sirius give James the thumbs-up. Sirius was lounging in his chair at ease, tilting it back on two legs. He was very good-looking; his dark hair fell into his eyes with a sort of casual elegance neither James's nor Harry's could ever have achieved, and a girl sitting behind him was eyeing him hopefully, though he didn't seem to have noticed.</i><br><br>OH.MY.GOD. HE IS SO HANDSOME. BUT WHY!?! WHY DID HE HAVE TO DIE?!?! I LIKE SIRIUS SO MUCH!! AND NOW, I WILL NEVER SEE HIM ANYMORE! LIFE IS SO UNFAIR. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1477333109ra/20939778.gif\" width=\"280\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>thank you for reading and liking this review, guys! hope you guys have a great day! U+2764 U+2764<br><br>P.S. I like Luna so much! she is funny xD</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10472031968039298646\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1773578300\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1773578300\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1773578300\" ref=\"like\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1405698623\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1405698623\" />\n    <a title=\"Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee\"><img alt=\"Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475805558p2/44137919.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1405698623?book_show_action=false\">Jun 13, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)\" href=\"/user/show/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee\">Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408855935\" href=\"/book/show/22037456-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1405698623\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12086524410947794285\"><blockquote> <b> <i>Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.</i> </b> </blockquote><br /><br />Rating:    <br /><br />I feel like I'm going to get attacked for only rating a Harry Potter book 3.75 stars but Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix is probably my LEAST favorite of the series thus far. It went by so slow and I felt like too much went on but at the same time nothing really happened. This book could've easily been made at least 200 pages shorter if J.K. Rowling got rid of all the pointless</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12086524410947794285\" style=\"display:none\"><blockquote>\n  <b>\n    <i>U+275DThings we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.U+275E</i>\n  </b>\n</blockquote><br /><br />Rating: U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+00BE<br /><br />I feel like I'm going to get attacked for only rating a Harry Potter book 3.75 stars but Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix is probably my LEAST favorite of the series thus far. It went by so slow and I felt like too much went on but at the same time nothing really happened. This book could've easily been made at least 200 pages shorter if J.K. Rowling got rid of all the pointless details and chapters that added nothing significant to the storyline. The movie was never really one of my favorites either and that was probably the primary reason it took me more than a month to get through Order of the Phoenix.<br /><br />On top of that, I wasn't a big fan of Harry in this book. I understand that he went through a whole lot after the events of Goblet of Fire but he was moody and a jerk to everyone around him 98% of the time and although I can empathize with him, it became too over the top for me and I got tired of it real fast. He just kept snapping and going off on all the wrong people and it got really annoying. All the constant CAPITALIZED yelling didn't help too much either.<br /><br />Even though Order of the Phoenix was my least favorite movie and book, I LOVED the concept of Dumbledore's Army. I just loved seeing all the students in action and actually putting everything they learned into good use. We finally get to meet Luna Lovegood, one of my favorite Harry Potter characters of all time, and I was so ecstatic every time her name was mentioned.<br /><br />As for Umbridge, she was also the ultimate villain in this book. She was the woman you LOVED to HATE and I felt the movie nailed this portrayal so perfectly. If J.K. Rowling's goal was to make you want to rip your own hair to shreds, she succeeded that and more.<br /><br />Overall, I felt the book was unnecessarily long but the movie itself was not much better. Where the book felt too slow, the film adaptation felt too rushed leaving out key details. Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix will probably always be my least favorite book and movie in the series, but the worst Harry Potter book is still a whole league better than a lot of other books.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12086524410947794285\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1405698623\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1405698623\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1405698623&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1405698623'><a id=\"like_count_review_1405698623\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1405698623?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">93 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1405698623\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1405698623\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=93&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1405698623&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1405698623\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1405698623, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1309613305\" />\n    <a title=\"P \" class=\"left imgcol\" it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\" href=\"/book/show/17347381-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=favorites-2015\">favorites-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25327841-p?shelf=re-read\">re-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1309613305\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14832531124127198371\"><b> <blockquote>U+201CWit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure.U+201D </blockquote> </b><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456988164i/18303633._SY540_.png\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>Reread -</b> Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix always gives me a challenge whenever I start reading. It's 870 pages for US edition and 1000+ pages for Thai edition. The book starts off with a summer when Harry banters with Dudley, and there comes the Dementors. So Harry has to use his magic to expel those nasty things. He never knows before his act will bring him to M.o.M. In the beginning, J.K. Rowling used the first few chapters to intro</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14832531124127198371\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <blockquote>U+201CWit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure.U+201D </blockquote>\n</b><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456988164i/18303633._SY540_.png\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>Reread -</b> Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix always gives me a challenge whenever I start reading. It's 870 pages for US edition and 1000+ pages for Thai edition. The book starts off with a summer when Harry banters with Dudley, and there comes the Dementors. So Harry has to use his magic to expel those nasty things. He never knows before his act will bring him to M.o.M. In the beginning, J.K. Rowling used the first few chapters to introduce us about the Order of the Phoenix. That got me chilled the first time I was reading about this order. I loved to see the good guys being together and figthing the Dark Lord. I was so excited about this book anyway.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1456990221ra/18303742.gif\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I have a feeling that Harry in this book is not like Harry, the one I know, he throws a tantrum when his friends don't believe about what happened last year. I understand about his age making him not stable, if I can call it. The only person I want to talk about is <b>Professor Umbrige</b>, I call her the pink toad, she's the character that unify everything around this book impeccably. Seeing everyone fighting with her and restraining her not to destroy the Hogwart's system make this book unique unlike the first four books. I couldn't stop laughing then.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1398869871ra/9473956.gif\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>\n  <blockquote>U+201CIs it true that you shouted at Professor Umbridge?\"<br>\"Yes.\"<br>\"You called her a liar?\"<br>\"Yes.\"<br>\"You told her He Who Must Not Be Named is back?\"<br>\"Yes.\"<br>\"Have a biscuit, Potter.U+201D </blockquote>\n</b><br><br>I laughed out loud because of this scene. This book contains many emotions I can't describe all of it in one review. Do you believe me ? It is far better than the movie and the last M.o.M. scene is beyond exciting. The movie cut it out and I was so angry for that !<br><br><b>\n  <blockquote>U+201CYou know, Minister, I disagree with Dumbledore on many counts...but you cannot deny he's got style...U+201D </blockquote>\n</b><br><br>The sad thing in this book is about Sirius. If you've read it, you'll know why. Every time I get my head around it, I want to cry and cry. It's so touching and heartwrenching to see that thing happens. Nonetheless, reading this book is like growing up. There's not only happiness in your life, you have to face so many regrets and learn how to move on like Harry and his friends. All I can say is this book is not just a book, it's my life !<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1456990320ra/18303744.gif\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>More at <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://goo.gl/GMGytx\" rel=\"nofollow\">http://goo.gl/GMGytx</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14832531124127198371\" href=\"#\" itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1471598063\" />\n    <a title=\"Councillor\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/40792319-councillor\"><img alt=\"Councillor\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1437208837p2/40792319.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1471598063?book_show_action=false\">Aug 09, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Councillor\" class=\"user\" name=\"Councillor\" href=\"/user/show/40792319-councillor\">Councillor</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=all-time-favorites\">all-time-favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=21st-century\">21st-century</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=rated-5-stars\">rated-5-stars</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=to-read-2016-priority\">to-read-2016-priority</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=read-2016\">read-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=library\">library</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=heart-breaking\">heart-breaking</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=the-5th-book-in-a-series\">the-5th-book-in-a-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=school-setting\">school-setting</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=woohoo-guilty-pleasure\">woohoo-guilty-pleasure</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1471598063\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1823529185192826926\">A lot of people consider <i>The Order of the Phoenix</i> to be the weakest book in the entire Harry Potter series. I haven't read the last two installments yet, but from what I have read so far ... <b>this one was my favorite</b>. I enjoyed two other books in the series more than this one (The Sorcerer's Stone and The Goblet of Fire), but enjoyment is not necessarily the only aspect allowing a book to turn into a favorite.<br><br><b>Let's go on the dark side here.</b> While the previous books were still light-hearted in the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1823529185192826926\" style=\"display:none\">A lot of people consider <i>The Order of the Phoenix</i> to be the weakest book in the entire Harry Potter series. I haven't read the last two installments yet, but from what I have read so far ... <b>this one was my favorite</b>. I enjoyed two other books in the series more than this one (The Sorcerer's Stone and The Goblet of Fire), but enjoyment is not necessarily the only aspect allowing a book to turn into a favorite.<br><br><b>Let's go on the dark side here.</b> While the previous books were still light-hearted in the overall atmosphere in spite of certain parts of the storylines, this one consisted to approximately 95% of darkness and a lack of happiness for all the characters involved. Studying at Hogwarts is not enjoyable anymore, life has become dangerous for everyone everywhere, favorite teachers have been replaced by unlikeable ones, dangers and traps are looming wherever you set your feet. Life is not easy for Harry Potter and his friends in this book, because not only do the dangers floating above their heads cloud their moods - they also slowly enter puberty with all the feelings and emotions involved with the process of growing-up. Not only because of the darkness of the various themes, but also due to the character development is it impossible to call this book a children's book anymore. <br><br>Justice is what a lot of readers - including myself - probably missed in this book. Harry has won the Triwizard Tournament, but nobody truly acknowledges his victory. He still has to spend the summer with his merciless family, he still has to fight for his reputation and his dignity. After everything Harry achieved, life reveals itself to him in its cruelest colors, the Dark Lord's return only being one of the many aspects influencing his decline of happiness. This book also introduces one of the most despised characters in the Harry Potter universe, Dolores Jane Umbridge. Who could possibly like such a woman? Apart from imagining Imelda Staunton's inspiring portrayal from the movies which helped a lot with exploring Dolores' role in the book, her unforgiving decisions and her unforgettable appearances, it can be discussed whether Dolores Umbridge is truly a realistic character, but she supported J.K. Rowling's general direction into the dark themes of the series, and if there is one thing Dolores Umbridge's presence was good for, then it is this: It made Harry and his friends, but also the book's readers realize that <b>life is never the way you imagine it to be. Life is cruel, life is hard, life is merciless.</b><br><br>I love this book because it doesn't beautify things. Death is presented as a necessary part of everyone's life. All the characters are created as human beings who are full of faults and mistakes. The perfect images everyone had in their minds of characters like Albus Dumbledore, James Potter or even Sirius Black are shattered in the course of the book, only to allow the readers to form new opinions on those characters again. Those books are set in the fantasy genre, but it all felt so realistic that it was impossible not to share the thrill and the excitement of those pages - mainly because the <i>characters</i> felt so realistic. They are flawed. They are full of emotions. They come to decisions, and they regret decisions. But in their essence, they are <i>human</i>. Which is perhaps why so many readers love this series - because it feels like you accompany people into a completely different world who might as well be your friends who are sitting at your school desk next to you.<br><br>[Major spoiler for this novel: <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[I am not even angry with J.K. Rowling for killing off Sirius Black. Obviously, he was a character beloved by a lot of readers, and I would have loved to see Sirius being redeemed officially as not having committed the crimes he was accused of. But that's the very reason for why this is my favorite novel in the series so far: Just like in real life, it's not a given that the good people survive and the bad people die. You can't even always say who is good and who is evil, because there is a thin line because good and bad. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>]<br><br>A lot of fantasy authors tend to kill off the antagonists and create a happy ending with the good-hearted major characters, which is my main reason for my troubles with the fantasy genre. J.K. Rowling doesn't mind all this; with her novels, you never know who is going to survive and who is going to die, because it could be everyone. As long as you haven't been spoiled already, that is.<br><br>Yes, maybe this book is too long indeed. I needed more days to finish it than I needed for all the other four books combined (considering only the respective reading time I spent with them). Yes, maybe it could be shortened, although I am the last one who knows how that could possibly be done. Yes, it is darker than all the other books in the series so far. And yes, I loved it for all those reasons.<br><br><blockquote>\n  <i>U+201CThings we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.U+201D</i>\n</blockquote><br><br><br>-----------<br><br><b>Pre-Review (4th July):</b><br><br>It has been <i>three</i> months since I finished <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>, and only now do I finally begin reading this fifth book in the series. (Which I am reading for the first time. Can this confession become even more embarassing?)<br><br>Maybe it can be accepted as an explanation that I left the fourth book feeling like this and obviously needing to recuperate:<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467657371ra/19615207.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>So, let's continue my journey through the world of Hogwarts!<br><br>Review to come once I'm finished. Which might take a while, because while it's evidently Harry Potter and shouldn't take much time to get through, my copy of this book has <i>1040 pages</i>. That's loooong. And, of course, a pretty good thing, considering that it's <i>Harry Potter</i> we talk about.<br><br><br><br><b>My reviews in the Harry Potter series:</b><br><br>1) <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a>: <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1316706192?book_show_action=false\">Go to review</a><br>2) <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>: <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1469645452?book_show_action=false\">Go to review</a><br>3) <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>: <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1471598035?book_show_action=false\">Go to review</a><br>4) <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>: <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1471598053\">Go to review</a></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n id=\"reviewTextContainer1296987664\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10274328567474018612\">Maravilloso, increU+00EDble!! Este libro me dejU+00F3 destrozada, con los ojos hinchados de llorar y con el corazU+00F3n en pedacitos.<br /><br />La historia y los personajes han madurado mucho, el libro tiene un ritmo perfecto y es una ruleta rusa de emociones. Hay nuevos misterios y nuevos descubrimientos, amU+00E9 este libro como he amado a los demU+00E1s de la saga. <br /><br />Odie con mi alma a Dolores Umbridge<br /><br />ReseU+00F1a Completa: <a
