itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/388324480\" />\n    <a title=\"(9 3/4) Gerasimos\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/11731184-9-3-4-gerasimos\"><img alt=\"(9 3/4) Gerasimos\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1449705496p2/11731184.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/388324480?book_show_action=false\">Sep 29, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"(9 3/4) Gerasimos\" class=\"user\" name=\"(9 3/4) Gerasimos\" href=\"/user/show/11731184-9-3-4-gerasimos\">(9 3/4) Gerasimos</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747561071\" href=\"/book/show/862631.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11731184-9-3-4-gerasimos?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11731184-9-3-4-gerasimos?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11731184-9-3-4-gerasimos?shelf=reread\">reread</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11731184-9-3-4-gerasimos?shelf=signed\">signed</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer388324480\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9897312556595026111\">Harry Potter changed my life. If I hadnU+2019t read Harry Potter when I did I would not be the same person today. What I am today, in a part is due to Harry. I cannot really say enough to make you understand how much Harry Potter means to me. <br><br><br><i>The copy I own is not signed by J. K. Rowling but it is signed by Daniel Radcliffe!</i><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380387107i/747040.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review388324480\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link388324480\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=388324480&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_388324480'><a id=\"like_count_review_388324480\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/388324480?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">82 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_388324480\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_388324480\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=82&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=388324480&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_388324480\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 388324480, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;\">17 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/388324480?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_388324480' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/388324480/comments?reverse=true\">View all 17 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_147817227\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Linda Lytle\" href=\"/user/show/45432444-linda-lytle\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476778163p1/45432444.jpg\" alt=\"45432444\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/45432444-linda-lytle\">Linda Lytle</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9708882796318554550\">I couldn't put it down from The first to the last it was fascinating v</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Feb 19, 2016 12:30PM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_152322837\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Booklover101 U+2661\" href=\"/user/show/50900651-booklover101\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477671739p1/50900651.jpg\" alt=\"50900651\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/50900651-booklover101\">Booklover101 U+2661</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9329474766365876709\">Daniel Radcliffe! Holy crap!!!</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      May 30, 2016 04:44PM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_388324480' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 388324480, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_829021644\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/829021644\" />\n    <a title=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury\"><img alt=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1356324709p2/11375137.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/829021644?book_show_action=false\">Aug 07, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Cait (Paper Fury)\" href=\"/user/show/11375137-cait-paper-fury\">Cait (Paper Fury)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747551003\" href=\"/book/show/444327.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=magical-fantasy\">magical-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=3-star\">3-star</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/11375137-cait-paper-fury?shelf=read-2015\">read-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer829021644\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1038004924699081145\">AHHHH I AM FINALLY FINISHD. *collapses in a puddle* Peoples, I usually read a book in a day, two days if it's big, <i>three</i> if it's super huge. THIS BOOK TOOK ME FOREVER. I know there a lot of super-keen Potter fans out there, so, um, you may not want to read this review. But! But! WAIT! The biggest thing you need to know is:<b> I seriously love this series. I do.</b> It's so detailed and thorough and interesting and I totally see why it's captured the world in it's wizarding claws. BUT. I didn't grow up</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1038004924699081145\" style=\"display:none\">AHHHH I AM FINALLY FINISHD. *collapses in a puddle* Peoples, I usually read a book in a day, two days if it's big, <i>three</i> if it's super huge. THIS BOOK TOOK ME FOREVER. I know there a lot of super-keen Potter fans out there, so, um, you may not want to read this review. But! But! WAIT! The biggest thing you need to know is:<b> I seriously love this series. I do.</b> It's so detailed and thorough and interesting and I totally see why it's captured the world in it's wizarding claws. BUT. I didn't grow up reading it. And now? Reading it? I love a lot of things, but there are <i>so</i> many things that bother me, particularly about The Order of the Phoenix. <br /><br /><b>THINGS THAT BOTHERED ME:</b><br /><br /><b>+ The freaking gargantuan size.</b> This is the most important thing to note. IT IS HUGE AND IT SHOULD NOT BE THIS BIG. The first 100-pages are numbingly boring...they cleaned house? SO WHAT. <br /><b>+ Ron/Hermione's bickering drove me nuts.</b> This trio of \"friends\" act so often NOT like friends, it just really grates on me. I know friends have their ups and downs, but Ron is downright rude. Harry is usually oblivious, but he doesn't help things much either. Of COURSE I'm Team Hermione here, and I know she gets together with Ron...but I ain't shipping it.<br /><b>+ The last 50-pages were so intense and interesting...WHY WERE THEY SO SHORT??</b> It's like the book FINALLY warmed up and got going and got exciting and -- BOOM! -- it's done now. Plus so many interest reveals just come as a Dumbledore info-dump. Um. Seriously?<br /><b>+ The characters, in general, drove me nuts.</b> I love Dumbledore, don't get me wrong, but he's awfully passive. There's this whole attitude around like \"Awww, well nothing TOO BAD is going badly, so let's just wait until it gets <i>absolutely horrific</i> before we do anything, shall we?\" AND ARGHHH YOU STUIPD STUPID WIZARDS.<br /><b>+ And Harry's logic...I mean, lack thereof...was frustrating.</b> Like \"Omg, a teacher is physically abusing me...I won't tell! I'm a strong brave little melon!\" NO YOU'RE A FREAKING IDIOT. Harry's whole mantra of just suffering in silence made me so so angry.<br /><b>+ Snape.</b> Because it's a grand idea to have a teacher who abuses and bullies students because he had a crappy childhood. Solid work hiring him, Dumbledore. I HATE SNAPE, BTW.<br /><b>+ In general, the book's huge GARGANTUAN themes of \"injustice\".</b> This one is very very much me, but social injustice and discrimination against children and adults exercising their age as a way to control/lord over younger humans -- I HATE IT WITH THE FIRE AND PASSION OF A THOUSAND SUNS. Sure, yes, it has it's place in books. It's realistic. But every time I pick up a Potter book, I just get smothered with how <i>unjust</i> everything is and it makes me SO ANGRY. And while there are 2 dozen things I love about these books, THAT is what makes me wait, like 9 million years between picking up volumes. There should be more balance. There should be more fighting back instead of passiveness.<br /><b>+ And please, someone remind me why Harry still needs to live with the Dursley's?</b> Because I think we've established he doesn't. Another = injustice for no reason.<br /><br /><br />OKAAAAY BUT YOU GUYS PROBABLY THINK I HATE HARRY POTTER NOW AND IT'S NOT TRUE.<br /><br />I also have a list of things I <i>freaking loved</i>. And at the end of the day, I do like this series. I don't \"adore\" it like a true Potterhead, I 'spose. But I do enjoy it.<br /><br /><b>THINGS I ABSOLUTELY LOVE:</b><br /><br /><b>+ The detail.</b> okay, I do complain that the books are too big (they are) but I <i>have</i> to admit this makes the worlds SO INCREDIBLE DEEP. Like all the food details, the off-handed comments, the descriptions, the subjects. IT'S INSANELY AWESOME. It's not like reading about a bunch of kids going to school...it's like genuinely <i>being there</i>.<br /><b>+ The fact that they actually had to DO SCHOOLWORK.</b> So often I read books about characters who are not \"geniuses\" but still manage to save the world AND score uber well in school without doing a scrap of homework. NO. So I love that Harry Potter makes them save the world AND do their homework. And half the time I think their homework sounds freakishy fascinating. Yes, I'm having a Hermione moment.<br /><b>+ HERMIONE.</b> I ABSOLUTELY LOVE HER. She is like one of the biggest reasons I love this series and would even consider rereading (seriously!! I just said that!! Even though I complain!! I'd like to try audios one day...) because she's smart and into equality and rights and I just love her, yes okay?!<br /><b>+...oh and McGongall.</b> I love her too. SO SO MUCH. She does not take a single piece of crap from anyone. SHE IS AMAZING. I love how she fought Umbridge, although I think she could've done more (like stabbed Umbridge in the eye or something) and I love how she's fiercely protective of her students. She's like a super scary mum.<br /><b>+ The Weasleys.</b> ALL OF THEM! Even Ginny is getting more a personality now! YAAAY. I particularly love Fred and George and I'm glad they're living their dream. (Oh, but obviously I hate Percy.) Ron is not my favourite person unfortunately, because I think he's very self-obsessed and I do find him irritating at times. BUUUUT MRS. WEASLEY IS SO FEIRCE AND WONDERFUL.<br /><b>+ Also Luna...although I wish she had a bigger part.</b> Maybe she will in future books?! I love her and her whimsical attitude. She's totally fascinating.<br /><b>+ And Neville is amazing.</b> I particularly love how when Harry was teaching the secret Dark Arts class how Neville was just THRIVING. He didn't feel threatened, and he had one-on-one help with a peer he likes and respect. EQUALS = HIM DOING SO WELL. YAY!! I feel so so annoyed at this book too because I feel Neville has a learning disability and everyone just ignores it. Some teachers do a bit more, but mostly he gets abused - by teachers and students alike. I knoooow stuff like that happens IRL. But we're not reading real life are we??? We're reading about a WIZARD school and I'll be damned if I don't sit here and demand things like learning disabilities should be given respect and help. I love Neville. KEEP FIGHTING NEVILLE.<br /><b>+ And no matter how much I complain...I actually lost track of time while reading this!!</b> That's right! I was reading and my eyes were burning at night and I was like \"OMG WHAT'S THE TIME?!\" so I totally read a <i>lot</i> later than I would usually. A book that absorbs me is definitely a good book.<br /><br /><br />SEE?! I DO LIKE IT. Mostly. (I hated Umbridge of course, but duh. Who doesn't?) Ultimately it was too big and I got a wrist sprain just holding the jolly hardback, BUT! <b>It's intense and magical and intriguing and I want to know what happens next.</b> Also I want to see the movies.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1038004924699081145\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review829021644\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link829021644\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=829021644&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_829021644'><a id=\"like_count_review_829021644\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/829021644?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">80 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_829021644\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_829021644\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=80&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=829021644&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_829021644\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 829021644, true, &#39;&#39;); having maaajor throwback feels to fifth grade times staying up till 5 in the morning trying to finish this</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3588999314990931937\" style=\"display:none\">Ahhh, I'm in such a need of a re-reading; having maaajor throwback feels to fifth grade times staying up till 5 in the morning trying to finish this freaking gargantuan book ahaha :')</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"3588999314990931937\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; Oct 29, 2016 06:16AM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_829021644' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 829021644, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_577785894\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/577785894\" />\n    <a title=\"Darth J \" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/18974711-darth-j\"><img alt=\"Darth J \" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1456429148p2/18974711.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/577785894?book_show_action=false\">Mar 11, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Darth J \" class=\"user\" name=\"Darth J \" href=\"/user/show/18974711-darth-j\">Darth J </a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=series\">series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=witch-wizard\">witch-wizard</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/18974711-darth-j?shelf=harry-potter\">harry-potter</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer577785894\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12212560265468327144\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1426095352i/13973463._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>Instead of a review, IU+2019m just going to share my memories of this book. Back when this came out was the high time of midnight bookstore release parties. Yes, I did go to one and no, I didnU+2019t dress up.<br><br>It was held at a Barnes and Noble and of course John WilliamsU+2019s soundtrack for the first 2 movies was played on a loop throughout the night. Amidst the crowd eagerly awaiting the stroke of 12, were tired adult chaperones and sullen workers who had <b>had enough already</b>. My brother brought me to the stor</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12212560265468327144\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1426095352i/13973463._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>Instead of a review, IU+2019m just going to share my memories of this book. Back when this came out was the high time of midnight bookstore release parties. Yes, I did go to one and no, I didnU+2019t dress up.<br><br>It was held at a Barnes and Noble and of course John WilliamsU+2019s soundtrack for the first 2 movies was played on a loop throughout the night. Amidst the crowd eagerly awaiting the stroke of 12, were tired adult chaperones and sullen workers who had <b>had enough already</b>. My brother brought me to the store and one of his friends was working there; of course being the only ginger on staff he had to dress up like Ron and <i>did not</i> appreciate it. I think he actually hated Harry Potter so that kind of made it worse.<br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1397577426ra/9295520.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Let me preface this next paragraph with the following: I grew up in Las Vegas, so some weird stuff went down that probably wouldnU+2019t have happened anywhere else that night. Not only did the <a href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Goodman\" rel=\"nofollow\">Mayor</a> show up, but <a href=\"http://www.lanceburton.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">U+201CMaster MagicianU+201D Lance Burton</a> did too. They are local celebs, though why they put in an appearance is beyond me. More on this in a minute.<br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1426094990i/13973394._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>So at about 11:30 everyone starts lining up to get our books. The store decided to release them before midnight and that made it all the more like catnip. I remember seeing some four year olds plopped down in an aisle with their copies, pretending to read themU+2026and I thought, <i>who would stop me if I just took it from the kid and ran out?</i> I didnU+2019t though, obviously, but Potter fever makes you think strange thoughts, especially while waiting in line for a highly anticipated book.<br><br>Both the Mayor and the U+201CMaster MagicianU+201D were signing copies of the book. I donU+2019t understand this at all, and still think that somewhere on ebay somebody must have bid on an U+201Cautographed copyU+201D and gotten one signed by one of these men. While thatU+2019s technically true, can you just imagine the disappointment??<br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1426094990i/13973395._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>When I did finally have it in my handsU+2026 oh, that beautiful gloriously blue cover. You knew from <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/2927.Mary_GrandPr_\" title=\"Mary GrandPrU+00E9\">Mary GrandPrU+00E9</a>U+2019s artwork that something major was going to go down, and it did. I started reading it with a booklight on the drive home but was told that the light was distracting my brotherU+2019s driving. Buzzkill. DidnU+2019t he know how important this was?!?!?!?!<br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1426095587ra/13973508.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Arriving home, I went straight to bed and stayed up all night reading. At some point, I think at about 2am, my mom came into my room. She took the book from me, and flipped towards the end, read about SiriusU+2019s death, then gave it back to me without a word. (She had read the first 4 to her third grade class and still chokes up at the mention of U+201Cthe boy who livedU+201D). She never actually read the fifth book or the rest, but always insisted I tell her everything that happened once I finished them.<br><br>I finished it later that day. I didn't care too much that Sirius died, but I do remember being slightly miffed that Rowling never cleared up more about that Veil in the Department of Mysteries. That was such a cruel tease, Jo.<br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1426095208i/13973424.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12212560265468327144\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review577785894\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1243659238?book_show_action=false\">Oct 10, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Kai\" class=\"user\" amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747551003\" href=\"/book/show/444327.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=finished-series\">finished-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=2016\">2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1243659238\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15126715013606039156\"><i>U+201CWe've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.U+201D </i><br /><br />This is my favourite book in my favourite series of all time. It's so rich of detail, so full of mysterious and often dark magic. So much character development, so many brave people sticking up for their friends. It's also the book that introduces us to my most hated fictional character ever. Never have I hated anyone as much as Umbrige. And being able to create such deep anger</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15126715013606039156\" style=\"display:none\"><i>U+201CWe've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.U+201D </i><br /><br />This is my favourite book in my favourite series of all time. It's so rich of detail, so full of mysterious and often dark magic. So much character development, so many brave people sticking up for their friends. It's also the book that introduces us to my most hated fictional character ever. Never have I hated anyone as much as Umbrige. And being able to create such deep anger and loathing in me, with only words!, shows again what a fantastic writer Mrs. Rowling is.<br /><br />Here are some of my favourite scenes, characters and details:<br />1. Mrs. Figg beating up Mundungus and cursing Dudley<br />2. Grimmauld Place and the Order<br />3. Thestrals<br />4. McGonagall vs. Umbrige (Harry's Career Advice appointment is one of the funniest scenes in the whole series)<br />5. McGonagall and Trelawney vs. Umbrige<br />6. The Teachers vs. Umbrige<br />7. Peeves giving Umbrige hell<br />8. Hermione setting up a meeting with Luna & Rita Skeeter<br />9. Dumbledore's Army meetings<br />10. Ginny dating whoever she likes and not giving a damn<br />11. St. Mungo's<br />12. The Department of Mysteries<br />13. \"Have a biscuit, Potter.\"<br />14. Professor Sprout giving Harry 20 points for Gryffindor for handing her a watering can</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15126715013606039156\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1243659238\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1243659238\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1243659238&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1243659238'><a id=\"like_count_review_1243659238\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1243659238?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">77 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1243659238\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1243659238\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=77&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1243659238&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1243659238\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1243659238, true, &#39;&#39;);     \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review659759897\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" style='display: none;'>\n<div id=\"comment_144047567\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"U+00A7 Bookworm Nidhz U+00A7 (Loves Romance)\" id='comments_form_review_659759897' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 659759897, true, '')\">Write a class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1428312\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1428312\" />\n    <a title=\"J.G. Keely\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/84023-j-g-keely\"><img alt=\"J.G. Keely\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1274333636p2/84023.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1428312?book_show_action=false\">Jul 18, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"J.G. Keely\" class=\"user\" name=\"J.G. Keely\" href=\"/user/show/84023-j-g-keely\">J.G. Keely</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fiction\">contemporary-fiction</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=novel\">novel</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fantasy\">contemporary-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=uk-and-ireland\">uk-and-ireland</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1428312\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13845425626130050097\">This is my favorite installment of the quintessential modern bildungsroman. Nevertheless, it has its problems, familiar to any reader of Rowling's.<br /><br />She never seems to gain control of her writing, which spirals out into thousand-page doorstops filled with unimportant side characters and rambling plots. The story is moved along by arbitrary plot devices, often magic. Instead of using the magic to make her world seem more strange and wondrous, she uses it to cover up plot holes. Why write a consiste</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13845425626130050097\" style=\"display:none\">This is my favorite installment of the quintessential modern bildungsroman. Nevertheless, it has its problems, familiar to any reader of Rowling's.<br /><br />She never seems to gain control of her writing, which spirals out into thousand-page doorstops filled with unimportant side characters and rambling plots. The story is moved along by arbitrary plot devices, often magic. Instead of using the magic to make her world seem more strange and wondrous, she uses it to cover up plot holes. Why write a consistent plot when you can just put in a spell or two to fix the problems?<br /><br />Likewise her world is poorly defined. She did not start by constructing the 'wizarding world' and then base her stories off of it, rather she changes her setting to fit whatever she needs at the moment. This constantly shifting setting means the world doesn't make much sense if you take the time to sit and think about it.<br /><br />Her fractured plots are not the result of 'realism', which some authors use to create a sense of a 'real world', separate from archetypes. Rowling is just trying to fit in all the disparate ideas and characters she has in her notepad. She becomes so attached to her characters and ideas that she is unwilling to sacrifice them for a more streamlined book.<br /><br />She has problems connecting the many dots of her story, but uses her magical 'plot devices' to keep us from noticing that the scaffolding behind the facade is rather bare (indeed: crumbly). Her rabid plot movement points away from the cracks in her storytelling: \"move along, nothing to see here\".<br /><br />I find it somewhat ironic that Rowling wants to 'graduate' from Potter to writing adult mysteries. A mystery needs to have a tight plot, based not in the characters but in the events surrounding them. Though many people tried to 'figure out' the Potter books and predict them, in truth there is nothing to figure out. <br /><br />Rowling's foreshadowing is vague and unsupported, and there are just as many clues as red herrings. The only reason some of the elements seem predictable is because there was a crack team of several million people making every guess under the sun. <br /><br />Combine that with the fact that the final book introduces completely new elements to finish the plot, and we can see that Rowling is not really in charge of her own pen. She is a slave to her own sentimentality. Then again, so are millions around the world.<br /><br />The only thing which makes these meandering plots move along at a reasonable pace are her characters. They connect us to the magical world, so that even if it doesn't make sense, at least we can see how it might work for the people who live in it.<br /><br />Her characters are vivid, emotional, motivated, and archetypal without being banal. They may not be psychologically deep, but for a monomyth like this, that is hardly the point. Most people aren't that complex, either.<br /><br />In the series, this book gets the prize for the most psychological depth and also the most consistent mood. Before this, Rowling was still trying to get her footing, figuring out what exactly she was writing, and trying to explain the world to her readers. <br /><br />She finally hit her stride in 'Prisoner of Azkaban', and got much of her unsure world-building out of the way in 'Goblet of Fire'. This is before she started feeling the pressure to wrap things up in a neat package, which again begins to take its toll on her consistency. This is the first, and really the last of her books where Rowling is able to write without being overly concerned with either the beginning or ending of her series.<br /><br />Instead of placing a scattered plot over her characters, Rowling was instead able to let the characters travel through their own path of growth and self-exploration. The change is the most apparent in Harry himself, and though his transformation is somewhat sudden, it is still honest and believable for the character.<br /><br />By focusing chiefly on her strength--character building--and escaping the constraints of the monomyth, if only for a moment, Rowling is able to avoid her weakest points as a writer and turn out her strongest book.<br /><br /><a href=\"http://starsbeetlesandfools.blogspot.com/2012/06/suggested-readings-in-fantasy.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">My Fantasy Book Suggestions</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13845425626130050097\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1428312\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1428312\" likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1428312\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1428312\" ref=\"like\" class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_146592819\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Jack Tripp\" href=\"/user/show/28474265-jack-tripp\"><img src=\"https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/m_25x33-8a3530ed95c3dbef8bf215b080559b09.png\" alt=\"M 25x33\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/28474265-jack-tripp\">Jack Tripp</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17311905508336148299\">Rowling's intention in making the magic so simple was to make Ron, Harry, and Hermione, as well as the reader, aware that Dumbledore intended that the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17311905508336148299\" style=\"display:none\">Rowling's intention in making the magic so simple was to make Ron, Harry, and Hermione, as well as the reader, aware that Dumbledore intended that the three search for the horcruxes, even after his death.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17311905508336148299\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/45833437-fish\">Fish</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4582466820754275283\">Do you have any suggestions onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1428312, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_381017067\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/381017067\" />\n    <a title=\"Evgeny\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/9340136-evgeny\"><img alt=\"Evgeny\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1349810697p2/9340136.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/381017067?book_show_action=false\">Feb 25, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Evgeny\" class=\"user\" name=\"Evgeny\" href=\"/user/show/9340136-evgeny\">Evgeny</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810590\" href=\"/book/show/7955580-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9340136-evgeny?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer381017067\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4358961569282508595\">Harry Potter's fifth year at Hogwarts. The One Who Shall Not Be Named gathers power, but Harry Potter is completely sheltered from outside world and as the result has no clue about what Lord Voldemort is up to. This leads to frustration which in turn leads to angst. Speaking of the latter, the book is full of it. <br><br>So as I was saying, Harry is full of angst through the whole book. This makes for slow moving plot sometimes. It does not help any that the book is probably the biggest in the series. T</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4358961569282508595\" style=\"display:none\">Harry Potter's fifth year at Hogwarts. The One Who Shall Not Be Named gathers power, but Harry Potter is completely sheltered from outside world and as the result has no clue about what Lord Voldemort is up to. This leads to frustration which in turn leads to angst. Speaking of the latter, the book is full of it. <br><br>So as I was saying, Harry is full of angst through the whole book. This makes for slow moving plot sometimes. It does not help any that the book is probably the biggest in the series. To Harry's defense he has a pretty good reason for being such. A couple of reasons actually. Firstly, he is a 15-year-old boy in here. Remember 15-year-old yourself? You were full of angst, too. Secondly, Dumbledore failed Harry, hard. In fact he keep failing him over and over again until the last couple of chapters. <br><br>The biggest lesson of it all: the adults <b>can</b> be wrong (as an adult it pains me to say it); even the ones you hold in the greatest respect like it is a case with Harry and Dumbledore.<br><br>I do not think my review would be complete without mentioning the following character:<br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1455205287i/18072964.jpg\" width=\"340\" height=\"270\" alt=\"Dolores Umbridge\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>This is how I envision her; the movie version was pretty good too. I am talking about Dolores Umbridge of cause. Compared to Lord Voldemort she is fairly low-level as far as villains go, but she was created in such a way that everybody and their brother love to hate her. <br><br>So this is the first book of the series which gets less than perfect rating. The main reason is I feel that it could be made shorter - but I'll be damned if I know how. It is still great and everything, but 600+ pages are a little bit too much for a Harry Potter tale, especially the angst-y one. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4358961569282508595\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review381017067\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link381017067\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=381017067&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_381017067'><a id=\"like_count_review_381017067\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/381017067?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">69 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_381017067\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_381017067\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=69&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=381017067&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_381017067\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 381017067, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1700693308\" />\n    <a title=\"Markus\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/26681101-markus\"><img alt=\"Markus\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1421952301p2/26681101.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1700693308?book_show_action=false\">Jul 28, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Markus\" class=\"user\" name=\"Markus\" href=\"/user/show/26681101-markus\">Markus</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=childrens-books\">childrens-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=2016\">2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=harry-potter\">harry-potter</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1700693308\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11219036103628425014\">ItU+2019s settled. The fifth Harry Potter book has worked a miracle. I actually like the <i>Harry Potter</i> series. You hear that? I actually like it.<br /><br />The first three books were silly childrenU+2019s books with the occasional really good part. Enjoyable, but hardly remarkable. The fourth was an excruciatingly boring book that was saved by its amazing ending. <i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i>, on the other hand, is a great fantasy novel.<br /><br />The atmosphere is finally a lot darker, the story is a lot more coher</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11219036103628425014\" style=\"display:none\">ItU+2019s settled. The fifth Harry Potter book has worked a miracle. I actually like the <i>Harry Potter</i> series. You hear that? I actually like it.<br /><br />The first three books were silly childrenU+2019s books with the occasional really good part. Enjoyable, but hardly remarkable. The fourth was an excruciatingly boring book that was saved by its amazing ending. <i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i>, on the other hand, is a great fantasy novel.<br /><br />The atmosphere is finally a lot darker, the story is a lot more coherent, and several new characters, organisations, places and scenes add a lot of complexity.<br /><br />One of the most important aspects is the expansion of Severus SnapeU+2019s character. One particular flashback made me understand all his actions (though not quite like him, at least not yet) and hate HarryU+2019s sorry excuse for a father more than any literary character ever.<br /><br />The wildly interesting Order of the Phoenix is (obviously) introduced, several of SiriusU+2019 ancestors show up in various forms (including the absodamnlutely amazing Phineas Nigellus Black), Dumbledore is truly shining in this instalment and the final scenes in the Department of Mysteries top the whole thing off greatly.<br /><br />All in all, the second half of the series has placed itself on a much higher level than the first, and I am fully immersed in it for the first time.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11219036103628425014\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1575289621\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1575289621\" />\n    <a title=\"Brina\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2933855-brina\"><img alt=\"Brina\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454067566p2/2933855.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1575289621?book_show_action=false\">Mar 30, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Brina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Brina\" href=\"/user/show/2933855-brina\">Brina</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2933855-brina?shelf=rereads\">rereads</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2933855-brina?shelf=j-k-rowling\">j-k-rowling</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1575289621\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14501557715420368491\">I have read the Harry Potter septuology in its entirety at least ten times. This book is the turning point and also the most difficult for me to read. For starters, I detest Umbrage that foul woman. In fact I abhor her to the point that on occasion I have skipped from book 4 to 6 just to avoid her. <br />Order of the Phoenix is a whopping 870 pages. J K Rowling's prose has transformed from being geared toward kids to teenagers, mirroring Harry's own development. In books 1-4, the language is easy enou</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14501557715420368491\" style=\"display:none\">I have read the Harry Potter septuology in its entirety at least ten times. This book is the turning point and also the most difficult for me to read. For starters, I detest Umbrage that foul woman. In fact I abhor her to the point that on occasion I have skipped from book 4 to 6 just to avoid her. <br />Order of the Phoenix is a whopping 870 pages. J K Rowling's prose has transformed from being geared toward kids to teenagers, mirroring Harry's own development. In books 1-4, the language is easy enough that despite the length even middle grade kids should be able to read it. Book 5 is more tedious. The themes are darker and tougher to digest. Additionally the students are interested in dating, making the content slightly inappropriate for younger readers. <br />Prose aside, we see new characters and many developments in the plot lines. We witness how powerful Dumbledore's abilities are the clear distinctions between Voldemort's death eaters and Dumbledore's army. The end makes it challenging for me to finish the entire book even after all these times because I know what is coming. Looking forward to books 6 and 7 which I enjoy much more than this one. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14501557715420368491\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1575289621\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1575289621\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1575289621&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1575289621'><a id=\"like_count_review_1575289621\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1575289621?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">57 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1575289621\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1575289621\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=57&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1575289621&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1575289621\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1575289621, true, &#39;&#39;);            <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1246640022\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15163749711533759048\"><b>No sU+00E9 quU+00E9 decir... </b> Es increU+00EDble. Gracias, Rowling, por esto...., <b>gracias</b>.<br><br><i>Los jU+00F3venes no pueden saber cU+00F3mo piensan ni cU+00F3mo sienten los ancianos, pero los ancianos cometemos un error si olvidamos quU+00E9 significa ser joven.</i><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1428281048ra/14399921.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><i>Tu incapacidad para comprender que hay cosas mucho peores que la muerte siempre ha sido tu mayor debilidad</i></span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1246640022\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1246640022\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" id='comments_for_review_1246640022' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_8074000\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/8074000\" />\n    <a title=\"Carmen Maloy\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/563625-carmen-maloy\"><img alt=\"Carmen Maloy\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1195667618p2/563625.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/8074000?book_show_action=false\">Oct 22, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Carmen Maloy\" class=\"user\" name=\"Carmen Maloy\" href=\"/user/show/563625-carmen-maloy\">Carmen Maloy</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">Everyone</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer8074000\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4839919850424134703\">What stands out in book 5:<br /><br />* Harry's outburst to his friends at No. 12 Grimmauld Place. A combination of frustration over being kept in the dark and fear that he will be expelled fuels much of Harry's anger, and it all comes out at once, directly aimed at Ron and Hermione. Rowling perfectly portrays Harry's frustration at being too old to shirk responsibility, but too young to be accepted as part of the fight that he knows is coming. <br />* Harry's detention with Professor Umbridge. Rowling shows her</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4839919850424134703\" style=\"display:none\">What stands out in book 5:<br /><br />* Harry's outburst to his friends at No. 12 Grimmauld Place. A combination of frustration over being kept in the dark and fear that he will be expelled fuels much of Harry's anger, and it all comes out at once, directly aimed at Ron and Hermione. Rowling perfectly portrays Harry's frustration at being too old to shirk responsibility, but too young to be accepted as part of the fight that he knows is coming. <br />* Harry's detention with Professor Umbridge. Rowling shows her darker side, leading readers to believe that Hogwarts is no longer a safe haven for young wizards. Dolores represents a bureaucratic tyrant capable of real evil, and Harry is forced to endure their private battle of wills alone. <br />* Harry and Cho's painfully awkward interactions. Rowling clearly remembers what it was like to be a teenager. <br />* Harry's Occlumency lessons with Snape. <br />* Dumbledore's confession to Harry.<br />* Harry yet again loses another loved one.<br />* We meet Hagrid's brother and come to love him as much as Hagrid does.<br />* We learn more about the destiny of Harry and Voldemort.<br />* We also see first hand how destructive government can be when predjudice, ignorance, and pride are at the helm. (i.e. Fudge and Umbridge)<br /><br />Amazon Review<br />As his fifth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry approaches, 15-year-old Harry Potter is in full-blown adolescence, complete with regular outbursts of rage, a nearly debilitating crush, and the blooming of a powerful sense of rebellion. It's been yet another infuriating and boring summer with the despicable Dursleys, this time with minimal contact from our hero's non-Muggle friends from school. Harry is feeling especially edgy at the lack of news from the magic world, wondering when the freshly revived evil Lord Voldemort will strike. Returning to Hogwarts will be a relief... or will it?<br />The fifth book in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series follows the darkest year yet for our young wizard, who finds himself knocked down a peg or three after the events of last year. Somehow, over the summer, gossip (usually traced back to the magic world's newspaper, the Daily Prophet) has turned Harry's tragic and heroic encounter with Voldemort at the Triwizard Tournament into an excuse to ridicule and discount the teen. Even Professor Dumbledore, headmaster of the school, has come under scrutiny by the Ministry of Magic, which refuses to officially acknowledge the terrifying truth that Voldemort is back. Enter a particularly loathsome new character: the toadlike and simpering (\"hem, hem\") Dolores Umbridge, senior undersecretary to the Minister of Magic, who takes over the vacant position of Defense Against Dark Arts teacher--and in no time manages to become the High Inquisitor of Hogwarts, as well. Life isn't getting any easier for Harry Potter. With an overwhelming course load as the fifth years prepare for their Ordinary Wizarding Levels examinations (O.W.Ls), devastating changes in the Gryffindor Quidditch team lineup, vivid dreams about long hallways and closed doors, and increasing pain in his lightning-shaped scar, Harry's resilience is sorely tested.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, more than any of the four previous novels in the series, is a coming-of-age story. Harry faces the thorny transition into adulthood, when adult heroes are revealed to be fallible, and matters that seemed black-and-white suddenly come out in shades of gray. Gone is the wide-eyed innocent, the whiz kid of Sorcerer's Stone. Here we have an adolescent who's sometimes sullen, often confused (especially about girls), and always self-questioning. Confronting death again, as well as a startling prophecy, Harry ends his year at Hogwarts exhausted and pensive. Readers, on the other hand, will be energized as they enter yet again the long waiting period for the next title in the marvelous, magical series. <br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4839919850424134703\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review8074000\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link8074000\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=8074000&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_8074000'><a id=\"like_count_review_8074000\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/8074000?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">52 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_8074000\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_8074000\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=52&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=8074000&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_8074000\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 8074000, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;\">1 comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/8074000?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_8074000' style='display: none;'>\n<div id=\"comment_155798057\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Willowpaw/Silverpaw |Dat Hunger Gamer| *Harry (James) Potter* "Perseus Jackson" But call me Percy\" href=\"/user/show/55800166-willowpaw-silverpaw-dat-hunger-gamer-harry-james-potter-perseus-j\"><img src=\"https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png\" alt=\"U 25x33\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/55800166-willowpaw-silverpaw-dat-hunger-gamer-harry-james-potter-perseus-j\">Willowpaw/Silverpaw |Dat Hunger Gamer| *Harry (James) Potter* "Perseus Jackson" But call me Percy</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8102767236495016762\">An empty placeU+2026</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Aug 20, 2016 09:36PM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_8074000' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 8074000, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"uitext\" style=\"float: right; itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1359557380\" />\n    <a title=\"Drew The Reviewer\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/25599529-drew-the-reviewer\"><img alt=\"Drew The Reviewer\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451757668p2/25599529.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1359557380?book_show_action=false\">Jul 13, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Drew The Reviewer\" class=\"user\" name=\"Drew The Reviewer\" href=\"/user/show/25599529-drew-the-reviewer\">Drew The Reviewer</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\" href=\"/book/show/17347381-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1359557380\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6733404444343242397\">*RE-READ*<br /><br />This will always be one of my favorite Harry Potter books. There is so much of everything. There's action, drama, death, new characters, character development, world building, etc. The Order Of The Phoenix is a masterpiece. <br /><br />I don't understand why everyone hates Dolores Umbridge. She's one of the most unique bitches I've ever read about. She is so evil yet has so much class. <br /><br />The battle between Albus and Voldemort is one of my favorite scenes in this entire series.<br /><br />I can go on and on about</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6733404444343242397\" style=\"display:none\">*RE-READ*<br /><br />This will always be one of my favorite Harry Potter books. There is so much of everything. There's action, drama, death, new characters, character development, world building, etc. The Order Of The Phoenix is a masterpiece. <br /><br />I don't understand why everyone hates Dolores Umbridge. She's one of the most unique bitches I've ever read about. She is so evil yet has so much class. <br /><br />The battle between Albus and Voldemort is one of my favorite scenes in this entire series.<br /><br />I can go on and on about how much I love this book.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6733404444343242397\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1359557380\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1359557380\" ref=\"like\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_18131947\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/18131947\" />\n    <a title=\"Crazy Uncle Ryan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/718763-crazy-uncle-ryan\"><img alt=\"Crazy Uncle Ryan\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1245851517p2/718763.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/18131947?book_show_action=false\">Feb 27, 2009</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Crazy Uncle Ryan\" class=\"user\" name=\"Crazy Uncle Ryan\" href=\"/user/show/718763-crazy-uncle-ryan\">Crazy Uncle Ryan</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/718763-crazy-uncle-ryan?shelf=books-that-rock\">books-that-rock</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/718763-crazy-uncle-ryan?shelf=books-i-own\">books-i-own</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n                  <em>\n                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,\n                    <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer18131947&#39;); return false;\">click here.</a>\n                  </em>\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer18131947\" class=\"readable\"\n                    style=\"display:none\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9902219101345699939\">Well, I know that for the last three books the story of how I read them has been less than epic but fear not, the story picks up a bit from here. Summer 2003 came along, I had just graduated from college and I was anxiously awaiting the release of the fifth Harry Potter book. I was so anxious in fact that I actually fell for and spread around the story that volume 5 would be called U+201CHarry Potter and The Green Flamed Torch.U+201D Not one of my prouder moments. As soon as the book became available for</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9902219101345699939\" style=\"display:none\">Well, I know that for the last three books the story of how I read them has been less than epic but fear not, the story picks up a bit from here. Summer 2003 came along, I had just graduated from college and I was anxiously awaiting the release of the fifth Harry Potter book. I was so anxious in fact that I actually fell for and spread around the story that volume 5 would be called U+201CHarry Potter and The Green Flamed Torch.U+201D Not one of my prouder moments. As soon as the book became available for preorder I went to my college computer lab (which I mysteriously still had access to) and ordered my copy online. Unfortunately, I failed to order it from an online store that would deliver it on the day it came out. It would be shipped on the day it came out. <br /><br />As it turned out, my brother got married the weekend of the bookU+2019s release. The wedding was on Friday and the book came out on Saturday. Saturday morning my sister, brother-in-law, my niece and I all got in their car and started heading home. We pulled off the highway into the first major town we could find and started driving around looking for a WalmartU+00AE so they could get their copies of the book. Finally, we spotted one and my sister and I started cheering like crazy people. My 1-U+00BD year old niece stared at us with a very confused look on her face as she wondered what in the world Crazy Uncle Ryan and mommy were doing. My sister and her husband both bought copies of the book and we started back out <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6288.The_Road\" title=\"The Road by Cormac McCarthy\">on the road</a>. As we drove we took turns reading out loud and as Harry was sitting with Luna and Neville on the HogwartsU+2019 Express we pulled into my apartment complex. They left me there and I was stuck without a book. I watched countless friends reading the book over the next few days. I expressly forbad them from telling me anything about what happened as I checked the mail every single day wondering when my copy would actually arrive. During that wait a nice girl I knew let me borrow her copy one evening as she told me she was not going to read any more that night. I ran back to my apartment with the book under my arm cackling fiendishly and I read as much as I could knowing that I would have to return the book the next day. All in all, I ended up using three or four different copies before I finished reading this book. I then didnU+2019t see it for at least a month as I loaned it out to several friends to read.<br /><br />There were several times during this book that I get really frustrated with Harry. These times involve him loosing his temper with Umbridge. So many times I just found myself shouting at the book telling Harry to control his temper and not yell at her again. That woman is the DEVIL! I canU+2019t think of any character in the whole series that I dislike more than her and I include Voldemort in that. ItU+2019s no wonder that Rowling named her Dolores Umbridge. The name U+201CDoloresU+201D comes from the Latin word for pain. U+201CUmbrageU+201D (yes, Rowling changed the spelling for the name) means U+201Canger or resentment caused by some real or imagined wrong.U+201D That certainly describes her attitude and outlook accurately. U+201CUmbrageU+201D can also mean a shadow. She certainly is a dark presence that seems to brood over people.<br /><br />This book also contains what I think are the two most powerful and moving scenes in the series. Neither of which, incidentally, made it into the movie version. The first of these is the scene in St. MungoU+2019s where we see Neville visiting his parents. That scene along with the battle in the Department of Mysteries should leave no doubt in any readerU+2019s mind that, in spite of the fact that he is rather clumsy and awkward, Neville is extremely brave and absolutely belongs in Gryffindor. The second is the scene at the end after SiriusU+2019 death when Harry rages at Dumbledore and their subsequent conversation. You finally see all the anger and sadness that had been building up inside Harry since the end of book 4 come out and we all FINALLY get the answer we had been waiting for so long as to why Voldemort came after Harry in the first place. ThatU+2019s a very good scene.<br /><br />Of course, one of the coolest parts in this book, if not in the whole series, is the wizardU+2019s duel between Dumbledore and Voldemort. I love how Dumbledore is dueling the most feared dark wizard ever and keeps calling him Tom and speaking to him as though he we still his teacher and Voldemort is nothing more than a misbehaving student. That and the scene where Dumbledore tells Fudge that he has no intentions of going to Azkaban and than proceeds to knock out everyone is his office and disappears with Fawkes in a flash of fire just make you realize that Dumbledore is the most awesome wizard ever.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9902219101345699939\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review18131947\">\n  <td id='like_container_review_18131947'><a id=\"like_count_review_18131947\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/18131947?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">28 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_18131947\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_18131947\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/18131947?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=3\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_18131947' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/18131947/comments?reverse=true\">View 2 comments</a><span
