class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 18131947, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_615213643\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/615213643\" />\n    <a title=\"Nina\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7664770-nina\"><img alt=\"Nina\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473158830p2/7664770.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/615213643?book_show_action=false\">May 19, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Nina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Nina\" href=\"/user/show/7664770-nina\">Nina</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810590\" href=\"/book/show/7955580-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=owned\">owned</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=5-star\">5-star</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=ya-pnr\">ya-pnr</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=read-in-2013\">read-in-2013</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=hp\">hp</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer615213643\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15233827905251666505\">I bawled my eyes out during the last fifty pages. I cried for almost an hour. I went to sleep at 1 AM with a headache, tachycardia and a slight fever. <s>I'm being perfectly Sirius.</s> Oh God, no, that was so lame. I'm sorry, guys.<br /><br />Aaannyyywwayyyy, this book shot my expectations through the roof. It's like J.K. Rowling keeps getting better, but to do this she needs to smash my heart to pieces that get smaller with every book.<br />For example, right here she has created my #1 Most Hated Character Of All Time</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15233827905251666505\" style=\"display:none\">I bawled my eyes out during the last fifty pages. I cried for almost an hour. I went to sleep at 1 AM with a headache, tachycardia and a slight fever. <s>I'm being perfectly Sirius.</s> Oh God, no, that was so lame. I'm sorry, guys.<br /><br />Aaannyyywwayyyy, this book shot my expectations through the roof. It's like J.K. Rowling keeps getting better, but to do this she needs to smash my heart to pieces that get smaller with every book.<br />For example, right here she has created my #1 Most Hated Character Of All Time (tie with Dan from SF, but that's a whole 'nother rant): Dolores Umbridge. Now, I swear, if I'm not developing this, it's because I know I would go on and on and on for about three Word pages.<br />Close on her heels is Bellatrix Lestrange, whom I'd probably hate more if I'd spent more time with her. Thankfully, I didn't, because I would have set the book on fire. She did the one and only thing that could have made break down, and I did - big time.<br />Another character that I used to hate is Snape, but now I think I actually love him a little bit. For one, he was bullied - by none other than <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[perfect James <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>, which explains a lot of things. (I know, there's probably around three people left in the entire world who haven't read this book, but you never know who might come across this.) For two, he's way more complex than he initially seemed. His involvement in the Order left me flabbergasted - not the simple fact that he was a part of it, but the way he acted. He was still an asshole, because that's just who he is, but he was badass too.<br />Mrs Weasley made me so mad with the way she tried to keep our heroes in the dark about what was happening and to control them. She has wonderfully good intentions, I know that, but you can't expect me to tolerate the way she treats these guys. They're fifteen, after all, and they've been through things more dangerous that anything she has ever faced.<br />I also got to hate James a little. Which is something I enjoyed like crazy, since I couldn't believe him as perfect as he was pictured in the first books. He was a conceited, insensitive bully, to put it plain and simple. And even though I would have liked not to like him, I'm still going through that phase where I'm impressed by the cool guy. Lily, on the other hand, was amazing. She actively loathed James, and that made me want to hug her. She's completely different from what I had imagined and I definitely hope we'll get to see more of the young Marauders, Lily and Snape. Yes, him too.<br />Oh, and hey! I was pretty pissed at Dumbledore, too. He's a bit of an idiot, to be honest, but his explanation in the end made everything so much better... and it made me cry so much harder. (Oh, God.) He's finally human now, isn't he? He has feelings and does stupid things. And he's badass, too. I finally got to see him in action!<br />For the first time ever, I felt more than a vague annoyance with Peeves - I actually liked him. Although he shows it in a particular way, he loves the school, guys! He's a brat, but he loves it, and he'd even do what people tell him to protect it.<br />Cho: such a <i>girl</i>. Get a fucking grip, bitch! Though it's good that she managed to put Harry off her, because now he's free to look for someone more worthy of him. (This is half ironic, but not quite. I have a bit of a hero worship thing going on here.)<br /><br />But do you know why I still loved this book so much it hurts? Because all of this stuff up there rings true. Not in the oh-yes-finally-this-character-is-not-that-perfect way, or in the there-need-to-be-villains-in-every-book way (and anyway at least half of the characters I wanted to beat up were not villains); for the simple reason that there are idiots and jackasses everywhere, all the time. They might have good intentions, they might simply be too stupid to understand the consequences of their actions, they might just be cruel, but they're there. I mean, you have no idea of how many people I would love to kill daily.<br /><br />A weird thing: despite the number of \"finally\"s and \"for the first time\"s that appear here, which hint that I should be satified with this book, I still crave more. <i>Unexpected</i>.<br /><br />---<br /><br />I don't know where to fit this in the text, so I'll leave it down here. (Yes, I still haven't mastered the art of writing a coherent review. If you can call the rants I write reviews.)<br />I have a never-ending and ever-growing admiration for Fred and George, because they're hilarious, brave and (okay, let's see if you can guess this one... [because self-deprecation is the weapon of the incompetent]) badass, but I'm getting more and more curious about Lee. I don't even know why, I just want to see more of him.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15233827905251666505\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review615213643\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1166766893, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1750967794\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1750967794\" />\n    <a title=\"Shahad takleef\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef\"><img alt=\"Shahad takleef\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453881901p2/35406752.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1750967794?book_show_action=false\">Oct 30, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Shahad takleef\" class=\"user\" name=\"Shahad takleef\" href=\"/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef\">Shahad takleef</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1750967794\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12002645492295799445\"><blockquote> <b>U+201CYouth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.U+201D </b> </blockquote><br><br><br><b>Actual rating : 4.5 stars </b><br><br>The order of the Phoenix , The fifth book of the series is a little bit controversial . the very same feeling harry had about his last week in Hogwarts , i do have about this whole book .<br>he thought that his week seemed to last much longer than it really did because it stretched between two universes , one with Sirius and one with out .<br>same experience i have wi</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12002645492295799445\" style=\"display:none\"><blockquote>\n  <b>U+201CYouth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.U+201D </b>\n</blockquote><br><br><br><b>Actual rating : 4.5 stars </b><br><br>The order of the Phoenix , The fifth book of the series is a little bit controversial . the very same feeling harry had about his last week in Hogwarts , i do have about this whole book .<br>he thought that his week seemed to last much longer than it really did because it stretched between two universes , one with Sirius and one with out .<br>same experience i have with the book , the time when i first opened the order of the phoenix and started reading seems literally a lifetime ago , and though maybe it was because meanwhile i was a bit distracted from reading by some real life matters , or that the book's gigantic length of nearly <b>900</b> pages can be a significant reason , but there is also the other reason , that this book too stretches between two universes , the one <b>Before</b> and the one <b>After</b> , and the cutting event is the blunt recognition of the war ahead , the actual cutting line is , <b>the beginning of the war.</b><br><br>The first half of the book was a bit slow paced , but then the second half would flow so rapidly you forget all about it , the book reaches itU+2019s climax when, after a dream, Harry and several other members of the studentU+2019s secret club theU+201CDAU+201D ( DumbledoreU+2019s Army) venture to the Ministry of Magic to prevent Voldermort from torturing Sirius (or so they think ) .<br><br>Both Harry and his readers are becoming adults throughout the duration of the series, the progression into a young adult is made evident in here through how Rowling shows a 15-year-old boy mind , harry deals with feelings of abandonment, yet heU+2019s also unable to stop thinking about how all the adults around him are either know-nothing , judgmental or unwilling to understand . He is definitely a lot angrier in this book . and there also were more fights and more arguments , In other words , heU+2019s 15 .<br>Yes , right . he is growing a bit annoying and he isn't my favorite character , at least not in this one , But ! literature at its best reflects real life, whether placed in a realistic or an unrealistic theme . <br>childrenU+2019s literature has been always showing that life is all rainbows and sun shines , when ever it <br>starts telling the truth its no children book anymore , But RowlingU+2019s turn at realistic adolescence places the Harry Potter series in the realm of great childrenU+2019s literature. <br><br>though I wouldn't have wanted to mention it , but its a bit hard not to , here this Major character loss is one of the most significant things that happened in this book , its utterly sad , I can even describe it devastating , because I think Sirius's death had came much earlier than it should .<br>we experienced one of the first real losses here .<br>I actually knew that Sirius black would die in this particular book , though no idea when or how , i was kind of waiting dreading the moment , though figures i had to wait for long 800 pages before my dread got confirmed , and inspite of that it still was shocking . i didn't expect it to happen this way , just like this , in the middle of a sentence , maybe i was kind of imagining a last moment conversation with harry , maybe because they never really had a proper one before , many things were pending between them , Harry actually never expressed himself to his Godfather , like Sirius never knew that the Dursleys we abusing , he was even surprised at some point that Harry was excited at the idea of leaving the Dursleys to live with him .<br>and though i neither watched the movie nor read the book before , but to tell you it was spoiled for me just the same , by FB posts , Tumblre , Pintrest and whatever else , but does it matter ? it really doesn't .<br>i usually do really mind spoilers , a series that's spoiled for me would be hard to catch my full attention , but as i said , not harry potter , its different here .<br><br><br><blockquote>\n  <b>U+201CWe've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.U+201D</b>\n</blockquote><br><br>P.S. : seriously did I skip talking about Fred and George ? these two are hilarious ! their bold witty behavior , indifference , sarcasm and spirit ! they are a comic relief in the darkest times .<br><b>Favorite characters ! </b>these two are always included (Duh!) .<br><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1474657351i/20629377._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12002645492295799445\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1541467940?book_show_action=false\">Sep 14, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"jamieson\" class=\"user\" name=\"jamieson\" href=\"/user/show/7706640-jamieson\">jamieson</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747551003\" href=\"/book/show/444327.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=read-in-2016\">read-in-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=childrens-literature\">childrens-literature</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=reread\">reread</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1541467940\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12597444448315477707\"><br /><br /><b><br /><br />OH MY GOD. I don't even have words for how much I LOVE this book.</b> It's second in the series, to Deathly Hallows in my favourites list <i>I just love it so much</i> Everything about it makes me so happy. <br /><br />Why? <br /><br />Well first of all, there's leaps and bounds in terms of plot development. Things are starting to get dark, they're starting to get serious and it sets the tone for the next two books to come. I love Harry coming to take on his role as \"The Chosen One\"<br /><br />Secondly, side characters! Thanks to the DA, we</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12597444448315477707\" style=\"display:none\"><br /><br /><b><br /><br />OH MY GOD. I don't even have words for how much I LOVE this book.</b> It's second in the series, to Deathly Hallows in my favourites list <i>I just love it so much</i> Everything about it makes me so happy. <br /><br />Why? <br /><br />Well first of all, there's leaps and bounds in terms of plot development. Things are starting to get dark, they're starting to get serious and it sets the tone for the next two books to come. I love Harry coming to take on his role as \"The Chosen One\"<br /><br />Secondly, side characters! Thanks to the DA, we get to see soo much more of the school aside from the golden trio. Neville, Luna, GINNY, Fred and George, Dean, Seamus, Tonks, Sirius, Remus, Cho and soo many other characters who I just adore SHINE and it makes me so happy. I love the side characters as much as the trio and they get so much more screen time (page time?) then in earlier books<br /><br />SO MANY COOL SCENES: I mean, the Weasley escape, the interview in three broomsticks, every DA meeting, Harry's first date, THE QUIDDITCH PITCH BRAWL, Umbridge being taken by Centaurs, the fight in the ministry, Dumbledore and Voldermorts epic duel ! There are so many scenes to love in this one. Literally institutional scenes like DA and the Weasley's leaving school can be exclusively found in ootp and I love them so much. <br /><br />I also just think OoTP is SO funny? I mean, the whole school rioting against Umbridge, the twins pranks, the DA meetings, the things said about Harry / that Harry says back. I laugh out loud when I'm reading this book, and I don't usually properly laugh when I'm reading. <br /><br />I literally just don't understand how anyone can not like ootp. I mean, beside the very sad events at the end, it's perfect. And EVEN that sad event <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[RIP SIRIUS ORION BLACK YOU DESERVED BETTER <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> gives us such a beautiful moment between Albus and Harry, that is sad, but also so incredibly human and heartbreaking and such an insight into the humanity and love that drives Harry's character it's amazing. <br /><br />anyway, tbh it's harry potter I shouldn't have to say much I loved reading this with all my heart, obviously. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12597444448315477707\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter id=\"reviewTextContainer1322961982\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8831058268709023056\">As someone who did it all wrong and watched the movies first (shame on me, I know!) this is my first time reading the series. I already know what happens, so reading the books is like having a super awesome extended version of what I already knew. Being that said... and knowing what happens in this particular book... <b> <u>I WAS NOT READY FOR WHAT I FELT.</u> </b> I am heartbroken, I am destroyed, I cried a river and I am not okay.<br><br>All I have to say is that Sirius Black is, and always will be, my favorite cha</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8831058268709023056\" style=\"display:none\">As someone who did it all wrong and watched the movies first (shame on me, I know!) this is my first time reading the series. I already know what happens, so reading the books is like having a super awesome extended version of what I already knew. Being that said... and knowing what happens in this particular book... <b>\n  <u>I WAS NOT READY FOR WHAT I FELT.</u>\n</b> I am heartbroken, I am destroyed, I cried a river and I am not okay.<br><br>All I have to say is that Sirius Black is, and always will be, my favorite character in this wonderful saga.<br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1476134687ra/20805690.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>I LOVE YOU FOREVER.</span>\n  <a class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1356213861\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1356213861\" />\n    <a title=\"Kate U+2661\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/15154637-kate\"><img alt=\"Kate U+2661\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450402290p2/15154637.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1356213861?book_show_action=false\">May 28, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Kate U+2661\" class=\"user\" name=\"Kate U+2661\" href=\"/user/show/15154637-kate\">Kate U+2661</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855690\" href=\"/book/show/22844196-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15154637-kate?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15154637-kate?shelf=books-i-own\">books-i-own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15154637-kate?shelf=2016-read\">2016-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1356213861\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14786608769756159746\"><b>BLOG REVIEW:</b><br /><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/2016/05/28/harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix-book-review/\" rel=\"nofollow\">https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/20...</a><br /><br /><i>(my blog review has more content... It's better, I promise)</i><br /><br />From the moment I started this book, I knew it would end up being my favourite in the Harry Potter series so far, and I was not mistaken. I loved this book so much. It's definitely going in my favourites of all time list.<br /><br />This novel took me sooo long to read it, and I mean come on, give me a break, it was 800 pages... However somehow, Rowling made not even one page feel tedious or boring</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14786608769756159746\" style=\"display:none\"><b>BLOG REVIEW:</b><br /><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/2016/05/28/harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix-book-review/\" rel=\"nofollow\">https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/20...</a><br /><br /><i>(my blog review has more content... It's better, I promise)</i><br /><br />From the moment I started this book, I knew it would end up being my favourite in the Harry Potter series so far, and I was not mistaken. I loved this book so much. It's definitely going in my favourites of all time list.<br /><br />This novel took me sooo long to read it, and I mean come on, give me a break, it was 800 pages... However somehow, Rowling made not even one page feel tedious or boring, which is amazing, considering its size.<br /><br />Perhaps I should've written notes whilst reading this, because I can't remember a lot in detail anymore as I read it over such a long time-span. Therefore, I make no promises about this review being any form of decent. (or in chronological order)<br /><br />The characters, I feel, in this book developed so much throughout, and really just left me loving (or hating, *cough* Umbridge *cough*) them even more, which I can't believe is even possible. <br /><br />It was so interesting to see into Snapes memories, and that whole scene in my head, rather than on screen. I can't wait to read more into Snape in the future books, he is such a complex character.<br /><br />I also loved Dumbledore as much as ever, as well as McGonagall (who was SO sassy in this book), her sass was honestly the best. I found myself cheering her along most of the time.<br />Harrys friendship circle continues to grow and develop, I love reading how they all interact and protect one other.<br /><br />Sirius, the whole Order, and the Weasleys, I just loved! Especially at the end when everyone had Harrys back. Ah, love it.<br /><br />Umbridge, OH, don't even get me started on her... she was possibly even worse in the book than in the movie, I truly thought that wouldn't be possible, but *hem hem*, that woman is insane.<br /><br />You'll notice I'm spreading a few quotes out throughout this review, and that's because I couldn't simply choose just one to include. If you're reading them, I'm sure you'd understand why.<br /><br />Anyway, I noticed whilst reading this that there is so much in the book that is not in the movie! I actually loved that aspect, because it gave me a bit of surprise and apprehension when reading it.<br /><br />I also found that I got so much more out of the book, than in the movie, which is to be expected, but, having watched the movies countless times, it was amazing to be able to pick up the things I may have missed simply by watching it play out on screen. The whole 'prophecy' aspect, what that entailed, the small details, and even just the depths of the characters I found that I understood so much more by reading this.<br /><br />Basically, I just loved and adored this novel, and it is definitely my favourite in the series so far. I'm so excited to read the last 2, because those are the movies I remember least about, and I even find that I don't fully understand everything that goes on in Deathly Hallows.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14786608769756159746\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext         <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n                  <em>\n                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,\n                    <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer53334843&#39;); return false;\">click here.</a>\n                  </em>\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer53334843\" class=\"readable\"\n                    style=\"display:none\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10444737349945340504\">This is where I stopped reading the Harry Potter series. I kept up with the happenings enough to know who died and how by the end, but overall, this book sealed my opinion of Rowling and the books she was churning out.<br /><br />This book read like marshmallow fluff cranked out by a money-hungry layabout. There was no substance, Harry was an emotional turd for the entire book (including PAGES of him YELLING IN ALL CAPS AT HIS FRIENDS BECAUSE THEY JUST DON'T UNDERSTAND HIM WAAAAAH), and then there was the \"</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10444737349945340504\" style=\"display:none\">This is where I stopped reading the Harry Potter series. I kept up with the happenings enough to know who died and how by the end, but overall, this book sealed my opinion of Rowling and the books she was churning out.<br /><br />This book read like marshmallow fluff cranked out by a money-hungry layabout. There was no substance, Harry was an emotional turd for the entire book (including PAGES of him YELLING IN ALL CAPS AT HIS FRIENDS BECAUSE THEY JUST DON'T UNDERSTAND HIM WAAAAAH), and then there was the \"villain\" that had to actually TRY to be more annoying than Harry himself for the whole book.<br /><br />She was, of course, but that's not really an accomplishment. And neither was this installment of the HP.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10444737349945340504\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review53334843\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link53334843\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=53334843&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_53334843'><a id=\"like_count_review_53334843\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/53334843?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">23 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_53334843\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_53334843\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=23&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=53334843&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_53334843\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 53334843, true, &#39;&#39;); Sery-ously?\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2926860-serena-sery-ously\"><img alt=\"Serena.. Sery-ously?\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1456926939p2/2926860.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1734403934?book_show_action=false\">Oct 15, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Serena.. Sery-ously?\" class=\"user\" name=\"Serena.. Sery-ously?\" href=\"/user/show/2926860-serena-sery-ously\">Serena.. class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_582891417\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/582891417\" />\n    <a title=\"Angela\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4255477-angela\"><img alt=\"Angela\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398251387p2/4255477.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/582891417?book_show_action=false\">Mar 28, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Angela\" class=\"user\" name=\"Angela\" href=\"/user/show/4255477-angela\">Angela</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Kindle Edition \" href=\"/book/show/13563636-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=ya\">ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=middle-grade\">middle-grade</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=kindle\">kindle</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2014-read\">2014-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2016-read\">2016-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer582891417\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5581218478420866054\">The longest book - by more than a hundred pages - in the series, many have complained that this is one of their least favorites. And I admit, it was my 2nd least favorite for a very long time. When I finally re-read it a few years ago, I revised my opinion. It's now one of my top favorites.<br /><br />When I first read it, as a young-adult, I was really annoyed with Harry's actions and attitude. I got frustrated with his frustrations and anger. It's funny that it took me getting older to actually become mor</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5581218478420866054\" style=\"display:none\">The longest book - by more than a hundred pages - in the series, many have complained that this is one of their least favorites. And I admit, it was my 2nd least favorite for a very long time. When I finally re-read it a few years ago, I revised my opinion. It's now one of my top favorites.<br /><br />When I first read it, as a young-adult, I was really annoyed with Harry's actions and attitude. I got frustrated with his frustrations and anger. It's funny that it took me getting older to actually become more understanding of this. I'm not sure if I was too close to that defiance and attitude from my own teenage years, and too disgusted with how I treated people during it, or what, but I've come to be incredibly sympathetic and understanding. Harry is actually quite reserved and thoughtful in this book, considering the circumstances. And he actually has excellent reasons for feeling the way he does.<br /><br />That's not to say that I'm not frustrated ever during this book, I definitely still get frustrated. It's just for different reasons now. Mostly, the same reasons as Harry. A lot is being held back from Harry in this book, and I really think he deserves to know more. More knowledge - as Dumbledore, especially, should know - is never a bad thing. And perhaps if he'd known a bit more, there wouldn't have been quite the devastation to follow.<br /><br />I know everyone loves Molly Weasley...I'm not one of them, at least not in this book. I love that she loves Harry, and she considers him \"as good as\" one of her sons, but she, like Ron, got on my nerves in this book. It's not her place to decide what's right for Harry. She did something similar in Prisoner of Azkaban and her brand of \"protection\" actually leaves Harry open to more danger. I wish she'd realize that, and stop trying to help.<br /><br />And, I know you're supposed to but, I HATE Umbridge. I can't even express the amount of hate that I have for this woman. She's a very good cautionary tale about what happens when zealotry has power. Something that's even more scary to me right now, what with the insanity going on within the democratic system in the US at the moment.<br /><br />So many things to love though!<br /><br />1. Tonks - <i>I'd almost like to be a metamorphagus</i><br />2. 12 Grimmauld Place - <i>I love the play on words that JKR uses</i><br />3. Ginny (in general) - <i>considering how much I disliked her in Chamber of Secrets, this is a huge thing</i><br />4. Extendable Ears - <i>I love Fred and George</i><br />5. Doxies<br />6. Department of Mysteries<br />7. Dumbledore's testimony<br />8. Luna Lovegood<br />9. Quibbler<br />10. Sorting Hat's Song - <i>and this leads into one of my biggest regrets with the series as a whole - I'll touch on it in my </i>Deathly Hallows<i> review</i><br />11. O.W.Ls - Ordinary Wizarding Levels<br />12. I must not tell lies. - <i>GRRRRRRRR</i><br />13. Angelina Quidditch Captain<br />14. Boys trying to get in Girls dormitory - <i>LOL! I love the slide</i><br />15. Snape vs Umbridge<br />16. Dumbledore's Army<br />17. \"Weasley is our king!\"<br />18. Ginny - again<br />19. St. Mungo's<br />20. Droobles Best Blowing Gum wrapper<br />21. McGonagall vs Umbridge<br />22. \"Give her hell from us, Peeves.\"<br />23. Fred & George vs Umbridge<br />24. All teachers vs Umbridge<br />25. Neville, Ginny (yes again), Luna, Hermione and Ron<br /><br />I also really love Dumbledore. I know that, in this book in particular, he's not everyone's favorite - and I question him myself sometimes - but by the end I adore him more than ever.<br /><br />I can't say that I love the end, but it's amazingly well done - it brings out a boatload of emotions in me, and I think that's probably why it was one of my least favorites - the emotions hit a bit too close to home when I read it originally, and then I have always associated this book with that time in my life. It's natural, but now that the pain's lessened a bit, I can look back on it and feel the missing naturally. And... well ... I do love it for that, I guess. It's so real and true. The emotions are honest and real. <br /><br />This book has gradually become one of my favorites in the entire series - and it's so much better than the movie. Honestly, if you think they can fit 870 pages into a single movie, then I don't even know what to say. There's so much that's truncated or missing entirely. Things that are moved to the next movie, or never even mentioned. And as I read this time I was struck, again, but how vivid and deep this world is, and how much I love being in it.<br /><br />This review also available at <a href=\"http://thebookeaters.net/2016/03/19/review-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix-2/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Book Eaters</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5581218478420866054\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review582891417\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link582891417\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=582891417&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_582891417'><a id=\"like_count_review_582891417\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/582891417?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">22 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_582891417\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_582891417\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=22&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=582891417&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/582891417?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=3\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_582891417' style='display: none;'>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1262407515\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1262407515\" />\n    <a title=\"Steve\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\"><img alt=\"Steve\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1262407515?book_show_action=false\">May 02, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Steve\" class=\"user\" name=\"Steve\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\">Steve</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015\">read-in-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=rmfao-2015-genre-challenge\">rmfao-2015-genre-challenge</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya\">ya</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1262407515\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7189535864865186254\">I have to laugh at myself for writing a review after thousands upon thousands already written (I think just about everyone on my friends list and all of the people I follow have read and rated/reviewed it!), but I just have to throw in my two cents. I could not put it down! I gasped out loud several times as I read the last few chapters, causing my wife to ask me what was wrong. I am a 50-year old management analyst who is probably the most even-keeled person you'll ever meet, and not given to</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7189535864865186254\" style=\"display:none\">I have to laugh at myself for writing a review after thousands upon thousands already written (I think just about everyone on my friends list and all of the people I follow have read and rated/reviewed it!), but I just have to throw in my two cents. I could not put it down! I gasped out loud several times as I read the last few chapters, causing my wife to ask me what was wrong. I am a 50-year old management analyst who is probably the most even-keeled person you'll ever meet, and not given to emotional outbursts. The book really grabs your interest and holds it! I'm really glad I accepted the RMFAO Young Adult challenge, as well as the challenge from my son and daughter-in-law!<br /><br />Other reviews state that the Harry Potter books are not terribly original in their plots, characters, settings, etc., and I have to agree. However, the books are EXTREMELY well written so far. Very little happens that is not foreshadowed in some small way hundreds of pages earlier in the book, or in a previous book, and the foreshadowing is completely seamless. The overall effect is that, even though there ARE surprises, everything makes sense. It gives all of the fantastic events a feel of \"reasonableness\". There is nothing in the book that does not have a reason for being there. All of the events fit together perfectly, like the pieces of an extremely complex puzzle.<br /><br />The use of language is superb. The descriptions of people, things, situations, and so on are very engaging. It is hard to use the word \"realistic\" about a fantasy setting, but the descriptions really draw you into the story. You feel that you are living the story, truly feeling the emotions of the characters. You can feel Harry's powerful, heart-rending sorrow and remorse at the end of the book as if it were your own. You can feel the fear, suspense, anger, joy, laughter, and fury that you would feel if the events of the story were truly happening to you.<br /><br />The characters are the most engaging aspect of the book. They are so well done that you can immediately relate to them. The setting may be fantastic, but the characters are very, very real. More than that, you come to truly care about the characters. What happens to them matters to you. When someone dies in the book, you feel the loss personally. It is as if someone you knew and liked, someone close to you, had died.<br /><br />In my opinion, the fifth book is the best of the series so far, and I can't wait to start number six. I feel that some of the other reviewers are overly fussy in their criticisms of the main character and the feelings he displays in this book. Two of the main themes of this book -- death and the turbulent emotions of adolescent men -- are much more mature than those of the previous books. Book four dealt with death in some small way, but it was a \"clean\" death in that the main character could not reasonably feel any responsibility for it. Death in this book is \"messy\"; there is plenty of guilt to stir in with sorrow and remorse.<br /><br />On to the next one!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7189535864865186254\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1262407515\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/137775900\" />\n    <a title=\"Priscilla\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4731097-priscilla\"><img alt=\"Priscilla\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451806103p2/4731097.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/137775900?book_show_action=false\">Apr 29, 2011</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Priscilla\" class=\"user\" name=\"Priscilla\" href=\"/user/show/4731097-priscilla\">Priscilla</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer137775900\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2182417167523639071\">Ugh.. my heart. So.. heavy.<br /><br />Quick thoughts:<br /><br />1. Really intense and dark.<br />2. Fantastical spells, jinxes, and charms. I love magic.<br />3. I want to know more about Moony, Padfoot and Prongs.<br />4. Writing is superb, invoking intense emotions. I almost cried .___.<br />5. Now I know why Weasly is my king :)<br /><br />A month to finish?! T__T I do not like that.<br /><br />Full review soon.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1198405731\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1198405731\" />\n    <a title=\"Jonathan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6313408-jonathan\"><img alt=\"Jonathan\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478230200p2/6313408.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1198405731?book_show_action=false\">Feb 18, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jonathan\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jonathan\" href=\"/user/show/6313408-jonathan\">Jonathan</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747561071\" href=\"/book/show/862631.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=children-s-literature\">children-s-literature</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=worldbuilding\">worldbuilding</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1198405731\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7563777096552070591\">This is probably the best entry in the Harry Potter series to this point. In my personal opinion, the novels begin as average stories at best - with Rowling trying to gain a proper control over her writing voice and style. They do show delightful promise with the worldbuilding and some sense of nice-enough characters, but all in all it's clear that marketing played a huge hand in selling the books early on. I'm not cynical enough to say marketing was all that did it, Rowling has a distinctly</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7563777096552070591\" style=\"display:none\">This is probably the best entry in the Harry Potter series to this point. In my personal opinion, the novels begin as average stories at best - with Rowling trying to gain a proper control over her writing voice and style. They do show delightful promise with the worldbuilding and some sense of nice-enough characters, but all in all it's clear that marketing played a huge hand in selling the books early on. I'm not cynical enough to say marketing was all that did it, Rowling has a distinctly British charm and humour that shines even through her early books (and the world of Hogwarts provides a fantastic fantasy setting). However, something is missing from the first three books that is more present in this novel.<br /><br />Perhaps it is the nuanced political commentary - through displaying the failing inner workings of the Ministry of Magic Rowling appears to provide a critique on normal human political systems. The ideas that she displays include that in trying to do 'good' often laws are designed for those in power to keep power and secondly that those in power often fight among each other for power when they should be fighting bigger problems facing the world. This rings true for politics in Australia at the moment in particular where it seems as if the government and opposition government are busier fighting internal party battles than actually passing legislation. <br /><br />Perhaps it is the increased (and improved) characterisation present in this novel that causes this to be a more improved novel. You have Harry, Hermione and Ron showing more depth to different aspects of their personalities with their various fears and desires as teenagers and heroes being exposed. The fact that Harry houses more raw anger in this novel to go alongside his perfect heroic goodness leads him to become a more three dimensional figure. The same applies to his friends, however I think the most development of side characters is shown through Dumbledore and Snape. Firstly, because Dumbledore has more of an active role in this novel's plot and secondly because we see some of Snape's tragic, misunderstood, childhood. <br /><br />All I can admit is that this series is growing on me and I can see the unique brilliance and appeal now in how the audience for Harry Potter grew up alongside the characters. It's a nice series, if not particularly groundbreaking, with some charming moments and a clever magical world. I look forward to seeing how the last two books now play out. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7563777096552070591\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1198405731\">\n  <td class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_3906531\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3906531\" />\n    <a title=\"Ren the Unclean\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/243750-ren-the-unclean\"><img alt=\"Ren the Unclean\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1326754151p2/243750.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/3906531?book_show_action=false\">Aug 07, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Ren the Unclean\" class=\"user\" name=\"Ren the Unclean\" href=\"/user/show/243750-ren-the-unclean\">Ren the Unclean</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">did not like it</span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">Hardcore Harry Potter fans only.</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/243750-ren-the-unclean?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer3906531\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4866791154694753216\">This is the worst Harry Potter book. The characterization is unbelievable and annoying, taking the various holes in the world J.K. has created with Harry Potter and throwing them in the face of the reader with the expectation that they will accept anything at this point. Events in the world that main characters (and by extension, the reader) find outrageous and crazy are accepted by everyone else in the world without adequate reasons for their acceptance.<br /><br />Harry whines incessantly throughout this</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4866791154694753216\" style=\"display:none\">This is the worst Harry Potter book. The characterization is unbelievable and annoying, taking the various holes in the world J.K. has created with Harry Potter and throwing them in the face of the reader with the expectation that they will accept anything at this point. Events in the world that main characters (and by extension, the reader) find outrageous and crazy are accepted by everyone else in the world without adequate reasons for their acceptance.<br /><br />Harry whines incessantly throughout this book. The entire time he is complaining about not getting what he wants and people not liking him, while turning away attempts by his friends to help him. He sort of acts like this throughout the rest of the series, but his outlook of wanting help from everyone except those who are trying to help him is really stressed in this book.<br /><br />This book also contains one of J.K.'s now signature death scenes. Rather than turning the death of a character into something touching and important to the reader, it happens in one sentence and it is not really apparent what exactly is happening. I had to go back and re-read the death scene after they started talking about it in later chapters because I was not sure that it actually had happened. Every one of the deaths throughout the rest of the book is (poorly) written in exactly this same way.<br /><br />In short, the only reason to read this book is because it is part of the series. I would almost suggest just watching the movie instead, as it is about five times better. I only wish that this book did not bring down the rest of the series by making the inconsistancies and logical problems in J.K.'s world abundantly obvious.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4866791154694753216\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext id=\"freeTextContainer3146974537704766800\">This book. It's the longest. It has some of the most wonderful scenes, and it's the beginning of the end! I adore this series and I have adored rereading it so far but I have to say I think that this one is probably the one which felt most exciting to me as I've only read this once many, many years back and had almost entirely forgotten the second half of the book. Therefore, some of the events which happened terrified, enchanted and enraged me so much.<br /><br />I love seeing Sirius and Harry's relationsh</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3146974537704766800\" style=\"display:none\">This book. It's the longest. It has some of the most wonderful scenes, and it's the beginning of the end! I adore this series and I have adored rereading it so far but I have to say I think that this one is probably the one which felt most exciting to me as I've only read this once many, many years back and had almost entirely forgotten the second half of the book. Therefore, some of the events which happened terrified, enchanted and enraged me so much.<br /><br />I love seeing Sirius and Harry's relationship grow, I also love that we're introduced to the Order and the DA, both respectable, worthy causes!<br />We also get Umbridge though.... Gahhhh I hate Umbridge....and Bellatrix, and Voldamort himself I guess (although I never hated him as much as those two ladies just mentioned!)<br />So much exciting and very dramatic stuff happens in this. We see Dumbledore preoccupied and taking a back-seat, we see power shifts and changes to the rules, we see court trials, songs, jokes, pranks, Quiddich, training and SO MUCH MORE.<br /><br />These books for me are a massive part of my life, and they are just divine. I love this one so much and I am so looking forward to continuing, but not to having to eave this world again! Naturally a 5*s :)</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"3146974537704766800\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer857868577786487343\">This book really made my CRY. And it was not just tears, I was CRYING out loud. If you've read it (or at least have seen the movie) you surely know that a very important character dies and GOD, it was heart wrenching, the tears came flowing like a waterfall. I didn't want him to die :(... <br /><br />Overall, I really liked this book, but I think it was way too long, it had some chapters that weren't relevant to the story... <br /><br />BUT THEN... there are some chapters I loved! I think my favorites were \"Snape's Wor</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText857868577786487343\" style=\"display:none\">This book really made my CRY. And it was not just tears, I was CRYING out loud. If you've read it (or at least have seen the movie) you surely know that a very important character dies and GOD, it was heart wrenching, the tears came flowing like a waterfall. I didn't want him to die :(... <br /><br />Overall, I really liked this book, but I think it was way too long, it had some chapters that weren't relevant to the story... <br /><br />BUT THEN... there are some chapters I loved! I think my favorites were \"Snape's Worst Memory\" (Just... Padfoot, Prongs and Moony, what else can I ask for?) and \"The Centaur and the Sneak\" (Dumbledore was AWESOME in this one!).<br /><br />ALSO: Characters that kicked ass in this book:<br />- Professor McGonagall (WOW).<br />- Fred and George Weasley.<br />- Dumbledore.<br />- Sirius.<br />- Remus.<br /><br />AND... I hate Umbridge. <br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"857868577786487343\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review916286770\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link916286770\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=all-timefavorites\">all-timefavorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/202724-jessica?shelf=read-aloud\">read-aloud</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer3235900\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer18030078058383060673\">My favorite. My absolute favorite book in the series. The double whammy of Voldemort and Umbridge, the first major death, Harry being defamed by the ministry, it's all too wonderful. And it turns out that my kids agree. This has been the one that has really gotten my daughter (who just turned 8) fully invested in the series, and my oldest son (11) who already knows the story also claims this as his favorite. </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review3235900\">\n itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/403851871\" />\n    <a title=\"Veronique\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/12371602-veronique\"><img alt=\"Veronique\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1346344137p2/12371602.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/403851871?book_show_action=false\">Oct 12, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Veronique\" class=\"user\" name=\"Veronique\" href=\"/user/show/12371602-veronique\">Veronique</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747570721\" href=\"/book/show/1213852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=favourites-5and4-5\">favourites-5and4-5</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=2016\">2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer403851871\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5348574570511713601\">4.5<br /><br />The U+2018angryU+2019 book. <br /><br />I personally didnU+2019t mind Harry loosing his temper. When you consider his life and experiences up to this point, it is amazing that he hasnU+2019t U+2018lostU+2019 it before!<br /><br />Rowling took a lot of the usual elements away in this instalment. Dumbledore and Hagrid are U+2018absentU+2019 for most of the book, leaving Harry alone/isolated to deal with difficult situations and feelings, which I guess is a part of growing up. Additionally, the Hogwarts Headmaster is shown to be U+2018humanU+2019 after all and not an</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5348574570511713601\" style=\"display:none\">4.5<br /><br />The U+2018angryU+2019 book. <br /><br />I personally didnU+2019t mind Harry loosing his temper. When you consider his life and experiences up to this point, it is amazing that he hasnU+2019t U+2018lostU+2019 it before!<br /><br />Rowling took a lot of the usual elements away in this instalment. Dumbledore and Hagrid are U+2018absentU+2019 for most of the book, leaving Harry alone/isolated to deal with difficult situations and feelings, which I guess is a part of growing up. Additionally, the Hogwarts Headmaster is shown to be U+2018humanU+2019 after all and not an infallible person. Things aren't black or white, but various shades of grey, and what Harry took for granted is again and again shown not to be so.<br /><br />It was inevitable that the tone of this book would be darker and more threatening now that Voldemort is back, but the creation of the odious Dolores Umbridge was a stroke of genius, especially with her toad-like girlish appearance. I still shiver at the sight of pink kittens platesU+2026 Luna is a lovely addition and Neville is finally showing his inner worth.<br /><br />For the longest book of the series, it does read very quickly :0)</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5348574570511713601\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review403851871\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link403851871\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=403851871&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_403851871'><a id=\"like_count_review_403851871\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/403851871?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">21 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_403851871\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_403851871\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=21&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=403851871&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_403851871\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 403851871, true, &#39;&#39;); id=\"reviewTextContainer857517162\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5652689501838336614\"><blockquote> <i>U+201CThings we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.U+201D</i> </blockquote><br>One of my favourites,even though Umbridge is a part of it.But seriously,I adore Harry in this one.We also have the always wise Hermione,our king Weasley,\"Loony\" Lovegood,badass Neville(who needs a spell when you can pretty much dig someone's eyes out with the wand),Sirius...(I totally didn't cry,especially when Lupin said: <i>\"There's nothing you can do, Harry... nothing... he's gone.\"</i>),and of course,F</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5652689501838336614\" style=\"display:none\"><blockquote>\n  <i>U+201CThings we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.U+201D</i>\n</blockquote><br>One of my favourites,even though Umbridge is a part of it.But seriously,I adore Harry in this one.We also have the always wise Hermione,our king Weasley,\"Loony\" Lovegood,badass Neville(who needs a spell when you can pretty much dig someone's eyes out with the wand),Sirius...(I totally didn't cry,especially when Lupin said: <i>\"There's nothing you can do, Harry... nothing... he's gone.\"</i>),and of course,FRED AND GEORGE.U+2665<br><blockquote>\n  <i>U+201CWe won't be seeing you,\" Fred told Professor Umbridge, swinging his leg over his broomstick.<br>\"Yeah, don't bother to keep in touch,\" said George, mounting his own.</i>\n</blockquote><br>Also,I was laughing so much while reading this,there are some simply hilarious lines(the twins,sarcastic Harry,etc.) but there are also many sad moments and moments&lines that just make you think,you know,about life,love,family,death.I seriously applaud good ol' J.K.Rowling for writing this masterpiece.<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1437399118i/15581234._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"400\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Favourite quotes:<br><br>U+201CIs it true that you shouted at Professor Umbridge?\"<br>\"Yes.\"<br>\"You called her a liar?\"<br>\"Yes.\"<br>\"You told her He Who Must Not Be Named is back?\"<br>\"Yes.\"<br>\"<b>Have a biscuit, Potter</b>.U+201D <br><br>U+201CYou're a prefect? Oh Ronnie! That's everyone in the family!\"<br>\"<b>What are Fred and I? Next door neighbors</b>?U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head</b>!U+201D <br><br>U+201CHello, Harry\" said George, beaming at him. \"We thought we heard your dulcet tones.\"<br>\"You don't want to bottle up your anger like that, Harry, let it all out,\" said Fred, also beaming. \"<b>There might be a couple of people fifty miles away who didn't hear you</b>.U+201D<br><br>U+201CHarry, don't go picking a row with Malfoy, don't forget, he's a prefect now, he could make life difficult for you...\"<br>\"<b>Wow, I wonder what it'd be like to have a difficult life</b>?\" said Harry sarcastically.U+201D <br><br>U+201CHow long have you been U+2018Big DU+2019 then?U+201D said Harry.<br>U+201CShut it,U+201D snarled Dudley, turning away again.<br>U+201CCool name,U+201D said Harry, grinning and falling into step beside his cousin. U+201C<b>But youU+2019ll always be Ickle Diddykins to me</b>.U+201D<br><br>U+201CYouU+2019re going to pay,U+201D said Malfoy in a voice barely louder than a<br>whisper. U+201C<b>IU+2019m going to make you pay for what youU+2019ve done to my<br>father</b>. . . .U+201D<br>U+201CWell, IU+2019m terrified now,U+201D said Harry sarcastically. U+201C<b>I sU+2019pose Lord<br>VoldemortU+2019s just a warm-up act compared to you three</b> U+2014 whatU+2019s the matter?U+201D <br><br>U+201CWell, I dreamed I was playing Quidditch the other night,' said Ron, screwing up his face in an effort to remember. 'What d'you reckon that means?'<br>'<b>Probably that you're going to be eaten by a giant marshmallow or something</b>,' said Harry.U+201D <br><br>U+201C<b>One more lesson like that and I might just do a Weasley</b>.U+201D </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5652689501838336614\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div
