<div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_3314538\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/3314538\" />\n    <a title=\"Nicole\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/163750-nicole\"><img alt=\"Nicole\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1189653481p2/163750.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/3314538?book_show_action=false\">Apr 21, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Nicole\" class=\"user\" name=\"Nicole\" href=\"/user/show/163750-nicole\">Nicole</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/163750-nicole?shelf=read-more-than-once\">read-more-than-once</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/163750-nicole?shelf=five-star-novels\">five-star-novels</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/163750-nicole?shelf=favourite-characters\">favourite-characters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/163750-nicole?shelf=magic-slingers\">magic-slingers</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer3314538\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9066044976430559146\">First read in 2003; re-read in 2006.<br />I know some people who complained about Harry being so angry in this book, but I think he has the right to be. HeU+2019s traumatized over VoldemortU+2019s return and CedricU+2019s death, very few people believe heU+2019s telling the truth about Voldemort, and heU+2019s being kept in the dark by the people he trusts and cares about. The formation of DumbledoreU+2019s Army is enjoyable because it finally gives Harry a chance to take on a leadership role, and his fellow students get to learn</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9066044976430559146\" style=\"display:none\">First read in 2003; re-read in 2006.<br />I know some people who complained about Harry being so angry in this book, but I think he has the right to be. HeU+2019s traumatized over VoldemortU+2019s return and CedricU+2019s death, very few people believe heU+2019s telling the truth about Voldemort, and heU+2019s being kept in the dark by the people he trusts and cares about. The formation of DumbledoreU+2019s Army is enjoyable because it finally gives Harry a chance to take on a leadership role, and his fellow students get to learn valuable skills that the foolish Ministry of Magic, deep in denial, wonU+2019t teach them. Hermione, Ron, Neville, and Luna also all really start to bloom throughout this sequence of events.<br />However, Rowling doesnU+2019t skimp on exploring the consequences of human faults and weaknesses, and her characters make some truly painful and tragic decisions. DumbledoreU+2019s distancing himself from Harry, SnapeU+2019s and SiriusU+2019s inability to let go of the past, the adultsU+2019 failure to impress upon Harry how very important it is that he shield his mind from Voldemort, and HarryU+2019s own impulsive tendency to leap to his loved onesU+2019 defense all combine and result in terrible outcomes.<br />To top it off, making everything worse, is Umbridge, the bureaucrat from hell. IU+2019ve heard it said and agree that for most of the book, UmbridgeU+2019s evil, deluded ways upstage the danger of the Voldemort situation. There she is, centre stage, literally torturing children in the name of following the rules. I love everyoneU+2019s attempts to outmaneuver her. The way McGonagall especially deals with Umbridge is priceless, and the Weasley twinsU+2019 fireworks assault and final departure are fabulous. <br />I wanted to dock this book one star for a long time because of the way certain plot twists broke my heart, but I have to give Rowling credit for creating such a complex, nuanced story and such interesting, believable characters. If she didnU+2019t do such a good job, I wouldnU+2019t care so much about what happens to the characters.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9066044976430559146\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border \n\n<div id=\"review_1211530723\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1211530723\" />\n    <a title=\"Mia (Parentheses Enthusiast)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/23106940-mia-parentheses-enthusiast\"><img alt=\"Mia (Parentheses Enthusiast)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470283455p2/23106940.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1211530723?book_show_action=false\">Dec 17, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Mia (Parentheses Enthusiast)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Mia (Parentheses Enthusiast)\" href=\"/user/show/23106940-mia-parentheses-enthusiast\">Mia (Parentheses Enthusiast)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\" href=\"/book/show/17347381-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/23106940-mia-parentheses-enthusiast?shelf=series-and-trilogies\">series-and-trilogies</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1211530723\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer478474797232403206\">Quite an outstanding book. I felt like this one in particular focussed less on Harry fighting the evil around him and more on fighting himself. Don't get me wrong: he's irritating and whiny for almost the entirety of the book, but he also grows in a touching way. Dumbledore, too- he isn't present for much of the plot, but his conversation with Harry at the very end was heart-rending in an entirely different way. Altogether this is longer and darker than any book in the series previously, but it</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText478474797232403206\" style=\"display:none\">Quite an outstanding book. I felt like this one in particular focussed less on Harry fighting the evil around him and more on fighting himself. Don't get me wrong: he's irritating and whiny for almost the entirety of the book, but he also grows in a touching way. Dumbledore, too- he isn't present for much of the plot, but his conversation with Harry at the very end was heart-rending in an entirely different way. Altogether this is longer and darker than any book in the series previously, but it deals with weightier issues and the characters are built upon as they go through hell and back. As I'm too lazy to write an actual review, I'm simply going to paste in a quote by Stephen King, who I think hits the nail on the head in his sentiment towards The Order of the Phoenix:<br /><br /><i>\"Is <u>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</u> as good as the other Harry Potter books? No. This one is actually quite a bit better. The tone is darker, and this has the unexpected- but very pleasing- effect of making Rowling's wit and playful black humor shine all the brighter... Will kids (and adults as well) still be wild about Harry 100 years from now, or 200? My best guess is that he will indeed stand time's test and wind up on a shelf where only the best are kept; I think Harry will take his place with Alice, Huck, Frodo, and Dorothy, and this is one series not just for the decade, but for the ages.\"</i><br /><br /><br />EDIT- 17 DECEMBER 2015: I was thinking about this book recently, and I feel I should tell you that my most hated characters in this series are Voldemort, Umbridge, and Ron. In that order. I honestly, truly, fucking despise Ron. That is all.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"478474797232403206\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1113640089\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1113640089\" />\n    <a title=\"Miquel Reina\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/34207574-miquel-reina\"><img alt=\"Miquel Reina\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472878884p2/34207574.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1113640089?book_show_action=false\">Nov 25, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Miquel Reina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Miquel Reina\" href=\"/user/show/34207574-miquel-reina\">Miquel Reina</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=classics\">classics</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=fantasy-yourng-adult\">fantasy-yourng-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=mistery-young-adult\">mistery-young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=top-books\">top-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=adventure\">adventure</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=children\">children</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34207574-miquel-reina?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1113640089\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12059864147100844105\">For me, it's difficult to review Harry Potter as individual novels because I think that J. K. Rowling wrote so well as a whole that I feel a difficult task. But well, I will try it. In Harry Potter and the order of Phoenix, the protagonists aren't so innocent, especially because of the circumstances they have to face and In my opinion this is the book that marks the beginning of an increasingly and suffocating darkness that will grow until the climax of the seventh and last book. As a great fan</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12059864147100844105\" style=\"display:none\">For me, it's difficult to review Harry Potter as individual novels because I think that J. K. Rowling wrote so well as a whole that I feel a difficult task. But well, I will try it. In Harry Potter and the order of Phoenix, the protagonists aren't so innocent, especially because of the circumstances they have to face and In my opinion this is the book that marks the beginning of an increasingly and suffocating darkness that will grow until the climax of the seventh and last book. As a great fan of Harry Potter, I recommend this book and the whole saga to all readers.<br /><br />Spanish version: <br />Para mU+00ED, es difU+00EDcil escribir una reseU+00F1a de Harry Potter como un libro individual, pienso que J. K. Rowling escribiU+00F3 los libros tan bien como conjunto que es una tarea difU+00EDcil criticarlos individualmente. Para mi Harry Potter y la Orden del FU+00E9nix es la novela que marca el inicio del oscurecimiento de la saga hasta llegar al punto de clU+00EDmax del libro final. Los protagonistas ya no son tan inocentes, sobre todo a causa de las circunstancias a las que se tiene que enfrentar y eso empezarU+00E1 a teU+00F1ir todo el libro de una oscuridad cada vez mU+00E1s asfixiante. Como gran fan de Harry Potter no puedo dejar de recomendar este libro y toda la saga en general a todo el mundo.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12059864147100844105\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border Deteste a Umbridge (como todo el mundo), creo que si la hubiera tenido en frente le hubiera pegado. Hubo un momento al principio en el que deteste un par de actitudes de Harry. Pero sin lugar a dudas este libro genero muchas emociones en mi. Deteste a Umbridge (como todo el mundo), creo que si la hubiera tenido en frente le hubiera pegado. Sin lugar a dudas me parece super simpatica. Se empieza a ver el \"amor\" entre Ron y Hermione y me rei mucho con ciertas cosas.<br />Obviamente mi corazon se partio con lo que le paso a Sirius.<br />Un buen libro!</span>\n  <a id='comments_for_review_1537097788' style='display: none;'>\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1537097788' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1039273\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1039273\" />\n    <a title=\"Joe\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/63748-joe\"><img alt=\"Joe\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1182904968p2/63748.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1039273?book_show_action=false\">Jun 26, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Joe\" class=\"user\" name=\"Joe\" href=\"/user/show/63748-joe\">Joe</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1039273\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5375830747898846623\">After reading this book for a second time, I've decided to dock it a star. It's still a good book, very well written, but I have some grievances to bring to Ms. J.K.'s attention:<br /><br />(SPOILER WARNING!!!!)<br /><br /> At 870 pages, it is very laborious to get through this tome when every other sentence brings a new disaster/ problem for Harry. Drama is fine, but to this level at this length is just overdoing it. Starting with the dementor attack in the first few pages and continuing through Umbridge's evilness, a</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5375830747898846623\" style=\"display:none\">After reading this book for a second time, I've decided to dock it a star. It's still a good book, very well written, but I have some grievances to bring to Ms. J.K.'s attention:<br /><br />(SPOILER WARNING!!!!)<br /><br /> At 870 pages, it is very laborious to get through this tome when every other sentence brings a new disaster/ problem for Harry. Drama is fine, but to this level at this length is just overdoing it. Starting with the dementor attack in the first few pages and continuing through Umbridge's evilness, all the way to Sirius' death (which on second read seems tacked on and unnecessary). What makes Four and Six so good is that they retain the sense of fantasy wonder that drew so many readers to the series in the first place. The Triwizard Tournament (4) and the Horocruxes (6) were just plain cool. The tournament was a fun story element and set up what is thus far the most important few chapters in the series. The horocruxes presented a great plot for the whole book and gave a basis for where the series is actually going to head down the stretch. <br /> But what was there in 5? There is a bare minimum of quidditch, dumbledore's army is a very minor part, the Grawp storyline is total filler, the whole thing with the department of mysteries isn't all that engaging until the climax, and then ends with a silly prophecy (Why doesnt Voldemort just steal harry's wand, tie cinder blocks to his legs and throw him in the lake?) and a much-too-quick duel between Dumbledore and Mr. Riddle. There's just not enough fun in this book. Although i did like how the Cho subplot was dealt with. <br /> And then at the very end, after all the doom and gloom, Rowling drops the ball on giving a glimmer of happiness. When Harry leaves the train platform, some of the Order is there, including much of the Weasley family. But where is Percy? Now that nobody is denying that V-thug is back, it would have been the perfect opportunity to show that Percy is back with the \"good guys\" without having it be overblown and sappy.<br /> This book is probably the most confounding of the six so far, since when you look back at it, after nearly 900 pages and seemingly so much going on, there was very little substance as far as the big picture goes: <br />Fudge now believes Dumbledore. Sirius is dead. Is there really anything else that happened in this book that matters? Umbridge was just there to be the cunty character that Rita was in 4, and doesnt figure into 6 at all. Occlumency seemed interesting, but it ended with Harry giving up and us learning that Snape doesn't like Harry or his dad (really????). <br /> This rant could all end up negated if certain aspects get flushed out in 7. This happened in 6, when it turned out the diary in 2 wasn't just a cheesy little contrivance. We shall find out soon...<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5375830747898846623\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1039273\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/1039273?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=4\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_1039273' style='display: class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1039273' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 1039273, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_14146690\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/14146690\" />\n    <a title=\"Chris\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/858949-chris\"><img alt=\"Chris\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1208350750p2/858949.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/14146690?book_show_action=false\">Feb 01, 2008</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Chris\" class=\"user\" name=\"Chris\" href=\"/user/show/858949-chris\">Chris</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747569404\" href=\"/book/show/861388.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/858949-chris?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/858949-chris?shelf=harry-potter\">harry-potter</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer14146690\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4647171744514066550\"><i>Since pretty much everyone I know has read these books, I figure reviewing them is pretty pointless. But with the new book coming out in a couple of days, I have to go through them beginning to end. To make the reviews more entertaining, I will be doing them in a variety of unexpected formats. For this review, I will be writing as an unnamed member of the Bush administration.</i><br /><br />So, how long until we can get this Rowling woman into Gitmo?<br /><br />I mean really, have you read this book? It's an 800-page diatr</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4647171744514066550\" style=\"display:none\"><i>Since pretty much everyone I know has read these books, I figure reviewing them is pretty pointless. But with the new book coming out in a couple of days, I have to go through them beginning to end. To make the reviews more entertaining, I will be doing them in a variety of unexpected formats. For this review, I will be writing as an unnamed member of the Bush administration.</i><br /><br />So, how long until we can get this Rowling woman into Gitmo?<br /><br />I mean really, have you read this book? It's an 800-page diatribe encouraging children to not only question authority, but to actively disobey it! I mean look at what we have here - there's a magical government that is responsible for to oversight and management of magical folk in Britain. Now I'm not entirely sure how this organization works, but I do know this - where there is a government, there is authority, and that authority must be there for a reason. No matter how much you may disagree with it, you have to understand that everything those in authority are doing is for your benefit.<br /><br />It pained me to see how the character of Dolores Umbridge was treated in this book. She single-handedly tried to bring order to Hogwarts and steer it from the liberal-free-thinking path to destruction paved by that long-haired hippie Dumbledore. And what did Umbridge get for her hard work? The Medal of Freedom? No! She got carried off by a pack of wild centaurs. How is that right? Moreover, what kind of example is that setting for American children?<br /><br />Now I don't care if Rowling wants to cripple a generation of readers in Britain. Go ahead, it's not like we need them anyway. But with these books becoming so popular in the United States, there is a very great danger that her insidious brand of rebellion and individualism will infect our children as well, and where will that lead us? Into howling chaos, that's where! Our children will see their favorite characters being disobedient and rebellious with no consequence, and it won't be long until they're thinking they can follow their example. If we let them, our children will become just as uncontrollable as the little monsters in this book.<br /><br />I urge you, if you have children, not to let them read this book. It will do nothing but damage that will take years to undo. All you parents need to do is remind them is that there are people in authority - like yourselves - who know what is right for them. They just have to listen, not question, and obey, not understand.<br /><br />I just hope that this trend doesn't continue in the next couple of books. Personally, I'd like to see all those kids locked up and that Muggle-hugger Dumbledore thrown off a parapet or something. The sooner Hogwarts comes back under Ministry control, the better everything will be.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4647171744514066550\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_14146690\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_14146690\" ref=\"like\" Was fU+00FCr ein dickes Ding aber auch der 5. Band der HP-Reihe ist! Zwar wU+00FCrde ich jetzt am liebsten gleich mit dem nU+00E4chsten Band beginnen, aber ich werde dazwischen wieder ein bisschen Pause einlegen mit anderen BU+00FCchern. (Muss mich erst einmal von diesem dicken Schinken erholen, haha.)<br /><br />5 Sterne gibt es U+00FCbrigens fU+00FCr die ganzen Details der Autorin, die sie hier von ihrer Welt gezeigt hat und dafU+00FCr, dass es trotz der Seitenanzahl nie ganz langweilig wurde. Obwohl ich mich nie gan</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12376601969746164046\" style=\"display:none\">Ich habe es geschafft! Was fU+00FCr ein dickes Ding aber auch der 5. Band der HP-Reihe ist! Obwohl ich mich nie ganz so richtig \"zu Hause\" gefU+00FChlt habe wie in den vorigen vier BU+00E4nden & es sich sehr nach einem Zwischenband anfU+00FChlt, wU+00E4re es irgendwie falsch dem Buch itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1123288713\" />\n    <a title=\"Maxwell\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1381728-maxwell\"><img alt=\"Maxwell\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474578952p2/1381728.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1123288713?book_show_action=false\">Dec 10, 2014</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Maxwell\" class=\"user\" name=\"Maxwell\" href=\"/user/show/1381728-maxwell\">Maxwell</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\" href=\"/book/show/17347381-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=i-own-it\">i-own-it</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=2014\">2014</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1123288713\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer257903075695157475\"><i> Reread December 2014 </i><br /><br />This is only the second time I have read <i>Order of the Phoenix</i> as opposed to having reread all the other books in the series at least once. And I can say that I think I enjoyed it a lot more the second time around. I've always said this one was my least favorite in the series because it's a bit more depressing, Harry is so moody, and everything seems to be going wrong--oh, and Umbridge. But this time, I totally understood Harry's frustration and angst, and I sympathized with</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText257903075695157475\" style=\"display:none\"><i> Reread December 2014 </i><br /><br />This is only the second time I have read <i>Order of the Phoenix</i> as opposed to having reread all the other books in the series at least once. And I can say that I think I enjoyed it a lot more the second time around. I've always said this one was my least favorite in the series because it's a bit more depressing, Harry is so moody, and everything seems to be going wrong--oh, and Umbridge. But this time, I totally understood Harry's frustration and angst, and I sympathized with his mood swings and outbreaks a lot more. He is under <b>so much pressure</b> for a 15 year old boy. And no one believes anything he says. I found Harry less 'moody' and more justified in his anger.<br /><br />One thing that I continue to find myself thinking, as opposed to the first time reading the series, is how much I dislike Snape. Even though I know the end of the series and how Rowling plays it all out, I still don't like him. I don't think his reasons for hating Harry are justifiable, even when we see in his memory in this book. <br /><br />Something fun that I noticed reading this was that when Harry first arrives at Grimmauld Place and helps the crew clean up the house, as they are searching Kreacher's nook they find 'a locket,' but they don't think anything of it. Easter egg!<br /><br />Overall, obviously 5/5 for the construction of the story, the character development, and just my love for the series overall. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"257903075695157475\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border title=\"Shandra\" class=\"user\" name=\"Shandra\" href=\"/user/show/23160533-shandra\">Shandra</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer697303946\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11172197589307751981\"><b>Initial thoughts:</b> Holy wow!! That was by far the most emotional book in this series!!! This was an amazing book, but filled with so much unhappiness. Poor Harry... Review to come. <br /><br /><b>Review:<br /><br />Actual rating: 5 solid, I-Hate-Being-A-Muggle stars!!! No story spoilers. </b><br /><br />This series is one of those that I find impossible to review. Almost everyone has read them, and they've been reviewed a million times over. So really, what is there for lil ol' me to say?!<br /><br />I'll give you some of my quick thoughts and feelin</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11172197589307751981\" style=\"display:none\"><b>Initial thoughts:</b> Holy wow!! That was by far the most emotional book in this series!!! This was an amazing book, but filled with so much unhappiness. Poor Harry... Review to come. <br /><br /><b>Review:<br /><br />Actual rating: 5 solid, I-Hate-Being-A-Muggle stars!!! No story spoilers. </b><br /><br />This series is one of those that I find impossible to review. Almost everyone has read them, and they've been reviewed a million times over. So really, what is there for lil ol' me to say?!<br /><br />I'll give you some of my quick thoughts and feelings. Like I already said, this one is the darkest so far. Harry came across as a whiny, poor me kid throughout most of the book. He is justified in being that way, but that's how he was nonetheless. For the first time, Hogwarts was somewhere I didn't want to be. I was so pissed at this fact I wanted to cry. A lot of sadness, tears, and pain occur throughout this story. I love this world, but at times this story was difficult to get through for me due to the emotional turmoil inside it. With that being said, I still loved the book, gave it five stars, and can't wait to get to the next one!!!!<br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11172197589307751981\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=absolute-favorites\">absolute-favorites</a>, \n id=\"reviewTextContainer1484200830\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10658583788203872753\">I don't know whose yelling I found more delightful: Mrs. Weasley's, Mrs. Black's or Harry's. But then Harry's yelling at the end was unmatched and all too painful to be amusing anymore.<br /><br />Fucking hate Umbridge with the intensity of a thousand burning suns. In some ways, she is the worst character in the series and that's saying a lot.<br /><br />Also, Cho was annoying as fuck.<br /><br />There are so many good things about this book, most notably the ability of humans (or wizards and witches in this case) to go on pretend</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10658583788203872753\" style=\"display:none\">I don't know whose yelling I found more delightful: Mrs. Weasley's, Mrs. Black's or Harry's. But then Harry's yelling at the end was unmatched and all too painful to be amusing anymore.<br /><br />Fucking hate Umbridge with the intensity of a thousand burning suns. In some ways, she is the worst character in the series and that's saying a lot.<br /><br />Also, Cho was annoying as fuck.<br /><br />There are so many good things about this book, most notably the ability of humans (or wizards and witches in this case) to go on pretending the fuck out of things. How dense do they have to be?<br /><br />The ending of this book is so much more worse than the previous four and then the ending of Half-Blood Prince is the worst... Still, the scene in Dumbledore's office will always be soul-crushing.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10658583788203872753\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1484200830\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1484200830\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1546204748\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1546204748\" />\n    <a title=\"Saoirse Sterling\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling\"><img alt=\"Saoirse Sterling\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478339708p2/4639825.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1546204748?book_show_action=false\">Jun 01, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Saoirse Sterling\" class=\"user\" name=\"Saoirse Sterling\" href=\"/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling\">Saoirse Sterling</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was ok</span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747551003\" href=\"/book/show/444327.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=intriguing-but-ultimately-naff\">intriguing-but-ultimately-naff</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bairns\">bairns</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=sterling\">sterling</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=seen-t-film\">seen-t-film</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=childhood\">childhood</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=feminine\">feminine</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ce21\">ce21</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=2016\">2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bookshelf\">bookshelf</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1546204748\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer18011658888361892056\">[First read: 2003. Four stars.<br />Second read: 20th February, 2016. Two stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br />I was looking forward to this book for one and only one reason: Luna Lovegood. I don't remember much of the book from when I first read it all those years ago, and most of my memories were definitely from the film only, but I have to say it was incredibly disappointing in many ways.<br /><br />The writing during the series has definitely impro</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText18011658888361892056\" style=\"display:none\">[First read: 2003. Four stars.<br />Second read: 20th February, 2016. Two stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br />I was looking forward to this book for one and only one reason: Luna Lovegood. I don't remember much of the book from when I first read it all those years ago, and most of my memories were definitely from the film only, but I have to say it was incredibly disappointing in many ways.<br /><br />The writing during the series has definitely improved since <i>The Prizoner of Azkaban</i>, which you'd expect with the fifth. I suppose since the length of each book has almost tripled since the first book, that should have had to be the case. However, despite the improvements to the writing, I still can't see much improvement to the story as a whole.<br /><br />We're getting more characters (more diverse characters) but I still find that most of the bad-or just the ones were supposed to dislike-ones are all a little ugly or fat. As if to say, this is how you know who're you're supposed to like and who you're supposed to hate. Whilst I know these books are aimed primarily at children, I don't find this a good excuse. Children aren't that stupid.<br /><br />Ron and Harry haven't changed much since day one, either. They're both gotten themselves an awful lot of hormones, which happens to anyone, unavoidable, and Harry was super annoying in this one (though, whilst I find that understandable considering how he feels that he might be more like Voldemort than he would like, there was no need for so much caps lock) but I haven't noticed any kind of change in either of them that you'd expect by the fifth book. Hermione, however, seems to change almost every book. At first I enjoyed this change, and whilst I would agree that in general girls change at a faster rate than boys do, it still feels like overcompensation.<br /><br />And now we come to Luna. I thought it was odd that she just turns up and becomes quite an important character from the off, but she was also incredibly flat in the book. I didn't realise that Film Luna had had a bigger impact on me than Book Luna did, and in fact I'd go far as to say that I didn't enjoy Book Luna at all. Not because she was weird, or odd, or picked on, or a little aloof, but because she was just a \"There\" character. Yes, we get she's weird, but it feels like that's the only reason she was there.<br /><br />The story has a whole didn't keep me all that entertained, either. It felt like a repeat of, well, all the other books, with just a bit more death thrown in. I like that the books are getting darker, but I don't think just adding death really counts. I feel like the moment of falling in love-or even just like-with this series like I was when I was twelve has passed by and it won't come back.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"18011658888361892056\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1546204748\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1546204748\" ref=\"like\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=tear-jerkers\">tear-jerkers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2010\">2010</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=highly-recommended\">highly-recommended</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer93981331\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2652010753379325500\">Whew! Done! Oh man. I've read this book, I dunno... dozens of times, but for some reason, this UK edition just seemed UNENDING! The story was fantastic as usual, and gut-wrenching and heart-breaking and mind-blowing, but as someone who enjoys seeing their progress through books in the pages that make their way to the left side of the split, this book felt like a treadmill... I'm busting-butt on it, but I'm making no visible progress. <br /><br />But ridiculously thick book gripes aside, this is my favorite</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2652010753379325500\" style=\"display:none\">Whew! Done! Oh man. I've read this book, I dunno... dozens of times, but for some reason, this UK edition just seemed UNENDING! The story was fantastic as usual, and gut-wrenching and heart-breaking and mind-blowing, but as someone who enjoys seeing their progress through books in the pages that make their way to the left side of the split, this book felt like a treadmill... I'm busting-butt on it, but I'm making no visible progress. <br /><br />But ridiculously thick book gripes aside, this is my favorite HP book, I think. Or at least tied with Deathly Hallows... And Goblet of Fire. And Half-Blood Prince. I can't decide. It's not fair. Like choosing a favorite child... not that I have any yet. Anywho, I love this book. It's dark, it's angsty, it's the beginning of the end. Harry now realizes that all this isn't just going to go away... it's a fight to the finish. <br /><br />This is the first time that I've re-read OOTP since reading the Deathly Hallows when it came out a few years ago. And I found myself very surprised at the hints that were in there and so easily overlooked that relate to DH. The choices, the state we're in when we're trying to decide what to do... How fear can take those decisions out of our hands and make them for us... Knowing what was coming in the last book definitely make this one a different reading experience for me. And, honestly, it was a little bit EASIER to read too, especially when it came to Sirius. Oh I still cried, but, somehow I wasn't the wreck that I usually am when I've read this in the past. Harry's grief and anger and guilt hurt and were hard to watch, but knowing the final outcome made it all easier to bear, I think. <br /><br />God I love this series.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"2652010753379325500\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review93981331\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right     </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review281196026\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link281196026\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=281196026&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_281196026'><a id=\"like_count_review_281196026\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/281196026?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">15 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_281196026\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_281196026\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=15&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=281196026&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_281196026\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 281196026, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;\">4 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/281196026?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=4\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_281196026' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/281196026/comments?reverse=true\">View all 4 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_281196026' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 281196026, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1354077230\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1354077230\" />\n    <a title=\"Melanie (itsabookishthing13)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13\"><img alt=\"Melanie (itsabookishthing13)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1447807212p2/45616064.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1354077230?book_show_action=false\">Dec 25, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Melanie (itsabookishthing13)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Melanie (itsabookishthing13)\" href=\"/user/show/45616064-melanie-itsabookishthing13\">Melanie (itsabookishthing13)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n                  <em>\n                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,\n                    <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1354077230&#39;); return false;\">click here.</a>\n                  </em>\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1354077230\" class=\"readable\"\n                    style=\"display:none\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2853503070243015895\">\"Thoughts could leave deeper scars than almost anything else.U+201D<br /><br />(Spoilers ahead)<br /><br />WOW this was one hell of a book.<br /><br />I'm so lost, I truly have ZERO idea where I'm supposed to start. Ok. I'm just going to start typing whatever comes to mind first.<br /><br />HARRY'S MOODINESS: OH MY GOD it was so FRUSTRATING being inside his head during this book because he was always so ANGRY. And I didn't exactly hate that. Ok, it was INFURIATING when he went off on Ron & Hermione, but his angst was so raw and real, it took t</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2853503070243015895\" style=\"display:none\">\"Thoughts could leave deeper scars than almost anything else.U+201D<br /><br />(Spoilers ahead)<br /><br />WOW this was one hell of a book.<br /><br />I'm so lost, I truly have ZERO idea where I'm supposed to start. Ok. I'm just going to start typing whatever comes to mind first.<br /><br />HARRY'S MOODINESS: OH MY GOD it was so FRUSTRATING being inside his head during this book because he was always so ANGRY. And I didn't exactly hate that. Ok, it was INFURIATING when he went off on Ron & Hermione, but his angst was so raw and real, it took the story itself on a whole other level. Can you blame him for being upset? He's basically shut out from the situation all summer break, without anyone telling him whats going on in the Wizarding World, it's not exactly fair, is it? But it was so sad watching him have a difficult time this time around in Hogwarts because of all the nasty things happening once Umbridge showed up, and nobody believed him about Voldemort's return.<br /><br />UMBRIDGE: OH MY GOD. The b**ch. I LITERALLY CRINGED EVERY TIME SHE SHOWED UP, SHE WAS SO AWFUL MY GOD HOW TO EXPRESS MY HATRED AAGSHGDH! But. BUT. I watched the movies before reading this series. So I knew what happened to this god-awful toad looking creature. So I truly enjoyed every single scene she was in, just thinking of how it ends for her. :')<br /><br />Dumbledore's detachment: this time around, Harry can't confide in Dumbledore, because he's basically avoiding Harry. Watching Harry feel so alone and betrayed by Dumbledore physically hurts. BUT THAT ENDING WHERE DUMBLEDORE BEARS HIS HEART AND SOUL TO HARRY. WOWOWOWOWOWOW. No words can explain. That was a FANTASTIC scene.<br /><br />Dumbledore's Army: THESE SCENES WERE EVERYTHING. Every time it was announced that a meeting would take place my heart would soar, because they were absolutely my favorite parts of the book. They were the rare times where Harry was truly happy in this story, which made every single scene spectacular.<br /><br />Cho: God. I can't. I CANNOT. Out of everybody, EVEN UMBRIDGE, I really REALLY couldn't stand Cho.<br /><br />Ginny: Her badassery is FINALLY coming to the surface and I'm LOVING EVERY MOMENT. She's becoming a very interesting character, because she's basically a mixture of her brothers' best qualities: she's loyal, mischievous, brave, quirky, funny, an amazing girl. Can you see the ship floating? Can you see it? The fact that Ron is also 100% onboard the Harry/Ginny ship is giving me life. I CANNOT WAIT for Half-Blood Prince, because I think it's when they'll finally have their moment, now that Cho is finally out of the picture.<br /><br />Hagrid's story: I didn't really...like it? I found it very anti-climactic, and frankly pointless.. Grawp was an excellent addition to the story, but Hagrid's secrecy and detachment in a time when Harry really needed him was extremely frustrating.<br /><br />Occlumency: You know when I said that the DA meetings were my favorite parts? Yeah, well I lied, because OCCLUMENCY MEETINGS WITH SNAPE ARE EVERYTHING. You guys may not know, but Snape is one of my most beloved characters of all time. For SO LONG I love/hated him during the movies, but once the final movie came out I became loyal to him. Snape is one of the most fascinating characters I've ever read/watched and this book cemented my love for him. The Occlumency meetings were perfection, and now that I've read the book I can honestly slow-clap to the movie actors because that scene was SPOT-ON. When I read the book I was literally picturing every single word in my head just like the movie portrayed it, and that was amazing. The things we learn from Snape's past during these meetings were so revealing and eye-opening; it's the beginning of cracking his exterior to find out what he's really like; I'm SO excited for Half-Blood Prince because it has SO MUCH SNAPE <3<br /><br />Luna Lovegood: her introduction to the series was basically one of my most anticipated parts of reading the books for the first time, and it did NOT disappoint. What I didn't expect was adoring Luna's movie version a lot more than the book version, because the actress did an amazing job in showcasing Luna's strangeness with a lovableness that's sort of absent in the book. I'm very much obsessed with her character so reading about her was everything I wished for, and more.<br /><br />The end: I don't really want to sit here and hash-out all my heartbreak because I would have to type for 500000 hours, so I'll just say this: it was one of the best literary work I've ever read in my life. The chapters throughout #36-38 were absolutely breathtaking, and so tense, it was an experience like no other. J.K. Rowling continues to astound me. AND THE DA KILLED IT. Harry should be proud. I'm SO EXCITED TO CONTINUE WITH THIS SERIES but getting slightly concerned because I'm almost done with it... two more books. And that's it. No more Harry Potter.... I'm going to go now, before I lose it. <3</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"2853503070243015895\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer\"><img alt=\"Sonja - Badass Wanderer\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467482539p2/35853271.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1525316278?book_show_action=false\">Feb 05, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Sonja - Badass Wanderer\" class=\"user\" name=\"Sonja - Badass Wanderer\" href=\"/user/show/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer\">Sonja - Badass Wanderer</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=awesomesauce\">awesomesauce</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=favourite\">favourite</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=ya\">ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=magic\">magic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=mystery\">mystery</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=feel-good\">feel-good</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=too-many-feels\">too-many-feels</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=love-this-so-much\">love-this-so-much</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=adventure\">adventure</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=family\">family</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=relationships\">relationships</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=magical-writing\">magical-writing</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1525316278\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10634019568412623526\"><b>5 Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes Stars</b><br><b> <blockquote>Youth cannot know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.</blockquote> </b><i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i> has some of my most treasured moments in the entire series: Luna Lovegood and all of her amazing and quirky moments; Neville gaining self-confidence and standing up against the Death Eaters in the Ministry of Magic; Fred and George's pranks, jokes, dialogue, and <i>every</i> other scene involving them; McGonagall interrupti</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10634019568412623526\" style=\"display:none\"><b>5 Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes Stars</b><br><b>\n  <blockquote>Youth cannot know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.</blockquote>\n</b><i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i> has some of my most treasured moments in the entire series: Luna Lovegood and all of her amazing and quirky moments; Neville gaining self-confidence and standing up against the Death Eaters in the Ministry of Magic; Fred and George's pranks, jokes, dialogue, and <i>every</i> other scene involving them; McGonagall interrupting Snape and giving one million points to Gryffindor House & Peeves causing chaos and trouble all around.<br><br>As hilarious and light the book was at times; sadness and darkness weighed heavier. Darkness follows light, and thus death and destruction ensued eventually *sighs*. <i>The</i> death still hurts. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[PADFOOT, DON'T LEAVE MOONY ALONE *hysterical crying* <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>One part of me doesn't want to start <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i>, knowing that <i>he</i> is going to die.<br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454434843ra/17962138.gif\" width=\"380\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>.<br><a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1519364425?book_show_action=false\">My Review of Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a><br>.<br>.<br>.<br><i>\n  <u>1st read in August 2014</u>\n</i><br>U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50<b>/5 (8.25/10)</b><br><i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i> displays HarryU+2019s capabilities of being a leader and RowlingU+2019s capabilities of growing with Harry as he grows older. Rowling clearly shows that Harry is growing up. The reader can read Harry becoming more responsible; learning to control his emotions. As Harry grows up, the reader grows with him.<br><br>ItU+2019s very sad to see that nobody believes Harry Potter and Dumbledore. People - mainly students - start to believe the lies the press - The Daily Prophet, the Ministry of Magic - is telling them. This is very upsetting for both Harry and his friends. ItU+2019s off-putting to see how many people think Harry has lost it. The ostracising of Harry makes my heart weep with sympathy for the poor boy who hasnU+2019t got any parents. <br><br>The novel yet again displays some bigotry. Professor Umbridge, who works for the Ministry of Magic, is a <u>sadistic and evil human being</u>. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[When Harry tells the truth about VoldemortU+2019s return, he has to write lines in his own blood. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> She doesnU+2019t like half-breeds or anything that isnU+2019t a pure-blood wizard. <br><br>Harry realises in the novel that it isnU+2019t Voldemort - aka the bad guys - vs innocent, warm-hearted and friendly people. The world isnU+2019t divided in two groups; it isnU+2019t: U+2018YouU+2019re either with me or against me.U+2019. For instance, Dumbledore is against Voldemort, however, there also people - the Ministry of Magic - who are against Dumbledore. From that one cannot deduce that the Ministry of Magic is together with Voldemort. ItU+2019s much more complicated than that. And I am very glad and happy that Rowling shows this and explains it. <br><br>The novel is to some degree predictable. This makes the novel less exciting because the reader knows what is bound to come. It hasnU+2019t got the jaw-dropping surprises the previous novels contained. Even though there is one surprising death, it doesnU+2019t really come as a shock, because it was obvious that somebody needed to die. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[The death of Sirius Black is mostly painful because it is painful for Harry. It wasnU+2019t really painful for me because I got a bit unattached with Sirius when Harry saw the memory of Professor Snape being severely bullied by Sirius and James. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>The novel has, as its predecessors have, humour in it. At times the light-heartedness is very difficult to find, especially as the novel comes to its climax. The humour makes all the situations more manageable for both the readers and the characters. <br><br>The novel gives more depth and more information on the characters. ItU+2019s very delightful to know more about the characters. I feel that in each new Harry Potter novel I dive in deeper into the pool that holds the characters. This makes <i>my Potterhead-heart</i> beat with excitement.<br><blockquote> U+2018 U+2018Listening to the news! Again?\" \"Well it changes every day, you see,\" said Harry. - Uncle Vernon and Harry, p.11</blockquote><blockquote> U+2018 U+2018IU+2019ll look for him later, I expect IU+2019ll find him upstairs crying his eyes out over my motherU+2019s old bloomers or something. Of course, he might have crawled into the airing cupboard and died U+2026 but I mustnU+2019t get my hopes up.U+2019 U+2019 - Sirius, p.446</blockquote></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10634019568412623526\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1525316278\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1525316278\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1525316278&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1525316278'><a id=\"like_count_review_1525316278\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1525316278?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">15 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1525316278\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1525316278\" ref=\"like\" was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Kindle Edition \" href=\"/book/show/19249726-harry-potter-y-la-orden-del-f-nix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/43792706-andrea-manzanilla?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/43792706-andrea-manzanilla?shelf=reads-2016\">reads-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1696311221\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer3447117806141007001\"><b>Reading Challengers 2016: Un libro que este garantizado para que te brinde alegrU+00EDa</b><br /><br />Por donde empiezo...<br /><br />Primero que todo, y se que no estoy sola en esta afirmaciU+00F3n, ODIO a Dolores Umbridge con mi alma y corazU+00F3n. Llego al extremo de odiarla tanto o mas que al Voldemort. Especial menciU+00F3n de odio al estU+00FApido de Percy, al imbU+00E9cil de Fudge y la asesina de Bellatrix. <br /><br />Pasando pagina, vemos que Harry ha madurado como en sus reacciones y emociones. Obviemente siempre estU+00E1n sus tomas de decisiones apresurad</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3447117806141007001\" style=\"display:none\"><b>Reading Challengers 2016: Un libro que este garantizado para que te brinde alegrU+00EDa</b><br /><br />Por donde empiezo...<br /><br />Primero que todo, y se que no estoy sola en esta afirmaciU+00F3n, ODIO a Dolores Umbridge con mi alma y corazU+00F3n. Llego al extremo de odiarla tanto o mas que al Voldemort. Especial menciU+00F3n de odio al estU+00FApido de Percy, al imbU+00E9cil de Fudge y la asesina de Bellatrix. <br /><br />Pasando pagina, vemos que Harry ha madurado como en sus reacciones y emociones. Obviemente siempre estU+00E1n sus tomas de decisiones apresuradas pero en este libro son pocas. <br /><br />Por fin conocU+00ED a Luna que recordaba de las peliculas pero no tenU+00EDa no idea de en que libro salia, me ha parecido inteligente y sorprendentemente mas perspicaz que los demU+00E1s. Tenerla a ella, Nevile y Ginny como parte de la pandilla esta increU+00EDble.<a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ Gracias que haya acabado la \"relaciU+00F3n\" de Harry y Cho, no los shipeaba para nada <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />No puedo olvidar a Hermione que como siempre salvando el trasero de todos y Ron que con su humor me alegra el dU+00EDa. <br /><br />La trama esta poniU+00E9ndose mas y mas oscura, me encanta a donde se esta dirigiendo.<a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Voldemort tambiU+00E9n me engaU+00F1o en la visiU+00F3n que la mando a Harry sobre Sirius y me siento fatal porque la muerte de Canuto no me afecto tanto como esperaba, pero creo que es porque todavU+00EDa tengo esperanza de que pueda volver ya que nunca dicen a donde llevaba ese velo <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Nunca me cansare de alabar la hermosa escritura que nos regala con cada libro J.K Rowling. Pareciera que cada palabra estuviera conectada con la siguiente, lo que hace que fluya de una manera extraordinaria. <br /><br />No se si he mencionada en mis anteriores reseU+00F1as que la ediciU+00F3n que estoy leyendo tiene estas hermosas ilustraciones al empezar cada capitulo que te da un sneak-peak de lo que pasara en el mismo, me parece un detallaso. <br /><br />Es un libro bastante grande y a pesar de eso no fue lo suficientemente grande para saciarme. Tantas cosas que comentar pero no quiero que sea tan larga la reseU+00F1a asU+00ED que la dejare asU+00ED. En resumen me ha fascinado!!!<br /><br />He visto la adaptaciU+00F3n cinematogrU+00E1fica y hasta ahora es mi menos favorita, principalmente porque quitaron detalles que en mi opiniU+00F3n eran importantes a la trama. Sin embargo los aplaudo porque pasar un libro con tanta cantidad de paginas a una pelU+00EDcula de 2 horas no es fU+00E1cil. <br /><br />Recomendadisisima... </span>\n  <a Court of BooksU+2013\" href=\"/user/show/30004027-laurie-a-court-of-books\">Laurie U+2013A Court of BooksU+2013</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9782070556854\" href=\"/book/show/173688.Harry_Potter_et_l_Ordre_du_Ph_nix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30004027-laurie-a-court-of-books?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30004027-laurie-a-court-of-books?shelf=to-read-before-dying\">to-read-before-dying</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30004027-laurie-a-court-of-books?shelf=read-in-french\">read-in-french</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer892594316\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15732223850019753279\">No word is strong enough to explain the pain it had to get through during this book. Therefore I will not write a review. I will post the sweetest/most heartbreaking picture ever.<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1380358779i/709954._SY540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br></span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review892594316\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link892594316\" title=\"Flag this
