href=\"/user/show/29371397-sophie-petticrew\">Sophie Petticrew</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747551003\" href=\"/book/show/444327.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=re-read\">re-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=read-this-year\">read-this-year</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/29371397-sophie-petticrew?shelf=owned\">owned</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer873789221\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer482811673145145406\">Just like with the Goblet of Fire, this book is a million times better than I remembered. I think, once again, the film clouded my memory. As always, I'm unbelievably excited about Luna Lovegood. I've always found solace in our similarity. She's meant so much to me since I first read the book nine years ago, and I just love her so much ahhhhhh. Moving on, I'm still not phased about <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ Sirius Black dying <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. I don't know if it's because all he did in this book was moan a</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText482811673145145406\" style=\"display:none\">Just like with the Goblet of Fire, this book is a million times better than I remembered. I think, once again, the film clouded my memory. As always, I'm unbelievably excited about Luna Lovegood. I've always found solace in our similarity. She's meant so much to me since I first read the book nine years ago, and I just love her so much ahhhhhh. Moving on, I'm still not phased about <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ Sirius Black dying <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. I don't know if it's because all he did in this book was moan and sulk, but still to this day I have never shed a single tear over his passing. What does upset me is Harry's reaction. He's lost so many people that are important to him and he just clings on to the hope that maybe this time they won't be gone forever. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ His conversation with Nearly Headless Nick always gets me, damn. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> In general though, I think this book did a great job of discussing Harry's mental health. You always hear jokes about how angsty Harry is in this book, but I think it shows a very relatable version of somebody struggling with their mental health and with PTSD, etc. Once again, there are so many things that the film really missed with this book, and I'm going to remain bitter about it for the rest of my life. >.> (I've always seen the films as more of a companion to the books than proper adaptations idk)<br />Also, everytime Harry was in Umbridge's office, I kept imaging Taylor Lautner on all those decortive plates rather than kittens; THANK YOU STARKID FOR RUINING MY LIFE!!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"482811673145145406\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_679452701\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/679452701\" />\n    <a title=\"Thomas\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2018505-thomas\"><img alt=\"Thomas\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463769552p2/2018505.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/679452701?book_show_action=false\">Aug 09, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Thomas\" class=\"user\" name=\"Thomas\" href=\"/user/show/2018505-thomas\">Thomas</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=own-electronic\">own-electronic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer679452701\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6174932198257667578\">Here are some alternative titles I thought of while slogging through this book (spoilers later on in the review):<br />- <i>Harry Potter and His Never-Ending Angst</i><br />- <i>Harry Potter and the Order of His Angst</i><br />- <i>Harry Potter and Angst Angst Angst</i><br /><br />I finished the last three books earlier this week on vacation, so I can definitely say that this one is my least favorite. I get it, I get it - Cedric died, Harry feels like no one is listening to him or keeping him in the loop, he has a lot of dumb stuff to deal with</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6174932198257667578\" style=\"display:none\">Here are some alternative titles I thought of while slogging through this book (spoilers later on in the review):<br />- <i>Harry Potter and His Never-Ending Angst</i><br />- <i>Harry Potter and the Order of His Angst</i><br />- <i>Harry Potter and Angst Angst Angst</i><br /><br />I finished the last three books earlier this week on vacation, so I can definitely say that this one is my least favorite. I get it, I get it - Cedric died, Harry feels like no one is listening to him or keeping him in the loop, he has a lot of dumb stuff to deal with in regard to Umbridge, his mind is not his own, etc. Perhaps that explains his angst, but it did not make him easy to sympathize with, or really care about. He whines to Dumbledore, he yells at Hermione (and everyone else) even though she's right, and he complains that Cho cries too much... even though it's not like he's handling his grief any better.<br /><br />Nothing grabbed me or moved me here - I wish Harry's angst had some resolution to it or played a part in his character growth, but that mostly came in the sixth and seventh books. Which, may I add, were <i>superb</i>, and I can't wait to review them. Unlike this one, in which my favorite scene was when Ginny verbally slapped Harry by reminding him that she was actually controlled by Voldemort... in essence, just get through this installment as quickly as possible, please.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6174932198257667578\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1263086612\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1263086612\" />\n    <a title=\"Rubi\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/5866182-rubi\"><img alt=\"Rubi\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1405000537p2/5866182.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1263086612?book_show_action=false\">Jun 29, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Rubi\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rubi\" class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5866182-rubi?shelf=owned-books\">owned-books</a>, \n              <a id=\"reviewTextContainer1263086612\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13649152102418488749\"> I think that for the moment this book is my favourite of the series. :D<br /><br />It has a lot of introduction (before going to Hogwarts, I mean) in which we can discover what is the Order of the Phoenix and who are the members. And after that, 5th year in Hogwarts get started for Harry, Ron, Hermione and their colleagues. <br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[The issue with Hagrid and the Gigant, Umbridge (I swear I wanted to punch her in the face from the very beginning...): how does she dare to occupy Dumbledore's position??</span></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13649152102418488749\" style=\"display:none\"> I think that for the moment this book is my favourite of the series. :D<br /><br />It has a lot of introduction (before going to Hogwarts, I mean) in which we can discover what is the Order of the Phoenix and who are the members. And after that, 5th year in Hogwarts get started for Harry, Ron, Hermione and their colleagues. <br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[The issue with Hagrid and the Gigant, Umbridge (I swear I wanted to punch her in the face from the very beginning...): how does she dare to occupy Dumbledore's position??; Dumbledore's Army and Harry like a teacher...<br />I liked a lot Fred and George in this book. They were great fighting against Umbridge and the way they went out...OMG! :D <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I love when books are plenty of the character's dreams. You can understand very well how they feel and their worries...<br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ Was it necessary to kill Sirius?? I will miss him :(. But ok, at least I know more things about the relation between Harry and Voldemort through the Prophecy. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />As always I have loved Hermione and Dumbledore the most. They are my favourite characters.<br /><br />I will continue soon with the next one! :D<br /><br /><br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13649152102418488749\" href=\"#\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1518783604\" />\n    <a title=\"Sam :)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/33142853-sam\"><img alt=\"Sam :)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477368609p2/33142853.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1518783604?book_show_action=false\">Nov 12, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Sam :)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Sam :)\" href=\"/user/show/33142853-sam\">Sam :)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33142853-sam?shelf=cried-while-reading\">cried-while-reading</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33142853-sam?shelf=re-read\">re-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33142853-sam?shelf=5-stars\">5-stars</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1518783604\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7473682060003956477\">Rating: 4.75!<br /><br />(Re-read) This book is a complete turning point in the series. At the end of The Goblet of Fire, things have just started getting more intense, with deaths and the return of Voldemort. However, The Order of the Phoenix is really where things start to become darker. Horrifying and gruesome secrets about the days when Voldemort and his Death Eaters were in power surface, Umbridge is legitimately one of the worst villains ever (and she's supposed to be on the good side!), the abuse of</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7473682060003956477\" style=\"display:none\">Rating: 4.75!<br /><br />(Re-read) This book is a complete turning point in the series. At the end of The Goblet of Fire, things have just started getting more intense, with deaths and the return of Voldemort. However, The Order of the Phoenix is really where things start to become darker. Horrifying and gruesome secrets about the days when Voldemort and his Death Eaters were in power surface, Umbridge is legitimately one of the worst villains ever (and she's supposed to be on the good side!), the abuse of house-elves and other magical creatures becomes more pronounced, Harry's father and his friends' true selves as boys are revealed, and even Harry himself is frequently resentful towards his friends and the world in general. The Order of the Phoenix's tone actually seems to be a fitting one for where Harry is in his life, however. He's a growing teenager, his schoolwork is becoming more strenuous, and even Rowling's writing is more mature. Therefore, I recognize this book as a growth in Harry Potter, and consequently a growth in the series. <br /><br />p.s. SIRIUS</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7473682060003956477\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408835005\" href=\"/book/show/18271937-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/21250003-roberta-jayne?shelf=read-in-2015\">read-in-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1253978752\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14986763091294826131\">UMBRIDGE IS SO EXCELLENT. Yes! I mean it! I've been wanting to read this book for quite a while now, partly because of her character, and I couldn't be happier now that I've read it. Luna was also a great addition to the series and I absolutely loved Fred and George's characters, along with the creation of their company, Weasley's Wizard Wheezes. The whole dynamic of the Weasley family is just brilliant. <br /><br />Also, this series is written <u>ridiculously well</u>. I've never fully appreciated how fantastic R</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14986763091294826131\" style=\"display:none\">UMBRIDGE IS SO EXCELLENT. Yes! I mean it! I've been wanting to read this book for quite a while now, partly because of her character, and I couldn't be happier now that I've read it. Luna was also a great addition to the series and I absolutely loved Fred and George's characters, along with the creation of their company, Weasley's Wizard Wheezes. The whole dynamic of the Weasley family is just brilliant. <br /><br />Also, this series is written <u>ridiculously well</u>. I've never fully appreciated how fantastic Rowling's writing is, never mind the incredible story line and superb characters that she also manages to create. It's just exquisite. <br /><br />I feel like I enjoy myself far too much when I read a Harry Potter book, and I certainly prove myself right when I try to read another book afterwards that seems practically pathetic in comparison, but I can't help it because they're just so good! </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14986763091294826131\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/69841585\" />\n    <a title=\"Stephen\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1413439-stephen\"><img alt=\"Stephen\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1311616811p2/1413439.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/69841585?book_show_action=false\">Sep 07, 2009</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Stephen\" class=\"user\" name=\"Stephen\" href=\"/user/show/1413439-stephen\">Stephen</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=ya\">ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=potteresque\">potteresque</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=2000-2005\">2000-2005</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=comfort-food\">comfort-food</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer69841585\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15559174557619293441\">5.0 stars. Tough call whether a like this book or the 4th book better. Suffice it to say that they are both excellent. This is a much darker story then the previous installments and I think that is a good thing. It took me a long time to get around to read these books and I am really, really enjoying them. </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/174755114\" />\n    <a title=\"Radwa\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/5591839-radwa\"><img alt=\"Radwa\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1419870705p2/5591839.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/174755114?book_show_action=false\">Jan 20, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Radwa\" class=\"user\" name=\"Radwa\" href=\"/user/show/5591839-radwa\">Radwa</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\" href=\"/book/show/17347381-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer174755114\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10766618897247133255\">Prophecy. Sirius. Umbridge. Occlummency. Realizing that Harry is a great friend but not an ideal boyfriend. Dumbledore hiding more than he should. Snape. <br /><br />Now that was Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix in a nutshell. Not. This book is so much more, we get a first glimpse of the truth that Dumbledore kept hiding from Harry almost his entire life, up to his (DumbledoreU+2019s) death. The prophecy is just a small tiny part of that. And I can never fathom why Dumbledore did that. If he really want</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10766618897247133255\" style=\"display:none\">Prophecy. Sirius. Umbridge. Occlummency. Realizing that Harry is a great friend but not an ideal boyfriend. Dumbledore hiding more than he should. Snape. <br /><br />Now that was Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix in a nutshell. Not. This book is so much more, we get a first glimpse of the truth that Dumbledore kept hiding from Harry almost his entire life, up to his (DumbledoreU+2019s) death. The prophecy is just a small tiny part of that. And I can never fathom why Dumbledore did that. If he really wanted Harry to stop acting like the hero, he shouldU+2019ve told him more. Keeping everything away from only encouraged him.<br /><br />The character of the book, besides Hermione who kicks ass (and who Harry should listen to all the time), is Luna. SheU+2019s really underrated and I think Harry starts somehow to realize that in the end (even if it was mainly pity).<br /><br />IU+2019m sad to realize that Sirius died after being locked up most of the book. Yes, he died fighting, but I think his death, despite tragic, was quite rushed. Rowling throws people to their death, without as much of an introduction (Snape, Dumbledore...etc). And I hate Bellatrix and Umbridge more than I hate Voldemort, which says something, and actually itU+2019s mainly to the actressesU+2019 efforts, so kudos to them.<br /><br />Snape is a great guy, I love him, but I canU+2019t help but feel that he still acts as the teenager he was in school, looking at Harry and seeing nothing but James with LilyU+2019s eyes, the same as Sirius did. Except them both had different reactions towards seeing James. Talking about James, it was shocking, and it still shocks me as Harry, the shattering of JamesU+2019 ideal image in HarryU+2019s mind. I think Rowling is trying to show us that no one is perfect, and I love that. But I understand the <br />shock.<br /><br />Harry, heU+2019s as irrational as ever, and yet I can relate to his irrationality, to all of the bad decisions he makes, to his anger fits, because thatU+2019s what being a teenager is all about, especially when you have so much going on, and I think Rowling managed to write it perfectly.<br /><br />The biggest book, definitely the darkest so far, and I love it.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10766618897247133255\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1282737204\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1282737204\" />\n    <a title=\"Constanze Zietz\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/28987106-constanze-zietz\"><img alt=\"Constanze Zietz\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469925799p2/28987106.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1282737204?book_show_action=false\">Sep 04, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Constanze Zietz\" class=\"user\" name=\"Constanze Zietz\" href=\"/user/show/28987106-constanze-zietz\">Constanze Zietz</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/28987106-constanze-zietz?shelf=all-time-favorites\">all-time-favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/28987106-constanze-zietz?shelf=out-of-this-world\">out-of-this-world</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1282737204\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15754285961272122522\">Well, after rereading this book for the what feels like the 100th time I once again must say that nothing compares to Harry Potter and the wizarding world. It is simply fantastic. The imagination of J.K.Rowling just doesn't seem to end and the detailed description of every place, person and happening is amazing.<br /><br />The story in the 5th part continues as dark as the 4th book ended and focuses around the rebellion against Voldemort and his followers as well as the Ministry of Magic which brings us one</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15754285961272122522\" style=\"display:none\">Well, after rereading this book for the what feels like the 100th time I once again must say that nothing compares to Harry Potter and the wizarding world. It is simply fantastic. The imagination of J.K.Rowling just doesn't seem to end and the detailed description of every place, person and happening is amazing.<br /><br />The story in the 5th part continues as dark as the 4th book ended and focuses around the rebellion against Voldemort and his followers as well as the Ministry of Magic which brings us one of the, in my opinion, worst character the series has to offer: Dolores Umbridge. The sympathy I have for all the Hogwarts-Students who have to endure her terror is just the beginning of the emotions I had while reading. This part just combines so many feelings of love, hate, anger, sympathy, laughter and sadness! But, opposed to Umbridge we also get to know very lovable characters such as Luna Lovegood, who is one reason for the \"laughter part \" of the book (another one for example is Ron being jealous of Victor Krum or protective of Ginny or Fred and George trying out their inventions for the joke shop). I just love to witness the friendship between Harry and his fellow students growing (spiked with a little romance) and am looking forward rereading part 6 and 7. <br /><br />By the way, next to the story I have to compliment the Bloomsbury Edition of the Series. Every book is filled with little details (such as drawings) and fun facts about the wizarding world, such as: Every Year St. Mungos Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries treats at least one injury caused by homemade floo powder. So great!!!!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15754285961272122522\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/29458352-naksed?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/29458352-naksed?shelf=children-s-books\">children-s-books</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1695122922\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4050174299410771570\">That Umbridge witch was the most hateful villain aside from Voldemort that HP has ever had to deal with. I really liked this one, my favorite of the series so far. Really smart to have Hogwarts being slowly taken over by a totalitarian regime. Very <i>Animal Farm</i> of J.K. Rowling :)<br /><br />More and more intrigued by Snape's emerging, mysterious back story. I have found him to be one of the most interesting characters in the book, with a masterful on screen interpretation by Alan Rickman, may he rest in peac</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4050174299410771570\" style=\"display:none\">That Umbridge witch was the most hateful villain aside from Voldemort that HP has ever had to deal with. I really liked this one, my favorite of the series so far. Really smart to have Hogwarts being slowly taken over by a totalitarian regime. Very <i>Animal Farm</i> of J.K. Rowling :)<br /><br />More and more intrigued by Snape's emerging, mysterious back story. I have found him to be one of the most interesting characters in the book, with a masterful on screen interpretation by Alan Rickman, may he rest in peace. <br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[However, I was disappointed that Umbridge did not get her comeuppance. Since she has run back to the Ministry with her tail between her legs, can I hope for some revenge down the line? I don't think being captured by centaurs can quite make up for the fact that she tortured children. Those scenes with Harry's bleeding hands were very hard to stomach, more so than the battle scene with Voldy and the gang. Since Hogwarts is obviously modeled on British boarding school system,that kind of unfettered sadism by a teacher towards a helpless student rang a lot truer than some of those fantastical wand battles. Wonder if Rowling got her inspiration second or first hand. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4050174299410771570\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1695122922\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1695122922\" ref=\"like\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1201517203\" />\n    <a title=\"Lonneke\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/8800217-lonneke\"><img alt=\"Lonneke\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1429794055p2/8800217.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1201517203?book_show_action=false\">Mar 06, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Lonneke\" class=\"user\" name=\"Lonneke\" href=\"/user/show/8800217-lonneke\">Lonneke</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582971\" href=\"/book/show/17347381-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8800217-lonneke?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8800217-lonneke?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1201517203\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14565182169586506026\">It took me so long to finish this book! Mainly because of school, but I actually think it was good for once to really take the time to read this. This was always my least favourite book in the series because of Harry being angry all the time, because of Umbridge, because the build up is quite long.. But this time it didn't bother me at all. (Except Umbridge, she is still the worst person ever..) <br><br>Also is it just me who always feels extremely heartbroken at the end of this book? I loved Sirius Bla</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14565182169586506026\" style=\"display:none\">It took me so long to finish this book! Mainly because of school, but I actually think it was good for once to really take the time to read this. This was always my least favourite book in the series because of Harry being angry all the time, because of Umbridge, because the build up is quite long.. But this time it didn't bother me at all. (Except Umbridge, she is still the worst person ever..) <br><br>Also is it just me who always feels extremely heartbroken at the end of this book? I loved Sirius Black his character so much from the first moment I read about him so this book always hits me really hard. In this book you see he isn't perfect, not at all, but he was exactly the person Harry needed in his life and I loved him for that. <br><br>Well, I could write a review about everything else I really liked or that has really touched me, but it would probably be 5 pages long, so I wont do that. :)<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1387258231ra/7562180.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14565182169586506026\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19080180-crystal?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a id=\"freeTextContainer1563970061781467966\">Review for audiobook. 5 stars story  5 stars narration. This book starts to get a bit darker and I have to say that I'm not impressed with Harry's flaring temper in this one, but I still loved it. I'm happy that Fred & George were there for most of the book to lighten it up and help make it fun. I enjoyed very much and look forward to the next book soon. <br />The narration by Jim Dale is top-shelf as expected with this wonderful narrator. He's very gifted and I really enjoy listening to his magic</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1563970061781467966\" style=\"display:none\">Review for audiobook. 5 stars story U+266B 5 stars narration. This book starts to get a bit darker and I have to say that I'm not impressed with Harry's flaring temper in this one, but I still loved it. I'm happy that Fred & George were there for most of the book to lighten it up and help make it fun. I enjoyed very much and look forward to the next book soon. <br />The narration by Jim Dale is top-shelf as expected with this wonderful narrator. He's very gifted and I really enjoy listening to his magical narration. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1563970061781467966\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=children-s-books\">children-s-books</a>, \n      <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=made-the-hype-worth-it\">made-the-hype-worth-it</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=2012-favorites\">2012-favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=summery\">summery</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=series-ended-well\">series-ended-well</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=life-changer-books\">life-changer-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=rainy-day-re-reads\">rainy-day-re-reads</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5593888-victoria?shelf=books-turning-into-movies\">books-turning-into-movies</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer223624757\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6076630079087404655\"><b>Warning: There will be spoilers present in this review.</b><br /><br />Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix was a deeply-moving, touching, and suprising book with plenty of twists from beginning to end. It wasn't a suprise to me that every book I've read in HP series thus far, has made on my list of favorites. J.K Rowling keeps writing books that I've always wanted and look in a book. I don't know how she has done it, but it's a truly a gift.<br /><br />In the 5th book, we get to see Harry has truly grown increasingly</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6076630079087404655\" style=\"display:none\"><b>Warning: There will be spoilers present in this review.</b><br /><br />Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix was a deeply-moving, touching, and suprising book with plenty of twists from beginning to end. It wasn't a suprise to me that every book I've read in HP series thus far, has made on my list of favorites. J.K Rowling keeps writing books that I've always wanted and look in a book. I don't know how she has done it, but it's a truly a gift.<br /><br />In the 5th book, we get to see Harry has truly grown increasingly mature and developed throughout the novel. Yes, he has gotten a bit of a temper which can annoyed the hell out of readers, but I can truly understand his anger and frustration. I can understand his temper because every teenager has reach a point in their lifetime where they began feeling these emotions. (I know I did) J.K Rowling did a <i>successful</i> job, on potraying realistic emotions of Harry and has shown his true light in the ending.<br /><br />This book is by far the longest book out of the whole entire series, but it's definitely worth it because there are lots of plot twists, hidden info, action scenes, and lots of parts where we least expected. It also includes a mystery and lots of hidden clues that I've come to love. <br /><br />In this book, we get to see the secondary characters began developing and as well as their character/personality began heightening. We see their potential, skills, and cunning and wit in battles. The secondary characters which included Ginny, Luna, and Neville all have major parts in the story which made them very likeable and <i>unforgettable</i>. It's truly amazing in every way.<br /><br />I never thought I would say this, but I feel very sorry for Snape because of his sad past that was revealed in the middle of the book. Snape has always been on my list of hated characters of Harry Potter, but that quickly changes when I've seen his good intentions. I have a good feeling I'll be seeing more of that soon.<br /><br />Sirius's tragic death has affected me in more ways than one. He did not deserve to end like this. His death had made me feel numb, sad, and stayed in a corner for a day, reflecting on his death and how it had affected Harry and myself. He was like a father-figure to Harry and to see this unfortunate accident happen to him was just <i>inevitable</i>. Sirius was one of my favorite characters, but I wasn't anticpating for this. I can't imagine what Harry feels, but I deeply feel for him since he has now lost his only godfather. R.I.P Sirius and we will be greatly missing you for your courage, bravery, and kindness to others.<br /><br />Lots of showdowns/duels take places between Dumbledore and Voldemort and Harry with Death Eaters. There were a lot of scenes where adreneline was bursting inside me and I was clutching the book, madly flipping the pages to know what happen next. It was just <i>so</i> good! (I know I keep saying that, but you get my point!)<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix will always be one of my favorite books out of HP series. It will always be on my shelf that will make a lasting impression on mine.<br /><br />Now, I'm onto reading <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince__Harry_Potter___6_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (Harry Potter, #6) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a> and finish from there on.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6076630079087404655\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_223624757'><a id=\"like_count_review_223624757\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/223624757?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">10      \n\n<div id=\"review_1051948949\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1051948949\" />\n    <a title=\"ellemaddy\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/34871872-ellemaddy\"><img alt=\"ellemaddy\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476541603p2/34871872.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1051948949?book_show_action=false\">Aug 01, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"ellemaddy\" class=\"user\" name=\"ellemaddy\" href=\"/user/show/34871872-ellemaddy\">ellemaddy</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855690\" href=\"/book/show/22844196-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=the-motherfucking-best\">the-motherfucking-best</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=read-2015\">read-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=own-a-copy\">own-a-copy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1051948949\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer18438208985187175048\">Did you know that I love thick books? <s>I love thick books and I cannot lie.</s><br /><br />And HPATOOTP is the thickest of all Harry Potter books. I'm not sure if it's my favourite (the best HP book in my opinion is HPATPOA. Because no one fucking died) but it's probably my second or third favourite. <br /><br />You know the feeling you get when you open a Harry Potter book and the smell just kind of hit your nose and you'd be like... OH shit this is better than sex or some shit like that, then you'd start crying and like e</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText18438208985187175048\" style=\"display:none\">Did you know that I love thick books? <s>I love thick books and I cannot lie.</s><br /><br />And HPATOOTP is the thickest of all Harry Potter books. I'm not sure if it's my favourite (the best HP book in my opinion is HPATPOA. Because no one fucking died) but it's probably my second or third favourite. <br /><br />You know the feeling you get when you open a Harry Potter book and the smell just kind of hit your nose and you'd be like... OH shit this is better than sex or some shit like that, then you'd start crying and like end up being a weeping mess because of a fucking children book? It's awesome, because I get that every time. And I have this thing called Harry Potter Strike (the name is still not official yet) in which I would get re-obsessed about the whole thing and re-read all the books and re-watch all the movies and basically talk about nothing else for a whole month or something, so the crying thing happens a lot to me. It's, honestly, pretty sad.<br /><br />And in HPATGOF you get a pretty big deal of a death scene and the book and the characters have matured a lot but that book is nothing compared to this one. With this one, it's just like... Whoa. Reading this book is like getting punched with the hardback version of this book in the face repeatedly. Near the ending it's just like a continuous wtf stop this nonsense immediately while you're crying blood and getting nosebleed and just want everything to be over but not really because you're a masochist. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ You think I'm exaggerating but I'm not, my child. I just really really love Sirius.  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Sometimes, though rarely, you get a fresh gentle breeze of awesomeness and hilarious jokes that would caress your face. But, you know, they happen so rarely. Then it's back to being punched in the face again and again. <br /><br />That's what it's like to me, personally. It's awful, it's awesome, it's kind of hilarious and heart warming sometimes, but most of the times it's just a huge tsunami of emotion drowning me in emotion and tears. A lot of tears especially near the ending. And when it's over you're kind of overwhelmed with this great loss and you want to read the next book to bring you back to life but then you already know what's going to happen in the next book and you just feel like... Well, sometimes I wish I could re-write this series and make everyone happy and alive and just forget everything bad ever happened to them.<br /><br />Proceed to book 6. Though quite unwillingly. Though this means you're a step closer towards the end of your childhood. Again. *cue to tears*<br /><br />FIN.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"18438208985187175048\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_421011865\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/421011865\" />\n    <a title=\"Arielle Walker\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker\"><img alt=\"Arielle Walker\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452561487p2/6762949.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/421011865?book_show_action=false\">May 26, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Arielle Walker\" class=\"user\" name=\"Arielle Walker\" href=\"/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker\">Arielle Walker</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=fantasy-unusual\">fantasy-unusual</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=children\">children</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=over-500-pages\">over-500-pages</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer421011865\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8916958085020244746\">This is less a review, and more a sort of memoir of my Harry Potter experience. Gushy emotions and etc follow, so feel free to skip this review with no more than my recommendation that if you have not read this series you must do so immediately.<br /><br />Every so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books - in order -</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8916958085020244746\" style=\"display:none\">This is less a review, and more a sort of memoir of my Harry Potter experience. Gushy emotions and etc follow, so feel free to skip this review with no more than my recommendation that if you have not read this series you must do so immediately.<br /><br />Every so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books - in order - over the course of around two days (I've read them so often that I can devour them in almost a single go now) followed by as many of the films as I can fit into the time I have left, before I'm forced back into reality. <br /><br />I am one of the Harry Potter generation. I was four when the first book was published, fourteen when the series concluded, and around the same age as the characters in the films, when they eventually came out. It's a series that I grew up with, and as such, cannot comment on its literary merits without bias. All I know is that they are a comfort, and feel like family.<br /><br /><br />I still remember the agony of being in a little country where books come out long after their release in bigger countries (America, the UK, Australia). Luckily I'm pretty sure this came out only a day after the original release, but that was plenty of time for spoilers to come out, making school on the day before a harrowing experience, hiding from those cruel people determined to ruin the book. I found out the ending. The book was not ruined.<br /><br />When this book finally did come out, I waited in line at the bookshop for hours, and, once I had my hands on my (pre-ordered) copy, proceeded to sit at home undisturbed for six hours as I inhaled every word with both laughter and tears. <br /><br />They may not technically be the best books I have ever read, but - for me - as a reading experience they are truly unparalleled.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8916958085020244746\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_532702016\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/532702016\" />\n    <a title=\"Becky\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1376766-becky\"><img alt=\"Becky\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457393924p2/1376766.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/532702016?book_show_action=false\">Feb 22, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Becky\" class=\"user\" name=\"Becky\" href=\"/user/show/1376766-becky\">Becky</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747569404\" href=\"/book/show/861388.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=mystery-and-thrillers\">mystery-and-thrillers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=tear-jerkers\">tear-jerkers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=highly-recommended\">highly-recommended</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2013\">2013</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer532702016\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5520164659625211719\">I remember the first time I'd ever read this book, and how I felt at the end - after everything that was lost... and I still feel that way to this day: shocked, hollow, heartbroken, and furious. <br /><br />OK, maybe not 'shocked' anymore, because now I know what's coming, but my point is that this book has the power to affect me... EVERY SINGLE TIME. And as loud as the emotions can be (Harry rampaging about being kept in the dark all summer when he finally is brought to Grimmauld Place, and After (capital</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5520164659625211719\" style=\"display:none\">I remember the first time I'd ever read this book, and how I felt at the end - after everything that was lost... and I still feel that way to this day: shocked, hollow, heartbroken, and furious. <br /><br />OK, maybe not 'shocked' anymore, because now I know what's coming, but my point is that this book has the power to affect me... EVERY SINGLE TIME. And as loud as the emotions can be (Harry rampaging about being kept in the dark all summer when he finally is brought to Grimmauld Place, and After (capital A) in Dumbledore's office), it's the small things that gut me. Lupin's voice being full of pain, Harry's crushing realization that he wouldn't be kept waiting, especially when he was clearly in need. <br /><br />Even writing this makes me tear up. <br /><br />I know that there are a lot of people who dislike the angsty-ness of this book, but I think it's perfect. Harry is 15, right in the thick of his moody teen \"I'm So Misunderstood\" years, as Phinneas Nigellus is wont to point out, and I loved it. I don't mean to say that I LIKE it, because it is a tad frustrating, but I love it because it's realistic. Harry has been through more than most full-grown wizards, hell, more than some AURORS have been through, and he's left in the dark for so long that it's completely realistic that he should be frustrated and angry about it. <br /><br />I love this book, and I love the way that the circumstances really become real to Harry in this book. After Cedric last year, and then the Longbottoms - I mean, I know that Harry knew what happened to them last year, but really SEEING them this year had to make it tangible how dangerous Lord Thingy's supporters can be, and then Sirius solidified it.<br /><br />There's a lot that comes together in this book as well, most that becomes clear in the last two books, but it's starting to meld into a picture of the link that was formed that day in Godric's Hollow. <br /><br />Brilliant stuff. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5520164659625211719\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\"      \n\n<div id=\"review_1609311580\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1609311580\" />\n    <a title=\"Euge\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/43035001-euge\"><img alt=\"Euge\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451588060p2/43035001.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1609311580?book_show_action=false\">Jun 06, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Euge\" class=\"user\" name=\"Euge\" href=\"/user/show/43035001-euge\">Euge</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9788478888535\" href=\"/book/show/7851245-harry-potter-y-la-orden-del-f-nix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/43035001-euge?shelf=faves\">faves</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1609311580\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1482591161027672628\">Well, well, well, well...where do I start? My heart is officially broken and empty? Okay, I guess that's the perfect way to start. I feel like I'm probably going to forget to write a lot of things but I'll do my best, so here we go!<br /><br />It took me a month to read this book, not because it was boring but because it was long, a lot of HUGE things happen in this one and I honestly didn't want to miss anything. I can't stop saying how much I love the way these books are written, it's so easy to get invol</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1482591161027672628\" style=\"display:none\">Well, well, well, well...where do I start? My heart is officially broken and empty? Okay, I guess that's the perfect way to start. I feel like I'm probably going to forget to write a lot of things but I'll do my best, so here we go!<br /><br />It took me a month to read this book, not because it was boring but because it was long, a lot of HUGE things happen in this one and I honestly didn't want to miss anything. I can't stop saying how much I love the way these books are written, it's so easy to get involved with the story and the characters, I literally felt as if I were one of them through the entire book.<br /><br />So now let's talk about the book (even though I may be the only person in this world who is reading Harry Potter for the first time, ugh): so many things happen, like omg! Several secrets are revealed and we get to know other characters (I mean apart from Harry, Ron, Hermione and the Weasleys) a lot more such as Neville who I just adored in this one! Also, I loved the way Harry, Ron and Hermione supported each other, even though they didn't agree on everything they would find a way to solve their differences. I obviously hated Umbridge, Cho annoyed me A LOT but oh well. All in all it was an amazing book, I couldn't put it down and I can't wait to finish this series even though I don't want it to end deep inside *crying*.<br /><br />Weird fact: I liked all the exams part, like I wish uni was that fun, I would study without complaining to be honest haha.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1482591161027672628\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id='comments_for_review_1609311580' style='display: none;'>\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1609311580' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1012981976\" />\n    <a title=\"Melissa\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7488934-melissa\"><img alt=\"Melissa\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460663471p2/7488934.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1012981976?book_show_action=false\">May 21, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Melissa\" class=\"user\" name=\"Melissa\" href=\"/user/show/7488934-melissa\">Melissa</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810590\" href=\"/book/show/7955580-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7488934-melissa?shelf=books-i-own\">books-i-own</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1012981976\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8807068262681982329\">Harry Potter and the Order Of the Phoenix has always been my less favorite of the series. It's just HUMONGOUS!! That's also the reason why it's been quite a while since I've reread this book. Usually when I did my annual reread I skipped this one or only read the first part of it (I know shame on me). That's also why I couldn't really remember the ending of the book. I knew how the movie ended of course. But now that I finally reread it completely I'm surprised about the amount of things I</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8807068262681982329\" style=\"display:none\">Harry Potter and the Order Of the Phoenix has always been my less favorite of the series. It's just HUMONGOUS!! That's also the reason why it's been quite a while since I've reread this book. Usually when I did my annual reread I skipped this one or only read the first part of it (I know shame on me). That's also why I couldn't really remember the ending of the book. I knew how the movie ended of course. But now that I finally reread it completely I'm surprised about the amount of things I forgot that were never mentioned in the movie. I feel quite ashamed of what I though about this book for the last couple of years. I always \"discarded\" this book as \"okay\" (again, shame on me)and yes I still think this book is freaking long and full with somewhat unnecessary information, but the general storyline of this one is also fabulous. The big fight in the ending is fast-paced and brilliantly described.<br /><br />The Harry Potter series is a huge part of my life. I grew up with the characters, reread the books multiple times, loved the movies, ... hell I even have the same birthday as Harry Potter!.... and yet, in some way I was able to rediscover this book in the most unexpected way. This proves once again how well JK Rowling writes. It gives me such an amazing feeling!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8807068262681982329\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n          <span id=\"reviewTextContainer203222819\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10965214156199588045\">2016<br /><br />I've always liked this book least of all, but this year re-reading it, I've change my mind.<br />Yes Harry's anger still got to me and yes I still feel it's not part of his character, but now I've realize that maybe it's because of Voldemort he's acting out; and with this in mind the entire meaning of the book changed.<br />The way Rowling build this story and made all of us hate Umbridge more than the original villain is amazing! And how she brings in all the little details to make the bigger picture s</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10965214156199588045\" style=\"display:none\">2016<br /><br />I've always liked this book least of all, but this year re-reading it, I've change my mind.<br />Yes Harry's anger still got to me and yes I still feel it's not part of his character, but now I've realize that maybe it's because of Voldemort he's acting out; and with this in mind the entire meaning of the book changed.<br />The way Rowling build this story and made all of us hate Umbridge more than the original villain is amazing! And how she brings in all the little details to make the bigger picture seem more than just a story shows how this series became the best know.<br /><br />Well let me keep going only 4 days to the release of Cursed child and I still have two books to read.<br /><br /><br />2015<br />For some reason this book is my least favorite. <br />Harry's anger tends to irritate me and the fact that he keeps shutting out Ron and Hermione is just not Harry for me. <br /><br />Still knowing now how all this ends, I get why Rowling had to make Harry go through this stage.<br /><br />It's very sad though the deaths that goes with this chapter of Harry's life.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10965214156199588045\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1518022756\" />\n    <a title=\"Sara Ghabar\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/46113221-sara-ghabar\"><img alt=\"Sara Ghabar\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470560997p2/46113221.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1518022756?book_show_action=false\">May 12, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Sara Ghabar\" class=\"user\" name=\"Sara Ghabar\" href=\"/user/show/46113221-sara-ghabar\">Sara Ghabar</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747551003\" href=\"/book/show/444327.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/46113221-sara-ghabar?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/46113221-sara-ghabar?shelf=owned\">owned</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1518022756\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10982156265418281771\"> I am ashamed to admit that it took me a long period of time to finish reading this book, but I can justify my actions by saying that: 1) I wasn't in a rush to end my enjoyment with J.K. Rowling's writing style. 2) I also wasn't much in a hurry to get to the heart-wrenching part (Hurry Potter... Sorry *.*). 3) The beginning wasn't so gripping to be honest with you. Now don't get me wrong, it wasn't boring in any mean, but wasn't the fast-paced, action-filled, eyes-glued-to-pages kind too. I am</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10982156265418281771\" style=\"display:none\"> I am ashamed to admit that it took me a long period of time to finish reading this book, but I can justify my actions by saying that: 1) I wasn't in a rush to end my enjoyment with J.K. Rowling's writing style. 2) I also wasn't much in a hurry to get to the heart-wrenching part (Hurry Potter... Sorry *.*). 3) The beginning wasn't so gripping to be honest with you. Now don't get me wrong, it wasn't boring in any mean, but wasn't the fast-paced, action-filled, eyes-glued-to-pages kind too. I am not complaining, thou! I mean, Suirisly *wink wink*, who's on earth would hate to read more about Hogwarts and our three musketeers!!! and let me tell you, those last 200 pages or so were so gripping that each time I had to put the book down it felt like I'm unpleasantly, forcefully, unwillingly donating one of my kidneys.<br /> SIMPLY A MASTERPIECE. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10982156265418281771\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1461140122\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4648175166343586650\">When you're in the process of reading the longest book of your life, you are either too eager to finish it or to dreadful to watch it end. In this matter, I was feeling both. Knowing what happens next in the life of Harry Potter is my door at the end of the silent corridor. A mystery that always provokes me to grab the knob and unveil it. But holding an 870 page book didn't help my anticipation. Nevertheless, I believe that the time I've allotted inside Hogwarts in its 5th installation is the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4648175166343586650\" style=\"display:none\">When you're in the process of reading the longest book of your life, you are either too eager to finish it or to dreadful to watch it end. In this matter, I was feeling both. Knowing what happens next in the life of Harry Potter is my door at the end of the silent corridor. A mystery that always provokes me to grab the knob and unveil it. But holding an 870 page book didn't help my anticipation. Nevertheless, I believe that the time I've allotted inside Hogwarts in its 5th installation is the rightful requirement for me to fully sink in and inhale its occurrences. The more pages I've flipped inside this wizarding world, the more of my soul I've voluntarily dedicate to it! Harry Potter is not just an experience, it's a way of living!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4648175166343586650\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2510736-luana?shelf=young-adult-fiction\">young-adult-fiction</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer63016881\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer18113128626181166364\">Glad to have read this again for the nth time. From here the story takes a different course and helps you come to terms with the death of your loved ones and appreciate more the people who are still with you. </span>\n\n          </span>\n
