</td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_151255500\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/151255500\" />\n    <a title=\"Aron\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1146888-aron\"><img alt=\"Aron\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1340492085p2/1146888.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/151255500?book_show_action=false\">Feb 28, 2011</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Aron\" class=\"user\" name=\"Aron\" href=\"/user/show/1146888-aron\">Aron</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">did not like it</span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"did not like it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer151255500\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17668443852484620062\">This book proves that fame and fortune is bad for good writing. Rowling was trapped by her desire to stick to the formula of one book per school year. While sometimes artificial constraints enhance the creative process, in this case the effect is the opposite. Voldomort comes back at the end of book 4. Do we really need a whole and very fat volume till we get ready for the real confrontation? And speaking of a fat volume: Rowling's editors are way too deferential at this point, and let the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17668443852484620062\" style=\"display:none\">This book proves that fame and fortune is bad for good writing. Rowling was trapped by her desire to stick to the formula of one book per school year. While sometimes artificial constraints enhance the creative process, in this case the effect is the opposite. Voldomort comes back at the end of book 4. Do we really need a whole and very fat volume till we get ready for the real confrontation? And speaking of a fat volume: Rowling's editors are way too deferential at this point, and let the author indulge herself with endless repetitions. Do we really need to stop at every floor in the ministry of magic? Do we have to be told what's on every floor of Saint Mungo's? When Hagrid leads Harry and Hermione through the forest, one gets the feeling 5 Quidditch matches could hvae been played during that interminable march. The climactic scene in the department of mysteries goes on and on and on, as the author tries to outdo herself with \"interesting\" rooms to visit. Instead of being thrilling it becomes tedious. The final confrontaion is anti-climactic. <br /><br />In short the book is a big fat fail, and 50% could have been cut out without any loss. In fact, if it wasn't for the one year a class constraint, the whole of this book could have taken up just a few chapters and we should have moved right into what is now book 6. I already had started losing interest in the series in the previous volume and in fact never got around to reading this volume and the subsequent ones when they were published. But recently, being a huge fan of the man, I decided to listen to the series through the Stephen Fry audiobook readings. His interpretation alone would have me add one star to my ratings of all previous volumes. But for this book, he only managed to carry me through. Had I been reading the text I never would have managed to finish. I'm glad I did, as I have started book 6 and it is already much improved as Rowling finally ditches the trite formula of the opening of the previous 4 books and varies (albeit only slightly) the whole Harry suffering at the Dursleys, being saved by the Weaselys dynamic. <br /><br />So while I can't recommend this book, you have to get through it to move on. So I strongly recommend everyone isten to the Fry audiobook version of the series. He truly brings the book to life, not to mention slyly making explicit the homoerotic undertones of various situations and characters (not least of which HP himself in his unrequited love of Ron). In any case, I would never have been able to finish the series without the help of the inimitable Mr. Fry.<br /><br />****Spoiler Alert<br /><br />In a related note, this book also underscores why the series as a whole is a failure despite Rowling being an extremely imaginative and talented writer. She never makes up her mind whether she wants the book to be fairy tale or myth. As the series progresses it gets darker and darker, with all the dead bodies piling up. But the classic myth of the hero has the main character learn about himself as he slays the dragons and demons he is forced to confront. He becomes a richer and more human character, as he discovers the world is not black and white but highly nuanced. Rowling can never seem to let Harry truly learn and mature because she herself seems to want to see the world in black and white. The climactic scene where Harry see's Snapes worst memory, for example, starts out as a potential moment for Harry to have a richer and more nuanced view of his father, Sirius and Snape. Instead, by the end of the book he is once again blaming Snape for Sirius' death! And his whole reaction to that (utterly unmoving) death is so over the top and childish. No real hero in the mythical sense, who has gone through what Harry did in the past 5 books would react in so unseemly and ridiculous a fashion. In general, the portrayal of Harry as some 15 year old teenager who is a victim of his hormones is an insult to all teenagers, most who are far more sophisticated than HP. In general, Harry, Ron and Hermione are unpleasant and one dimensional characters. They never seem to change, never learn from their mistakes, have no real compassion and in fact with their own prejudices and actions show themselves to be not much different than the death eaters they so despise.<br /><br />Even Tolkien, who has been so criticized for his one-sided portrayal of Mordor, allows his characters to mature, become more nuanced and more real. Rowling seems to be afraid to frontally confront the ambiguity of human nature, and so shrinks back from following her story to its human conclusions. For example, she wants us to believe, along with Harry, that despite his flaws Sirius is really the wonderful godfather Harry desperately wants, instead of a haughty Black who (most likely to spite his family) hates Deatheaters instead of Mudbloods, and is not really much different than his mom. He and all the rest would be far more interesting and human characters, if Rowling didn't keep pulling back from the ambiguity of what it means to be human.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17668443852484620062\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review151255500\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=7&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=151255500&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_151255500\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 151255500, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;\">3 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/151255500?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=8\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_151255500' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/151255500/comments?reverse=true\">View all 3 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_151255500' style='display: <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1710977234\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1710977234\" />\n    <a title=\"U+00C7avlan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/31501360-avlan\"><img alt=\"U+00C7avlan\" </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1710977234\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer257405082810103396\">U+0130lk U+00E7 U+0131ktU+0131 U+011F U+0131nda bazU+0131 okurlar tarafU+0131ndan pek iyi karU+015F U+0131lanmamU+0131 U+015FtU+0131 ZU+00FCmrU+00FCdU+00FCanka YoldaU+015FlU+0131 U+011F U+0131 diye hatU+0131rlU+0131yorum. U+00C7ok beU+011Fenen, hatta "serinin her kitabU+0131 bir U+00F6ncekinden daha iyi" diyerek bu romanU+0131 favori Harry Potter kitaplarU+0131 olarak sayanlar da oldu elbette, ama bir kesim gereksiz yere fazla uzun buldu. Pek bir olay olmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131, her U+015Feyin U+00E7ok yavaU+015F geliU+015FtiU+011Fi, hikayenin U+00E7ok savruk anlatU+0131ldU+0131 U+011F U+0131, gereksiz ergen U+00F6fkesiyle dolu olduU+011Fu ve yU+00FCzlerce, yU+00FCzlerce sayfa boyunca ipuU+00E7larU+0131 verilen, hazU+0131rlanU+0131lan olayU+0131n pek</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText257405082810103396\" style=\"display:none\">U+0130lk U+00E7 U+0131ktU+0131 U+011F U+0131nda bazU+0131 okurlar tarafU+0131ndan pek iyi karU+015F U+0131lanmamU+0131 U+015FtU+0131 ZU+00FCmrU+00FCdU+00FCanka YoldaU+015FlU+0131 U+011F U+0131 diye hatU+0131rlU+0131yorum. U+00C7ok beU+011Fenen, hatta \"serinin her kitabU+0131 bir U+00F6ncekinden daha iyi\" diyerek bu romanU+0131 favori Harry Potter kitaplarU+0131 olarak sayanlar da oldu elbette, ama bir kesim gereksiz yere fazla uzun buldu. Pek bir olay olmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131, her U+015Feyin U+00E7ok yavaU+015F geliU+015FtiU+011Fi, hikayenin U+00E7ok savruk anlatU+0131ldU+0131 U+011F U+0131, gereksiz ergen U+00F6fkesiyle dolu olduU+011Fu ve yU+00FCzlerce, yU+00FCzlerce sayfa boyunca ipuU+00E7larU+0131 verilen, hazU+0131rlanU+0131lan olayU+0131n pek de bir U+015Fey U+00E7 U+0131kmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131, okurlarU+0131n eleU+015Ftirisi. Ben bunlara katU+0131lmU+0131yorum, ama ZU+00FCmrU+00FCdU+00FCanka YoldaU+015FlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'nU+0131n serinin diU+011Fer kitaplarU+0131 kadar derli toplu olmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131nU+0131, bir de kendisinden U+00F6nceki iki kitabU+0131n sonunda gerU+00E7ekleU+015Fen kurgu harikasU+0131 zekice olaylar kadar bU+00FCyU+00FCk bir U+00E7 U+00F6zU+00FClme noktasU+0131 olmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131nU+0131 kabul ediyorum. (ErgenliU+011Fini en U+00E7ok bu kitapta yaU+015Fayan Harry'nin U+00F6fkesinin zaman zaman yorucu olduU+011Funu da.) SonuU+00E7ta bu yedi kitaplU+0131k bir serinin beU+015Finci kitabU+0131 ve pek U+00E7ok aU+00E7 U+0131dan bir geU+00E7iU+015F kitabU+0131. Yine de Rowling Harry'nin okuldaki ilk iki haftasU+0131nU+0131 gU+00FCn be gU+00FCn, ders ders anlatU+0131rken bile bunu U+00E7ok baU+015FarU+0131lU+0131 bir dille yapU+0131yor ve akU+0131cU+0131lU+0131 U+011F U+0131ndan da, sU+00FCrU+00FCkleyiciliU+011Finden de hiU+00E7bir U+015Fekilde fedakarlU+0131k etmiyor bence.<br><br>BU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FClU+00FCk dU+00FCnyasU+0131nU+0131n neredeyse tamamU+0131nU+0131n Harry'nin dikkat U+00E7ekmeye U+00E7alU+0131 U+015Fan, olaylarU+0131 kafasU+0131ndan uyduran bir yalancU+0131 olduU+011Funa inanmasU+0131 ve bunun zorluklarU+0131na U+00E7ok etkileyici bir U+015Fekilde deU+011FinilmiU+015F kitapta. Filmin az buU+00E7uk da olsa yansU+0131tmayU+0131 baU+015FaramadU+0131 U+011F U+0131 bir duygu; Harry'nin altU+0131 dolmayan nedenler sonucu deU+011Fil, son derece haklU+0131 olarak oluU+015FturduU+011Fu bir \"Herkes bana karU+015F U+0131,\" duygusu ve bunun getirdiU+011Fi yalnU+0131zlU+0131k ile U+00F6fkenin sonucunda kitaba yayU+0131lan karanlU+0131k, ZU+00FCmrU+00FCdU+00FCanka YoldaU+015FlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'nU+0131n en gU+00FC U+00E7lU+00FC noktalarU+0131ndan. AyrU+0131ca tU+00FCm sayfalarU+0131na hU+00FCkmeden \"fU+0131rtU+0131na U+00F6ncesi sessizlik\" havasU+0131, tek dU+00FC U+015FmanU+0131n Voldemort olmadU+0131 U+011F U+0131nU+0131, insanlarU+0131n U+00D6lU+00FCm Yiyen'ler ve iyi kalpli, harikulade yoldaU+015Flar olarak ikiye ayrU+0131lmadU+0131klarU+0131nU+0131 gU+00F6stererek bu tarz serilerin genelde yapmaya yeltenmediU+011Fi bir U+015Feyi yapmasU+0131 ve her zamankinden de gU+00FC U+00E7lU+00FC politik mesajlarU+0131, onu bir baU+015Fka tadU+0131ndan yenmez Harry Potter romanU+0131 yapmaya yetiyor da artU+0131yor bile.<br><br><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Kitapta beni rahatsU+0131z eden iki U+015Fey var: Sihir BakanlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'ndan BuharlaU+015Farak ayrU+0131ldU+0131 Voldemort. Madem bunu yapabiliyordu, niU+00E7in aylar U+00F6nce Kehanet OdasU+0131'na BuharlaU+015Farak elini uzatU+0131p Kehanet'i almadU+0131? Sihir BakanlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'na U+00F6n kapU+0131sU+0131ndan, BuharlaU+015Fmadan bile girebilirdi zorlasaydU+0131, sonuU+00E7ta kU+0131lU+0131k deU+011FiU+015Ftirmek, Voldemort gibi bU+00FCyU+00FCk bir bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FC iU+00E7in U+00E7ok zor olmasa gerek (U+00F6zellikle U+00C7ok U+00D6zlU+00FC U+0130ksir'i kullanarak Harry, Ron ve Hermi'nin son kitapta hem Sihir BakanlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'na, hem de Gringotts'a girdiU+011Fini dU+00FC U+015F U+00FCnecek olduU+011Fumuzda). Ya da bir adamU+0131nU+0131 gU+00F6nderip, kehaneti mesela filme aldU+0131rabilirdi. Evet adamlarU+0131nU+0131 gU+00F6ndermeyi denedi ama belli bir kehaneti, sadece kehanetin ilgili olduU+011Fu kiU+015Filer alabilir bilgisiyle dU+00F6ndU+00FCler biliyorum. Gelgelelim Harry ve arkadaU+015FlarU+0131 BakanlU+0131k'tayken, U+00D6lU+00FCm Yiyen'lerin dikkatini daU+011F U+0131tmak iU+00E7in kehanetlerle dolu raflarU+0131 bU+00FCyU+00FC yoluyla parU+00E7aladU+0131lar, bu olduU+011Funda da kehanetler yerlere dU+00FC U+015F U+00FCp aU+00E7 U+0131ldU+0131, ne dedikleri aU+00E7 U+0131k seU+00E7ik -o kehanetle hiU+00E7 de ilgisi olmayan kiU+015Filer tarafU+0131ndan- duyuldu. Yani Voldy'nin bir adamU+0131 elini uzatU+0131p alamazdU+0131 kehaneti belki, ama asasU+0131nU+0131 kullanU+0131p onu parU+00E7alayabilir, bu arada sU+00F6ylediklerini de bir kamera ya da ses kaydedici ya da hadi Muggle icatlarU+0131nU+0131n bu dU+00FCnyada pek yeri yok diyelim, Harry'nin Quidditch DU+00FCnya KupasU+0131'nda kullandU+0131 U+011F U+0131 EnvaigU+00F6z yoluyla kaydedebilir, sonra da Voldy'ye dinletebilirdi. BunlarU+0131n yerine o U+015Feytani, kudretli, zeki bU+00FCyU+00FCcU+00FCnU+00FCn, aylarca Harry'nin zihnine girmenin ve onu Esrar Dairesi'ne U+00E7ekip Kehanet'i aldU+0131rmak iU+00E7in sahte bir imgelem yaratmanU+0131n planlarU+0131nU+0131 yapmasU+0131, pek akla yatkU+0131n gelmiyor. (GerU+00E7i aynU+0131sU+0131 AteU+015F Kadehi'nde de vardU+0131, Deli GU+00F6z Moody gU+00F6rU+00FCnU+00FCmU+00FCndeki Barty Crouch Jr'U+0131n Harry'yi kaU+00E7 U+0131rmak iU+00E7in onu U+00DC U+00E7bU+00FCyU+00FC U+00E7 U+00FC TurnuvasU+0131'na sokmasU+0131, sonra da cidden bU+00FCtU+00FCn sU+00F6mestr bekleyip, gU+00F6revlerin sonuncusunun son aU+015FamasU+0131nda bU+00FCyU+00FClenmiU+015F bir anahtar yoluyla onu efendisinin yanU+0131na U+0131 U+015F U+0131nlamasU+0131na cidden gerek var mU+0131ydU+0131? YU+0131lU+0131n baU+015F U+0131nda, Harry'nin kiU+015Fisel bir eU+015FyasU+0131nU+0131 anahtar olarak bU+00FCyU+00FClemesi yeterli -ve U+00E7ok daha kolay- olmaz mU+0131ydU+0131?) ZU+00FCmrU+00FCdU+00FCanka YoldaU+015FlU+0131 U+011F U+0131'nda beni rahatsU+0131z eden bir bu, bir de Harry'nin Sirius'un kendisine bir iletiU+015Fim yU+00F6ntemi olarak verdiU+011Fi iki taraflU+0131 aynayU+0131 hiU+00E7 kullanmamU+0131 U+015F, merak edip kesekaU+011F U+0131dU+0131nU+0131 aU+00E7arak iU+00E7indeki U+015Feye bir kez bile bakmamU+0131 U+015F olmasU+0131. Bu saydU+0131 U+011F U+0131m iki durumdan biri gerU+00E7ekleU+015Fseydi kadar U+00E7ok U+015Fey deU+011FiU+015Firdi ki, Sirius kitabU+0131n sonunda hayatta olurdu bir kere. Ama o zaman bu kitap da olmazdU+0131. Bunu gU+00F6rebiliyorum, o yU+00FCzden dilimi U+0131sU+0131rU+0131p susmam gerek :) Zaten Rowling yarattU+0131 U+011F U+0131 evrenin kurallarU+0131nU+0131 iyi belirliyor, sonuU+00E7 olarak da okuyucunun mantU+0131ksU+0131z bulacaU+011F U+0131 az U+015Fey U+00E7 U+0131kU+0131yor. Arada bU+00F6yle durumlarla karU+015F U+0131laU+015F U+0131nca da, \"bu olay olmasa bu roman da olmazdU+0131\" diyip susup oturmak gerekiyor sanU+0131rU+0131m. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"257405082810103396\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/995225178\" />\n    <a title=\"arden\" class=\"left class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/995225178?book_show_action=false\">Sep 17, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"arden\" class=\"user\" name=\"arden\" href=\"/user/show/33033584-arden\">arden</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33033584-arden?shelf=faves\">faves</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer995225178\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10675283737529771313\">Spoilers probably <br /><br />You know what everyone's always saying this one's not as good as the other books in the series and no offense but I couldn't disagree more <br /><br />I love the order of the phoenix so much, mostly because of the portrayal of Harry's mental state. <br />I've read reviews of people complaining about Harry \"always bitching\" and being \"an ungrateful shit\" to which I can only respond with: did you realise that at the time the order of the phoenix takes place Harry has JUST witnessed the murderer of</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10675283737529771313\" style=\"display:none\">Spoilers probably <br /><br />You know what everyone's always saying this one's not as good as the other books in the series and no offense but I couldn't disagree more <br /><br />I love the order of the phoenix so much, mostly because of the portrayal of Harry's mental state. <br />I've read reviews of people complaining about Harry \"always bitching\" and being \"an ungrateful shit\" to which I can only respond with: did you realise that at the time the order of the phoenix takes place Harry has JUST witnessed the murderer of his parents (one of the most powerful wizards of all time) kill an innocent boy in front of him and almost murdered Harry himself and that Harry <br />1) blames himself for what happened to cedric<br />2)was left alone to live with his abusive family.for months. Without receiving news from anyone not even the people he loved and trusted the most like no offense but Harry James Potter deserves so much better I would die for that kid<br />Anyway so yes his outburst was 100% justified and I absolutely love the way his PTSD is being shown (it would have been beyond unrealistic if jkr had just ignored the toll the past events played on a CHILD but a lot of authors would probably have done just that so kudos to her) and i (a mentally ill teenager) can really #relate to him being upset about /everyone/ being informed about the order before him<br /><br />Another thing I really like about ootp is the beginning/rescue scene it's my favourite start of any of the books in the series (apart from maybe deathly hallows but that scene was a parallel to this one so..). <br /><br />Cho Chang is really well written in this book and, again, her reaction to Cedric's death was also 100% justified. (/SPOILERS/ also on a side note: contrary to what the movie showed it wasnt cho that ratted the DA out it was Marietta lol) <br /><br />Now that I've gotten all this off my chest o would like to just name a few of my favourite aspects of the book: <br /><br />- Tonks (one of my favourite characters) was introduced and I love her a lot and I loved the whole aspect of harry being able to feel hopeful again. Gracias jkr<br /><br />- everyone knows I hate the movies with a burning passion so it comes to know surprise that I absolutely love the way the characterizations of the characters are different (better) in the books (mostly the fact that Ron isn't just a stupid lazy no good jealous friend who only ever eats and hermione is perfect and has zero flaws and that ginny,,,, actually has a personality in the books) <br /><br />- I liked the McGonagall scenes. A lot. <br /><br />- unrelated but do you think lucius malfoy waited a long time in the ministry? Did he practice what he was gonna say? I'm not saying he used the crystal balls as mirrors to check his hair but he totally did <br /><br />- draco is a garbage kid but I love him also he is very much in love with Harry don't fight me on this <br /><br />- this is the only book in the series that I cry at everytime I reread it none of the other deaths moved me like this one did rip like nit even the death scene but the reaction to it yikes I'm gonna cry even more aren't I <br /><br />- I didn't like luna in the movies but I liked her in the books also she is probably the most #me like character of all time (only in the books) <br /><br />- Harry James Potter deserves the world <br /><br />- Dumbleton being emotionally abusive to Harry and manipulating him hmmmm that's homophobic Joanne <br />- the Umbridge r**e scene was wild and unnecessary tho like. please don't. No matter how bad a female character is don't do that to them. Never do that to them. Especially as a self proclaimed feminist. <br /><br /><br />(I write this on my phone please don't mind typos) *sunglasses emoji* </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10675283737529771313\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_142318808\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/142318808\" />\n    <a title=\"Micheline\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4845030-micheline\"><img alt=\"Micheline\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434381852p2/4845030.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/142318808?book_show_action=false\">Aug 19, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Micheline\" class=\"user\" name=\"Micheline\" href=\"/user/show/4845030-micheline\">Micheline</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439358064\" href=\"/book/show/77522.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">everyone</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=multiple-reads\">multiple-reads</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=classics\">classics</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=magic-witches-wizards\">magic-witches-wizards</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=hero-worship\">hero-worship</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=epic\">epic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=high-fantasy\">high-fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer142318808\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10447296083422209159\"><b>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</b> is the fifth book in the series and decidedly the longest book of them all. When I first read the series, it was my least favorite (because UMBRIDGE) but rereading the series has changed that and now, other than the Umbridge bit, this is one of my favorites in the series...despite the devastating ending. But more on that later.<br /><br /><b>The Order of the Phoenix</b> finds Harry still reeling from the terrible events at the end of <b>The Goblet of Fire</b>. Naturally, it's had</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10447296083422209159\" style=\"display:none\"><b>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</b> is the fifth book in the series and decidedly the longest book of them all. When I first read the series, it was my least favorite (because UMBRIDGE) but rereading the series has changed that and now, other than the Umbridge bit, this is one of my favorites in the series...despite the devastating ending. But more on that later.<br /><br /><b>The Order of the Phoenix</b> finds Harry still reeling from the terrible events at the end of <b>The Goblet of Fire</b>. Naturally, it's had lasting and devastating effects on him. I've never understood why some readers have complained about Harry's moodiness in this instalment because to me, it's obviously 110% warranted (big surprise, huh?) Honestly though, I dare anyone to go through half the shit that Harry does and remain happy and positive. Not.gonna.happen. And to top everything off, Harry and the rest of the school have that vile toad Umbridge to deal with. *fumes* The addition of Umbridge serves a purpose of course, and not just to torture the readers and students of Hogwarts. Her role is to further drive home the extent of corruption within the Ministry of Magic, not to mention proving how some people should never be given any amount of power.<br /><br />If you can move past Umbridge's infuriating presence, there's a lot of brilliant things going on in <b>The Order of the Phoenix</b>. There's more Sirius and Lupin, there's backstory on the first Wizarding War, the truly awesome formation of Dumbledore's Army, the introduction of the Room of Requirement, the OWLs, Quidditch (!!) and the looming, foreboding presence of Voldemort. I thought that the fact that Harry can now pick up on Voldy's moods to be truly compelling and terrifying. It's a key plot point that will be oh-so important later in the series. Oh and we finally get to know the real Ginny and she is just all kinds of awesome. I have so much love for her strength and how real she is here, she's a breath of fresh air U+2665 Her setting Harry straight in Grimmauld Place is one of my favorite things and it's from that point their kinship is kindled. And let's not forget Harry taking up the role of a DADA teacher and being spectacular at it! I absolutely loved Dumbledore's Army and how all the students learned so much from Harry's awesomeness. <br /><br />In <b>The Chamber of Secrets</b>, I'm always deeply bothered by Harry being an outcast. The same can be said for <b>The Goblet of Fire</b> but for me that was mostly due to Harry and Ron being on the outs. In <b>The Order of the Phoenix</b>, I enjoy how Harry just has zero fucks to give about it all. It bothers him, but he isn't scared of standing up for himself or telling people off for being prats. His new handle on things is incredibly admirable and...cut to me fangirling about The Boy Who Lives (AGAIN).<br /><br />Plot-wise, this is a huge book for a reason, there is a lot going on, many of which I alluded to above but I think the pacing remains tight, and other than the Grawp storyline - which I could have done without - I wouldn't remove a thing. The characters once again grow and mature significantly, the tone is intense, there's a HUGE LOSS at the end that is devastating beyond words (so I won't even try - I'll NEVER be ok with it) and a GINORMOUS reveal that puts us firmly on path for the end game that draws ever nearer. <b>The Order of the Phoenix</b> is an ultra compelling addition to the series and well worth the page count!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10447296083422209159\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div      \n\n<div id=\"review_1376326235\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1376326235\" />\n    <a title=\"NerdyBirdie\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/38552452-nerdybirdie\"><img alt=\"NerdyBirdie\" right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1376326235?book_show_action=false\">Jun 25, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"NerdyBirdie\" class=\"user\" name=\"NerdyBirdie\" href=\"/user/show/38552452-nerdybirdie\">NerdyBirdie</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855690\" href=\"/book/show/22844196-harry-potter-and-the-order-of-the-phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38552452-nerdybirdie?shelf=read-in-2015\">read-in-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38552452-nerdybirdie?shelf=read-slowly\">read-slowly</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38552452-nerdybirdie?shelf=favorite-covers\">favorite-covers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38552452-nerdybirdie?shelf=favorite-author\">favorite-author</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38552452-nerdybirdie?shelf=worth-the-hype\">worth-the-hype</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38552452-nerdybirdie?shelf=favorites-2015\">favorites-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1376326235\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9096420555001293993\">I really donU+2019t know how I felt about this one. I mean, I <b>love</b> <i>Harry Potter</i> (even though IU+2019m <b>extremely</b> late on the bandwagon). I gave this book a five out of five stars because of all the <i>feels</i> but personally, I think that this might be my least favorite book in the series. I think I might as well have given this at least a 4.5 star rating. But, oh well.<br /><br />First off, this book just starts off with the whole Ministry of Magic issue and the fact that Harry may have used magic illegally. Not only was t</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9096420555001293993\" style=\"display:none\">I really donU+2019t know how I felt about this one. I mean, I <b>love</b> <i>Harry Potter</i> (even though IU+2019m <b>extremely</b> late on the bandwagon). I gave this book a five out of five stars because of all the <i>feels</i> but personally, I think that this might be my least favorite book in the series. I think I might as well have given this at least a 4.5 star rating. But, oh well.<br /><br />First off, this book just starts off with the whole Ministry of Magic issue and the fact that Harry may have used magic illegally. Not only was this situation extremely frustrating, I think that this book just kept on making bad things after bad things happen, and it wasnU+2019t the same fun tone anymore. I mean, I understand that this series obviously changes direction, but I feel like there couldU+2019ve been something more from the old times, right?<br /><br />Also, can I just say that Luna Lovegood is the BOMB! She <i>knows</i> what sheU+2019s doing, man! She doesnU+2019t let anyone tell her anything!<br /><br />Unfortunately, thereU+2019s this witch (you know, when you change the U+2018wU+2019 to a U+2018bU+2019) in this book. Her nameU+2019s Dolores Umbridge. God damn, that woman is more frustrating than . . . <b>anything IU+2019ve ever read. Dolores Umbridge reminds me of those people that are mentally sick and weird sadists because this woman will get pleasure from your pain. ItU+2019s disgusting. It was also <u>extremely difficult to read about this witch</u></b>. I mean, besides the fact that she has an obsession with ruining peopleU+2019s lives, <i>she thinks that sheU+2019s helping them</i>. Like, woman, you are <i>insane</i> and there is no justification for being a tyrant! <b>Dolores Umbridge is a loner lady who is mentally insane and thinks Hogwarts is a mental institution and her only best friend (possibly even acquaintance) is the Ministry of Magic Handbook (or law book, or whatever the eff this psycho uses)</b>.<br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Can we talk about something? Does J.K. Rowling have a <i>goal</i> to kill off all of my favorite characters?! I mean, she kills off Cedric in <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i>! Now, itU+2019s Sirius. <b>Like, what the eff?! Why is she doing this? <u>I mean, <i>what did Sirius ever do?!</i></u></b> At the beginning of <i>Harry Potter and the Order of Phoenix</i>, I was kind of upset with Sirius because I agreed with Molly more on HarryU+2019s life and that Harry is not his father. But still. Still. ItU+2019s Sirius Black. I feel like I need time before I can even touch the next <i>Harry Potter</i>. That was upsetting. Next thing you know, in <i>Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince</i> she starts killing off Hermione, Ron, Molly, Fred-George, and Dumbledore, anyone that rocks!<br /><br />And SnapeU+2019s memory! (Lol, that came out of nowhere!) That was so sad! But that still doesnU+2019t give justification for being rude to a little boy who doesnU+2019t even know his parents properly. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Overall, <i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i> is probably my least favorite book in the series, but I think that IU+2019ll enjoy the last two books more! Hopefully, the drama that goes down wonU+2019t be too bad! IU+2019m looking forward to the next one, I just need some time because . . . well, you know.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9096420555001293993\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1727048120\" />\n    <a title=\"Rikke\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4327582-rikke\"><img alt=\"Rikke\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467464893p2/4327582.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1727048120?book_show_action=false\">Aug 20, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Rikke\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rikke\" href=\"/user/show/4327582-rikke\">Rikke</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was ok</span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747569404\" href=\"/book/show/861388.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4327582-rikke?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4327582-rikke?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4327582-rikke?shelf=owned-books\">owned-books</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1727048120\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6156693488053912131\">This is the hard one.<br /><br />This is the longest Harry Potter-novel, and it is the hardest one to finish. Its many pages doesn't work in its favor. I remember my sister giving up on it, even though she had loved the series so far. She simply couldn't make it past the angry main character, screaming in Caps Lock, the long summer without answers and the many discussions of politics. She wanted to read about Hogwarts; about spells, magical creatures and adventures. <br /><br />And she wasn't the only one. <br /><br />The main pro</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6156693488053912131\" style=\"display:none\">This is the hard one.<br /><br />This is the longest Harry Potter-novel, and it is the hardest one to finish. Its many pages doesn't work in its favor. I remember my sister giving up on it, even though she had loved the series so far. She simply couldn't make it past the angry main character, screaming in Caps Lock, the long summer without answers and the many discussions of politics. She wanted to read about Hogwarts; about spells, magical creatures and adventures. <br /><br />And she wasn't the only one. <br /><br />The main problem is the pace. This book paves the way for book 6 and 7. And while I appreciate Rowling taking her time to build up her finale, it doesn't work for me at all. This book is filled with more questions than answers U+2013 and most famously, I hate the way the thestrals were handled.<br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Thestrals can only be seen by someone, who has watched someone die. One could argue that Harry should be able to see them from the get-go, but Rowling has made it clear, that he didn't fully comprehend what was happening to his parents as he was only a toddler, and therefore wasn't able to see thestrals. However, all that changes when he watched Cedric die in book four.<br />But(!) shouldn't he then be able to see the thestrals, when he leaves the school in book four? Apparently not. <br /><br />Rowling says: \"<i>If Harry had seen them then and we hadn't explained them then, <b>I thought that would be rather a cheat on the reader in that Harry suddenly sees these monsters but we don't go anywhere with them</b>, so to explain to myself I said that you had to have seen the death and allowed it to sink in a little bit before slowly these creatures became solid in front of you.</i>\"<br /><br />The thestrals are a product of convinience. Rowling made up the clumsy rules (which are never fully explained in the books, leaving many readers puzzled), because she didn't want to explain the thestrals in the ending of a book. The solution she came up with is far from elegant, it is so contrived, making you extremely aware of the writer behind the book, pulling the strings and arranging the words in order to make the story flow nicely. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />While I understand why Harry is angry, and while I understand why he needs to be isolated, I feel like Sirius was done a major injustice in this book. His restlessness is of course understandable, but his need to encourage Harry to trouble and danger is so unlike him. <br />Sirius spent the entirety of book four warning Harry about upcoming dangers, urging him to be selfish and only focusing on getting safely out of the tournament. But in this book, Sirius suddenly becomes irresponsible, urging Harry to act out instead of being safe. Why? The man spent half of his lifetime in Azkaban U+2013 I would think he had learned some patience. Instead, a few months in hiding turns him into a madman.<br /><br />This book suffers from its length and from Harry's isolation. It becomes quite tiresome U+2013 though I of course always loved the idea of Dumbledore's Army as a way for the younger generation to mimic the Order of the Phoenix.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6156693488053912131\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1727048120\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right Den har U+00E6dt mere end halvdelen :D Og virkelig et irriterende sted den har cuttet, da det sU+00E5 lyder som en virkelig sur kommentar, og sU+00E5dan var den bare slet ikke skrevet oprindeligt :D Hvad jeg rent faktisk skrev var:<br />I completely disagree Rikke, but I might be one of the few that do, since The order of Phoenix is actually my favorite in the Harry Potter series :D But, on the other hand, my least favorite is The Prisoner of Azkaban, which seems to be most peoples favorite. So apparently I'm part of a minority in the Harry Potter community. U+0392 U+03AD U+03B2 U+03B1 U+03B9 U+03B1, 800 U+03C3 U+03C7 U+03B5 U+03B4 U+03CC U+03BD U+03C3 U+03B5 U+03BB U+03AF U+03B4 U+03B5 U+03C2 U+03BA U+03B1 U+03B9 U+03BC U+03AC U+03BB U+03B9 U+03C3 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03C4 U+03AD U+03C4 U+03BF U+03B9 U+03BF U+03C5 U+03C0 U+03B5 U+03C1 U+03B9 U+03B5 U+03C7 U+03BF U+03BC U+03AD U+03BD U+03BF U+03C5 U+03B5 U+03AF U+03BD U+03B1 U+03B9 U+03B4 U+03CD U+03C3 U+03BA U+03BF U+03BB U+03BF U+03BD U+2019 U+03B1 U+03C0 U+03BF U+03C4 U+03C5 U+03C0 U+03C9 U+03B8 U+03BF U+03CD U+03BD U+03C3 U+03B5 U+03BC U+03B9 U+03B1 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03B9 U+03BD U+03AF U+03B1 U+03B4 U+03C5 U+03CC U+03BC U+03B9 U+03C3 U+03B9 U+03C9 U+03C1 U+03CE U+03BD.<br /><br />U+03A4 U+03BF U+03B2 U+03B9 U+03B2 U+03BB U+03AF U+03BF, U+03BC U+03B5 U+03C4 U+03B7 U+03B3 U+03BD U+03C9 U+03C3 U+03C4 U+03AE U+03B3 U+03C1 U+03B1 U+03C6 U+03AE U+03C4 U+03B7 U+03C2 Rowling, U+03AD U+03C1 U+03C7 U+03B5 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03B9 U+03BD U+03B1 U+03B2 U+03AC U+03BB U+03B5 U+03B9 U+03C4 U+03B7 U+03BD U+03B9 U+03C3 U+03C4</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2995974952275408287\" style=\"display:none\">U+0388 U+03C7 U+03BF U+03BD U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03C2 U+03C0 U+03AC U+03C1 U+03B5 U+03B9 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03B2 U+03B9 U+03B2 U+03BB U+03AF U+03B1 U+03BC U+03BF U+03BD U+03CC U+03C4 U+03B5 U+03C1 U+03BC U+03B1 U+03BA U+03B9 U+03AD U+03C7 U+03BF U+03BD U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03C2 U+03B4 U+03B5 U+03B9 U+03C0 U+03C1 U+03CC U+03C3 U+03C6 U+03B1 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03C4 U+03B7 U+03BC U+03B5 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03C6 U+03BF U+03C1 U+03AC U+03C4 U+03BF U+03C5 U+03B2 U+03B9 U+03B2 U+03BB U+03AF U+03BF U+03C5 U+03C3 U+03B5 U+03C4 U+03B1 U+03B9 U+03BD U+03AF U+03B1 U+03B8 U+03B1 U+03AE U+03B8 U+03B5 U+03BB U+03B1 U+03BD U+03B1 U+03BE U+03B5 U+03BA U+03B9 U+03BD U+03AE U+03C3 U+03C9 U+03C9 U+03C2 U+03B5 U+03BE U+03AE U+03C2. size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/17295549-liberty-k?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1330012957\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15296541147175516978\">Maybe this is a bad dream, right? Maybe that didn't happened!<br><br>This was a really <b>dark</b> book.<br><br><b>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</b>, the fifth book in the Harry Potter series, starts with a very moody Harry Potter. In the other books Harry's behaviour and feelings were light and cheerful. <br>Well not on this folks!<br><br>The book starts with the Dementor's attack and Harry tries to save himself and his cousin's life by using magic but that leads to being expelled by the Ministry. But not really because Dum</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15296541147175516978\" style=\"display:none\">Maybe this is a bad dream, right? Maybe that didn't happened!<br><br>This was a really <b>dark</b> book.<br><br><b>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</b>, the fifth book in the Harry Potter series, starts with a very moody Harry Potter. In the other books Harry's behaviour and feelings were light and cheerful. <br>Well not on this folks!<br><br>The book starts with the Dementor's attack and Harry tries to save himself and his cousin's life by using magic but that leads to being expelled by the Ministry. But not really because Dumbledore persuaded the Ministry to make a hearing for Potter's case. And in all that, all summer the newspapers calls him a liar. A lot to deal with a fifteen years old boy!<br><br>But then he meets the Order of the Phoenix (so many great characters!) and Ron and Hermione again in Twelve Grimmauld Place, Siriu's house. <br><br>The trial scene was so stressful to read because Harry was sure he couldn't go again to Hogwarts and because of Dumbledore's behaviour (no eye contact with sad Harry but then at the end of the book we know why he acted like that!).<br><br>Harry is now in Hogwarts with all his friends (we meet a new one, Luna Lovegood) and enemies (yep I'm talking about Malfoy) and again everything is falling apart. Harry is angry with everyone, Hagrid is missing, the fifth year is going to be hella stressfull and we meet a new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, Dolores Umbridge. <br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1388560195ra/7869999.gif\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>The most amazing part in the book? <b>The last battle!</b><br>Yep the book has a battle and it is <b>the most epic thing</b> a reader could read!<br>But let me talk about the veil. Is it true? No it can't be! I am still in denial.<br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380222758ra/648036.gif\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Why J.K. ? WHYYYY? <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Why kill Sirius? <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> The ending left me out of breath and my heart pounding like crazy!<br><br>Can't wait for the next book and I know already that my heart is going to break in pieces. Yep, pretty sure!</[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n       \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7574785551065091230\">ahh my bones ache and muscles stiff,stiffer than ever........<br />A massive read this time around but...........<br />I'm Done o yess!<br />Rowling damn you for writing so many pages and pages,and damnedest <br />of me for not skipping a single one!<br />so?m I to say how this one went?<br />really?<br />you got to be kidding me coming-of-age story. Harry face</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7574785551065091230\" style=\"display:none\">ahh my bones ache and muscles stiff,stiffer than ever........<br />A massive read this time around but...........<br />I'm Done o yess!<br />Rowling damn you for writing so many pages and pages,and damnedest <br />of me for not skipping a single one!<br />so?m I to say how this one went?<br />really?<br />you got to be kidding me right?<br />well I'll be succinct on things this time around,so the thing is....<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, more than any of the four previous novels in the series, is a coming-of-age story. Harry faces the thorny transition into adulthood, when adult heroes are revealed to be fallible, and matters that seemed black-and-white suddenly come out in shades of gray. Gone is the wide-eyed innocent, the whiz kid of Sorcerer's Stone. Here we have an adolescent who's sometimes sullen, often confused (especially about girls), and always self-questioning. Confronting death again, as well as a startling prophecy, Harry ends his year at Hogwarts exhausted and pensive.and very confused!<br /> and no doubt<br /><br />U+201CWit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure.U+201D <br />go on!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7574785551065091230\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/775510145\" />\n    <a title=\"vLadimiR\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/23489815-vladimir\"><img alt=\"vLadimiR\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461216116p2/23489815.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/775510145?book_show_action=false\">Dec 05, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"vLadimiR\" class=\"user\" name=\"vLadimiR\" href=\"/user/show/23489815-vladimir\">vLadimiR</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer775510145\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5746606230779111263\"><br /> The O.W.L.S. (Ordinary Wizarding Levels) are just around the corner as Harry and his friends return to Hogwarts for their fifth year. But while our main characters think about what careers they want to pursue in the future, the Dark Lord and his followers are gathering forces in pursuit of a certain prophecy foretold during Harry's birth.<br /><br /> After Harry's rejection from the secret order that Dumbledore established to fight the Dark Lord, due to his age, our young wizard decides to take matters int</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5746606230779111263\" style=\"display:none\"><br /> The O.W.L.S. (Ordinary Wizarding Levels) are just around the corner as Harry and his friends return to Hogwarts for their fifth year. But while our main characters think about what careers they want to pursue in the future, the Dark Lord and his followers are gathering forces in pursuit of a certain prophecy foretold during Harry's birth.<br /><br /> After Harry's rejection from the secret order that Dumbledore established to fight the Dark Lord, due to his age, our young wizard decides to take matters into his hands. With the help of his best friends and a handful of new recruits, Harry is determined to stop Lord Voldemort and his plans by forming an army of their own. This would be easier said than done, however, as the ministry begins to meddle in Hogwarts' affairs through the arrival of the new Defense Against the Dark Arts professor, Dolores Umbridge.<br /><br /> Every new installment of the series gets thicker and thicker, and for good reason because there aren't seem to be enough pages to contain all the excitement that this book provides.<br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ My favorite scene (which its movie adaptation unfortunately didn't do justice to) was the unbelievable showdown between Dumbledore & Lord Voldemort in the halls of the Ministry. It was the very first time that I got a glimpse of the extent, mastery and sophistication that Dumbledore has over magic. He was described to have just <i>gracefully</i> walked through Lord Voldemort's attacks and performed highly advanced spells with minimal gestures of his wand.<<br /> <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /> I was also shocked about the revelations in this book such as another friend of Harry's whom he shares the same birthday with who could have been \"The Chosen One\" instead of our hero.<br /><br /> Surprising secrets, exciting adventures and tear jerking moments await anyone who will read this book, both fans and beginners alike. Highly recommended!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5746606230779111263\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div Lui si difende e cosU+00EC viene espulso dalla scuola e costrett</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8663212144532629817\" style=\"display:none\">SERIE HARRY POTTER n. 5<br /><br />Continuo a ripetermelo..perchU+00E9 ho letto solo ora questa serie? Possiamo definirlo un libro di passaggio dove Harry Ron ed Hermione (e tutti attorno a loro) sono alle prese con gli ormoni impazziti. Harry finalmente esce con Cho, anche se non gli va troppo bene, ma almeno U+00E8 riuscito a farsi avanti. <br />Questa volta partiamo subito con il botto, dei Dissennatori mentre Harry U+00E8 dai Dudley in vacanz, tentano di ucciderlo. Lui si difende e cosU+00EC viene espulso dalla scuola e costretto a presentarsi in udienza per essere giudicato dal Ministero della Magia. Tutto si risolve bene grazie a Silente. In questo mdoo Harry viene a conoscenza dell'esistenza dell'Ordine della Fenice, ne fa parte pure il suo padrino Sirius, tant'U+00E8 che la sede a casa sua. Al ritorno ad Hogwarts ci sarU+00E0 una nuova professoressa la Umbridge che fa parte del Ministero ed U+00E8 lU+00EC per controllare Silente e soprattutto sta cercando (cone del resto il Ministero della Magia) di occultare il fatto che Voldemort U+00E8 tornato. Insomma tante novitU+00E0, tante sorprese e soprattutto tanti guai per i nostri eroi. Mi U+00E8 spiaciuto che Fred e George abbiano lasciato la scuola..mi facevano troppo ridere<br />Alla fine ho pianto...ma si puU+00F2???Sirius non doveva morire!!!! Harry ha saputo della Profezia e tanto altro ancora. Era ora che sapessimo cosa c'U+00E8 dietro!!! Sono ancora frastornata..praticamente l'ho letto in tre giorni questo libro. Anche se alcune parti forse poteva tagliarle..ma pi ci penso, forse U+00E8 stato meglio cosU+00EC, ha creato un nuovo quadro psicologico di tutti i personaggi. Siamo entrati dentro di loro. Che dire? mi U+00E8 piaciuto molto. Vorrei subito leggere il prossimo, ma forse U+00E8 meglio aspettare un po' devo far mie tutte queste che sono successe.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8663212144532629817\" href=\"#\" <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1126653808\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1126653808\" />\n    <a title=\"Jake Hartnett\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/21045404-jake-hartnett\"><img alt=\"Jake Hartnett\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1414877404p2/21045404.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1126653808?book_show_action=false\">Mar 07, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jake Hartnett\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jake Hartnett\" href=\"/user/show/21045404-jake-hartnett\">Jake Hartnett</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1126653808\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8592134464959168430\">I've finally conquered the unassailable, paperback-Leviathan that is 'The Order of the Phoenix'. Yay! And I've come away unscathed. 800 pages couldn't defeat me in the end.<br /><br />I'm glad I persisted with this one, even though there were times when I had to take breaks from it to read other short books in between (The Martian, Wit'chfire and Steelheart) to name but a few. This is the only one of the series so far that I've given less than five stars for, as I felt it was the weakest of them. Plus, I do</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8592134464959168430\" style=\"display:none\">I've finally conquered the unassailable, paperback-Leviathan that is 'The Order of the Phoenix'. Yay! And I've come away unscathed. 800 pages couldn't defeat me in the end.<br /><br />I'm glad I persisted with this one, even though there were times when I had to take breaks from it to read other short books in between (The Martian, Wit'chfire and Steelheart) to name but a few. This is the only one of the series so far that I've given less than five stars for, as I felt it was the weakest of them. Plus, I don't think the sheer enormity of it helped much, either. 800 pages is a lot of pages, and I can't help but feel the same story could have been told in around 600 or so. There were short periods where I felt the story dragged on a bit unnecessarily at times, which came to be one of the reasons I took my short breaks away from this title. But then the story would pick right back up again and keep me engrossed.<br /><br />With regards to the charactersU+2014or additionsU+2014I thought Luna Lovegood was a breath of fresh air to the team, adding something different to the lineup that was otherwise missing before. And, undoubtably, Umbridge (someone who you'll want to strangle after a few hundred pages) was brilliantly portrayed as the villain. I enjoyed hating her so much, which means she was masterfully created.<br /><br />Though I've seen the films, and know what to expect in the coming titles, it's clear that so much content from the book is left out, which means I'll no doubt still be surprised when I come to read The Half-Blood Prince, which can only be a good thing; and seeing how shit kicked off towards the latter parts of The Order of the Phoenix, I'm expecting big thins from the next one.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8592134464959168430\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1126653808\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1126653808\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1126653808&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1126653808'><a id=\"like_count_review_1126653808\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1126653808?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">7 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1126653808\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1126653808\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=7&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1126653808&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1126653808\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1126653808, true, &#39;&#39;); $ratingGraph.clone();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();\n          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');\n          $copy.find('script').remove();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);\n      }\n  //]]>\n  </script>\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n<div id=\"bookReviews\">\n  \n\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section firstReview\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_7692495\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/7692495\" />\n    <a title=\"Annalisa\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/542037-annalisa\"><img alt=\"Annalisa\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1226336540p2/542037.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/7692495?book_show_action=false\">Oct 13, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Annalisa\" class=\"user\" name=\"Annalisa\" href=\"/user/show/542037-annalisa\">Annalisa</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">everyone! please read this series</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=movies\">movies</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer7692495\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer425340266630352223\">Some of my favorite moments happen in book 5: occlumency, Snape's worst memory, the battle between Dumbledore and Voldemort, finally a formidable death eater (Lestrange), Dumbledore's Army, the dementors attack, the evil manipulations of Umbridge, and of course, the fact that Harry, finally, was wrong in his rush to conclusions and did not save the day but needed rescuing himself. Such a good book. <br /><br />But strangely enough, I wouldn't consider it my favorite. My complaint about this book is how much</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText425340266630352223\" style=\"display:none\">Some of my favorite moments happen in book 5: occlumency, Snape's worst memory, the battle between Dumbledore and Voldemort, finally a formidable death eater (Lestrange), Dumbledore's Army, the dementors attack, the evil manipulations of Umbridge, and of course, the fact that Harry, finally, was wrong in his rush to conclusions and did not save the day but needed rescuing himself. Such a good book. <br /><br />But strangely enough, I wouldn't consider it my favorite. My complaint about this book is how much it dragged in the beginning. I get the importance of introducing the house of Black and Order of the Phoenix, but still too long. Get to school already. What Rowling is excellent at is painting a picture of detail while still keeping you interested so you never know which minor incidents are going to comeback with major importance. It makes the books unpredictable. This is one of the few times in the series where I wished she'd cut out the detail. Little did I know how important those details were. <br /><br />At first read, I was disappointed with her writing. I felt she was tainted by the release of the movies, writing movie scripts instead of imaginative tales that could never come to pass on screen. But reading the series over again, I could not pinpoint my initial reaction so maybe it was me who was tainted. And then I heard that she waited so long to release this book because the series had hit worldwide fandom never before seen in children's literature and she was scared. I can respect that. I'll take all those years of tortured waiting for perfection.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"425340266630352223\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review7692495\">\n  <td class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1457858564\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7833865769842588052\"><b> Actual rating: 4 </b> <br /><br />This is my least favourite of the books so far, though obviously I still enjoyed it! <br /><br />My problems with the book were personal, mostly just certain characters and the way they were acting was annoying me to a point that I had to take a rest for a few minutes before picking it up again. For example, I was absolutely furious when Harry was on detention with Umbridge, she was basically torturing him and HE DIDN'T SAY ANYTHING TO ANYONE???? Harry let his pride get to him too much fo</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7833865769842588052\" style=\"display:none\"><b> Actual rating: 4 </b> <br /><br />This is my least favourite of the books so far, though obviously I still enjoyed it! <br /><br />My problems with the book were personal, mostly just certain characters and the way they were acting was annoying me to a point that I had to take a rest for a few minutes before picking it up again. For example, I was absolutely furious when Harry was on detention with Umbridge, she was basically torturing him and HE DIDN'T SAY ANYTHING TO ANYONE???? Harry let his pride get to him too much for my liking in this book and just the way he acted and some of the things he thought got on my nerves. Also, Hermione got on my nerves a little as well with how much she was constantly nagging everyone.... <br /><br />Also, this book felt so LONG. And I know it was an 800 page book but there were a few parts that just dragged and I felt could have been removed? I don't know. <br /><br />To create a character, such as Umbridge, that someone can absolutely loathe whilst reading is a true talent and I must give Rowling props for that. (I hated her in this more than I've hated Voldemort in the whole series!) <br /><br />Overall I did enjoy this book very much however with those little things that annoyed me, I couldn't give it a higher rating. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7833865769842588052\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div       <span id=\"reviewTextContainer34544815\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5721063804960316458\"><b>***SPOILER ALERT***</b><br /><br />This was the longest I suppose so far when I've read it. It contains really good stuff too. I really like the character of Luna Lovegood in this one. Harry in the beginning of the story became an outsider because he was believe as a liar and insane for saying that Voldemort was alive. So I felt that Harry and Luna shared a common feeling of being alone that made them good friends easily.<br /><br />I also love the preparation in there OWLS, they were really busy studying and I felt that I</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5721063804960316458\" style=\"display:none\"><b>***SPOILER ALERT***</b><br /><br />This was the longest I suppose so far when I've read it. It contains really good stuff too. I really like the character of Luna Lovegood in this one. Harry in the beginning of the story became an outsider because he was believe as a liar and insane for saying that Voldemort was alive. So I felt that Harry and Luna shared a common feeling of being alone that made them good friends easily.<br /><br />I also love the preparation in there OWLS, they were really busy studying and I felt that I can relate to them in a way because when I've read this I was in school and we were preparing for the College Entrance Examination. <br /><br />I love Dumbledore Army, really cool. Snape's worst memory, that was I don't know what i felt in that one it's a weird feeling, perhaps I can relate with the bullying that i sympathize with Snape at that time though I really hate his character. And who could have thought that Lily, Harry's mother was like Snape's only friend.<br /><br />I really really love this book and I said that because of Sirius dying in this Book. Sirius died in this book. Go buy this book and when you've read the Sirius die part you'll cry like a baby. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5721063804960316458\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return href=\"/user/show/5858699-kavita\">Kavita</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5858699-kavita?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5858699-kavita?shelf=school-stories\">school-stories</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1427283718\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9346301299754855664\">This book could certainly have done with some trimming, especially in the first half with Molly's bipolar behaviour. The Hogwarts scenes were much better, especially with Ron's character development and his lack of confidence standing out starkly (quite possibly a product of Molly's favouritism and unsupportive behaviour). Draco began to get on my nerves; he was pretty much on his way to becoming a comic villain. Who cares about docking Gryffindor points when people are dying left, right and</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9346301299754855664\" style=\"display:none\">This book could certainly have done with some trimming, especially in the first half with Molly's bipolar behaviour. The Hogwarts scenes were much better, especially with Ron's character development and his lack of confidence standing out starkly (quite possibly a product of Molly's favouritism and unsupportive behaviour). Draco began to get on my nerves; he was pretty much on his way to becoming a comic villain. Who cares about docking Gryffindor points when people are dying left, right and centre? I was pretty much cringing at Draco scenes. But that got balanced out by Luna and Neville, who really developed so well in this book that he became one of my favourite characters. <br /><br />Umbridge was fun and truly the best villain in the HP universe since we barely get to see the others and even when we do, we don't get an explanation of why they are so evil. I did feel that JKR was making fun of feminine women. There are so many underlying threads of sexism in HP ...! <br /><br />And Sirius! *sniffs* RIP! <br /><br /><br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9346301299754855664\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border id=\"reviewTextContainer427562749\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12661937297604377037\">For those of you who know me, you know that my love for the Harry Potter series is unparalleled. For those of you who donU+2019t know me, you should know that IU+2019m a touch obsessed. Not in a crazy way, I just have very firm, loyal ties to the series. While picking my favourite Harry Potter book is like SophieU+2019s Choice, I have to say that a front runner is the fifth installment, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix. This is where the action heats up. Harry, Ron, and Hermione become hormone-riddled</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12661937297604377037\" style=\"display:none\">For those of you who know me, you know that my love for the Harry Potter series is unparalleled. For those of you who donU+2019t know me, you should know that IU+2019m a touch obsessed. Not in a crazy way, I just have very firm, loyal ties to the series. While picking my favourite Harry Potter book is like SophieU+2019s Choice, I have to say that a front runner is the fifth installment, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix. This is where the action heats up. Harry, Ron, and Hermione become hormone-riddled teenagers (but thankfully, none of them are angstyU+2014I really hate that in a character) with defined opinions, Voldemort is back in power, nobody can be trusted anymore, thereU+2019s a DELICIOUSLY wicked character introduced, and danger, secrets, and fireworks are afoot. ItU+2019s a thick, fast-paced, fabulous read. Of course if you havenU+2019t read the series, youU+2019d have to start at book one. See what I did there? I pulled five recommendations into one ;) <br /><br />- Sabrina Medora, Assistant, Marketing and Publicity</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12661937297604377037\" href=\"#\"
